general.para: Personnel disassembling the engine should read the Introduction Sections of this manual to familiarize themselves with the general overhaul procedures (Ref. INTRODUCTION, How to Use this Manual).

Disassembly is divided into three sections: DISASSEMBLY-1 through DISASSEMBLY-3. Unscheduled removal of the power section from gas generator assembly is found in DISASSEMBLY-3.
ENGINE DISASSEMBLY-1: EXTERNAL COMPONENTS
ENGINE DISASSEMBLY-2: ACCESSORY COMPONENTS
ENGINE DISASSEMBLY-3: MAJOR SUBASSEMBLIES

When an engine is received for overhaul, remove air inlet screen and examine for foreign object damage (FOD) in compressor rotor assembly. Inspect for external damage, burning, corrosion, and signs of leakage. Record all observations made at this inspection to provide reference during disassembly of engine; special notice is to be made of any discrepancy which might not be apparent after cleaning. All affected parts must be tagged to identify nature of fault and, after removal from engine, be subjected to detailed inspection before cleaning.

During inspection of engine, check that all externally mounted parts and accessories are correctly fitted; loose and/or unattached components usually indicates these parts have been replaced due to a previous unserviceability. Record all discrepancies and check against data sheets received with engine for information relating to unserviceabilities encountered during service.

Overhaul facilities may find it more expedient to remove certain parts before others, so disassembly sequences given in the text need not be strictly adhered to. Instructions for removal of some standard parts, such as loop clamps and similar attaching hardware, may be repeated in areas where such parts support more than one component.

Seal all openings as soon as possible after removal of external parts and accessory units. Place each component in a separate polyethylene bag or dust-proof container, and store on suitable racks until required for overhaul. Segregate the parts during storage to prevent impact damage.
When an engine is separated at the bolting flanges, install major assemblies in appropriate stands, cover with plastic sheeting and seal to prevent ingress of moisture and foreign material.

To prevent damaging seal grooves and lands, use plastic spatulas for removing preformed packings. Damage in these areas can cause leaks due to improper seating. Discard all preformed packings, packing retainers, backup rings, tabwashers, cotterpins and gaskets immediately after removal to prevent possible reuse of these parts.

special-tools.para: The special tools listed below are used in the following procedures.

procedure.title: Draining the Engine Oil System (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Install engine in stand (PWC34300) or (PWC51140) or (PWC70907) (Ref. Storage Instructions).

Drain engine oil system. Place suitable oil container and drip pan under engine. Remove oil tank drain plug (2) pt6a38-722000-002-0410 1 from bottom of compressor inlet case. Remove
oil drain plug (3) pt6a38-726000-001-0420 1 located at 6 o'clock position on rear face of accessory gearbox. Remove magnetic chip detector (1) pt6a38-721000-007-0010 1 from bottom of propeller reduction gearbox. Remove oil tank drain plug (4) pt6a38-731001-002-0040 1 from oil-to-fuel heater. Drain residual oil from engine and oil-to-fuel heater; reinstall drain plugs and chip detector.

figure.title: Location of Oil Drain Plugs and Chip Detector

procedure.title: Remove One-piece Rear Tube Installation (3099) (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Remove one-piece rear tube installation (3099) as follows: DO NOT BEND OR FORCE TUBE OUT OF POSITION DURING ASSEMBLY OR DISASSEMBLY OF PRESSURE OIL TRANSFER TUBES. WHEN REMOVING ANY SINGLE TUBE, THE ADJACENT TUBE, COUPLING, ELBOW OR FILTER BODY, TOGETHER WITH SEAL RETAINING PLATES, MUST BE REMOVED.Remove two bolts pt6a38-792001-001-0350 2 and washers pt6a38-792001-001-0360 2 securing front pressure oil elbow (27) to reduction gearbox front housing. Remove two self-locking nuts pt6a38-792001-001-0060 2 , washers pt6a38-792001-001-0050 2 and D-head bolts pt6a38-792001-001-0040 2 securing external coupling (24) to flange C. Withdraw
front pressure oil elbow (27) pt6a38-792001-001-0340 1 from boss on reduction gearbox, and remove elbow from front transfer tube (26). Remove preformed packings (28) pt6a38-792001-001-0370 1 from elbow. Remove and separate front transfer tube (26) pt6a38-792001-001-0010 1 and external coupling (24) pt6a38-792001-001-0030 1 . Remove
preformed packings (25) pt6a38-792001-001-0020 2 from tube. Remove bolts pt6a38-792001-001-0120 2 and
self-locking nuts pt6a38-792001-001-0130 2 securing seal retaining plates (21) pt6a38-792001-001-0090 2 , retaining plate heat shields (22) pt6a38-792001-001-0100 2 and seals (23) pt6a38-792001-001-0110 2 to center fireseal mount ring. Remove center transfer tube (20) pt6a38-792001-001-0070 1 from rear tube assembly (12). Remove preformed packings (19) pt6a38-792001-001-0080 2 from tube. Remove bolts pt6a38-792001-001-0270 3 , and self-locking nuts pt6a38-792001-001-0280 3 securing seal retaining plates (9) pt6a38-792001-001-0230 2 , retaining plate heat shields (10) pt6a38-792001-001-0260 2 and seals (11) pt6a38-792001-001-0240 pt6a38-792001-001-0250 1, 1 to rear fireseal mount ring. Sealing parts of fireseal at this location are shared jointly with long adapter on P3 air filter body housing (2). Remove two bolts pt6a38-792001-001-0170 2 that attach No. 2 bearing supply flange (14) of rear transfer tube assembly (12) to gas generator case. For PT6A-38/-41/-42 Engines and 3426 (PT6A-42A) Engines: Removal of bolts will release fuel delivery tube loop clamp (innermost) and ignition cable support bracket (18) (outermost). The ignition cable support bracket (18) (outermost) is omitted on 3426 Engines. Remove bolt pt6a38-742000-001-0020 1 and self-locking nut pt6a38-742000-001-0040 1 securing ignition cable support loop clamp to oil tube loop clamp (13) positioned adjacent to forward edge of air inlet screen. On PT6A-38 engines and PT6A-41 (3012) engines, remove bolts (5) and washers (3) securing elbow (6) to compressor inlet case. Withdraw elbow (6) from boss on compressor inlet case and from tube assembly (12). Remove preformed packing (1). On PT6A-41 (3012) engines, disconnect compressor delivery pneumatic (P3) supply tubes at front and rear of P3 air filter body housing (2). Cap exposed tube ends. Remove one
long pt6a38-731007-001-0136 1 and one short bolt (4) pt6a38-731007-001-0135 1 and two washer (3) pt6a38-731007-001-0134 2 securing P3 air filter body housing (2) to compressor inlet case. Remove filter body housing pt6a38-731007-001-0133 1 from inlet case boss, and withdraw housing from rear tube assembly (12). Remove preformed packing (1) pt6a38-731007-001-0215 1 from housing. Overhaul compressor air filter (Ref. 73-10-07). Separate No 2. bearing supply flange (14) from boss on gas generator case, and remove rear tube assembly (12) pt6a38-792001-001-0160 1 from center and rear fireseal mount rings. Remove
gasket (16) pt6a38-792001-001-0210 1 , alignment spacers (17) pt6a38-792001-001-0200 AR (if installed) and preformed packing (15) pt6a38-792001-001-0220 1 from No. 2 bearing supply flange (14). Record number of alignment spacers (17). Remove all seal retaining plates, retaining plate heat shields and seals from rear tube assembly (12). Remove preformed packing (7) pt6a38-792001-001-0150 1 and packing retainer (8) from rear end of rear tube assembly. Overhaul parts (Ref. 79-20-01).

figure.title: Removal of Pressure Oil Transfer Tubes - One-piece Rear Tube Installation

key.def: Ignition Cable Support Bracket (PT6A-38/-41/-42 Engines and 3426 (PT6A-42A) Engines)

procedure.title: Removal of Two-piece Rear Tube Installation (3099/3123) (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Remove two-piece rear tube installation (3099/3123) as follows: DO NOT BEND OR FORCE TUBE OUT OF POSITION DURING DISASSEMBLY OF PRESSURE OIL TRANSFER TUBES. WHEN REMOVING ANY SINGLE TUBE, THE ADJACENT TUBE, COUPLING, ELBOW OR FILTER BODY, TOGETHER WITH SEAL RETAINING PLATES MUST BE REMOVED.Remove two bolts pt6a38-792001-001-0350 2 and washers pt6a38-792001-001-0360 2 securing front pressure oil elbow (27) to reduction gearbox front housing. Remove two self-locking nuts pt6a38-792001-001-0060 2 , washers pt6a38-792001-001-0050 2 and D-head bolts pt6a38-792001-001-0040 2 securing external coupling (30) to flange C. Withdraw
front pressure oil elbow (27) pt6a38-792001-001-0340 1 from boss on reduction gearbox, and separate elbow from front transfer tube (29). Remove preformed packing (26) pt6a38-792001-001-0370 1 from elbow. Remove and separate front transfer tube (29) pt6a38-792001-001-0010 1 and external coupling (30) pt6a38-792001-001-0030 1 . Remove
preformed packings (28) pt6a38-792001-001-0020 2 from tube. Remove bolts pt6a38-792001-001-0120 2 and
self-locking nuts pt6a38-792001-001-0130 2 securing seal retaining plates (21) pt6a38-792001-001-0090 2 , retaining plate heat shields (22) pt6a38-792001-001-0100 2 and seals (23) pt6a38-792001-001-0110 2 to center fireseal mount ring. Withdraw center transfer tube (25) pt6a38-792001-001-0070 1 from tube assembly (14) and remove preformed packings (24) pt6a38-792001-001-0070 2 from tube ends. Remove bolts pt6a38-792001-001-0270 3 and self-locking nuts pt6a38-792001-001-0280 3 securing seal retaining plate (7), seals (8), retaining plate heat shields (9) and bracket (13) to rear fireseal mount ring. Sealing parts of fireseal at this location are shared jointly with long adapter on P3 air filter body housing. Remove nut pt6a38-792001-001-00280 1 and bolt pt6a38-792001-001-0284 1 securing bracket (13) pt6a38-792001-001-0285 1 and clamp (12) to tube assembly (14). Remove two bolts pt6a38-792001-001-0170 2 that attach No. 2 bearing supply flange (16) of rear transfer tube assembly (12) to gas generator case. For PT6A-38/-41/-42 Engines and 3426 (PT6A-42A) Engines: Removal of bolts will release fuel delivery tube loop clamp (innermost) and ignition cable support bracket (20) (outermost). The ignition cable support bracket (20) (outermost) is omitted on 3426 Engines. Remove bolt pt6a38-742000-001-0020 1 and self-locking nut pt6a38-742000-001-0040 1 securing ignition cable support loop clamp to oil tube loop clamp (15) positioned adjacent to forward edge of air inlet screen. On PT6A-41 engines, disconnect compressor delivery pneumatic (P3) supply tubes at front and rear of P3 air filter body housing (2). Cap exposed tube ends. Remove one long pt6a38-731007-001-0136 1 and one short bolt (4) pt6a38-731007-001-0135 1 and two washers (3) pt6a38-731007-001-0134 2 securing P3 air filter body housing (2) to compressor inlet case. Remove filter body housing (2) pt6a38-731007-001-0133 1 from inlet case boss, then withdraw from short transfer tube (11). Remove and discard preformed packing (1) pt6a38-731007-001-0215 1 . Overhaul P3 air filter assembly (Ref. 73-10-07). On PT6A-38 engines, remove bolts (5) and washers (3) securing elbow (6) to compressor inlet case. Withdraw elbow (6) from boss on compressor inlet case and from short transfer tube (11). Remove seal retaining plate (7) pt6a38-792001-001-0230 2 , retaining plate heat shield (9) pt6a38-792001-001-0240 pt6a38-792001-001-0250 1, 1 and seal (8) pt6a38-792001-001-0260 2 from rear fireseal. Withdraw short transfer tube (11) pt6a38-792001-001-0286 1 from tube (14). Remove and discard preformed packings (10) pt6a38-792001-001-0150 pt6a38-792001-001-0153 1, 1 . Separate No. 2 bearing supply flange (16) from boss on gas generator case, and remove
tube assembly (14) pt6a38-792001-001-0160 1 from center and rear fireseal mount rings. Remove gasket (18) pt6a38-792001-001-0210 1 , alignment spacers (19) pt6a38-792001-001-0200 AR if installed, and preformed packing (17) pt6a38-792001-001-0220 1 from No. 2 bearing supply flange (16). Record number of alignment spacers (19) (if installed). Remove remaining seal retaining plates, retaining plate heat shields and seals from transfer tube (14). Overhaul parts (Ref. 79-20-01).

figure.title: Removal of Pressure Oil Transfer Tubes - Two-Piece Rear Tube Installation

key.def: Ignition Cable Support Bracket (PT6A-38/-41/-42 Engines and 3426 (PT6A-42A) Engines)
Pressure Oil Tube Seal Retaining Plate (3123)

procedure.title: Removal of Two-piece Rear Tube Installation (3123) (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Remove two-piece rear tube installation (3123) as follows: Refer to preceding sub-para. and disassemble using steps through . Remove self-locking nuts pt6a38-792001-001-0280 5 , bolts pt6a38-792001-001-0270 pt6a38-792001-001-0275 3, 2 and washers pt6a38-792001-001-0287 5 securing tube seal retaining plate (36) pt6a38-792001-001-0250 1 , tube seal (35) pt6a38-792001-001-0255 1 , seal retaining plate (34) pt6a38-792001-001-0256 1 , tube seal (33), two retaining plate heat shields (32) and tube retaining plate (31) to rear fireseal mount ring. Continue disassembly using steps through and through of sub-para. , then continue with following. Remove
tube retaining plate (31) pt6a38-792001-001-0230 1 , two retaining plate heat shields (32) pt6a38-792001-001-0240 2 and tube seal (33) pt6a38-792001-001-0260 1 from rear fireseal. Overhaul parts removed (Ref. 79-20-01).

procedure.title: No. 2 Bearing Scavenge Oil Tube (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Remove two bolts (15) pt6a38-792001-002-0020 2 and washers (16) pt6a38-792001-002-0030 1 that attach front flange (10) of No. 2 bearing scavenge tube (9) to gas generator case. For PT6A-38/-41/-42 Engines and 3426 (PT6A-42A) Engines: Removal of right-hand bolt (15) releases fuel and air line support bracket (13). Move cable and bracket clear of flange. The fuel and air line support bracket (13) is omitted on 3426 Engines.

For PT6A-38/-41 and 3370 engines only, remove self-locking nut pt6a38-742000-001-0040 1 and
bolt pt6a38-742000-001-0020 1 that attach clamp (1) on scavenge tube to ignition cable loop clamp adjacent to forward edge of air inlet screen.

Remove four bolts pt6a38-792001-002-0130 4 and self-locking nuts pt6a38-792001-002-0140 4 that attach
seal retaining plates (2) pt6a38-792001-002-0090 2 , seal retaining plate assemblies (3) pt6a38-792001-002-0110 1 and (5) pt6a38-792001-002-0100 1 and seals (4) pt6a38-792001-002-0120 2 . Remove plates, plate assemblies and seals from tube.
Remove two bolts (15) pt6a38-792001-002-0020 2 that attach rear flange (8) of No. 2 bearing scavenge tube (9) and rear fireseal support bracket (6) to compressor inlet case.

Remove two bolts pt6a38-742000-001-0020 2 and self-locking nuts pt6a38-742000-001-0040 2 that attach
rear fireseal support bracket (6) pt6a38-792001-002-0050 1 to rear fireseal. Remove bracket.
Remove scavenge tube pt6a38-792001-002-0010 1 from bosses on gas generator and compressor inlet cases and remove tube rearward through hole in rear fireseal.
Remove preformed packings (7) pt6a38-792001-002-0080 1 and (12) pt6a38-792001-002-0070 1 from flanges on scavenge tube. Remove gasket (11) pt6a38-792001-002-0060 1 from front flange (10).
Overhaul removed parts (Ref. 79-20-02).

figure.title: Removal of No. 2 Bearing Scavenge Oil Tube

key.def: Fuel and Air Line Support Bracket (PT6A-38/-41/-42 Engines and 3426 (PT6A-42A) Engines)

procedure.title: Removal of Dual Scavenge Oil Tubes (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Remove bolts (1) pt6a38-792001-003-0190 pt6a38-792001-003-0200 1, 1 and washers pt6a38-792001-003-0210 2 securing front scavenge oil transfer elbow (2) to propeller reduction gearbox front case.

Remove self-locking nuts pt6a38-792001-003-0060 3 , washers pt6a38-792001-003-0050 3 , and bolts (3) pt6a38-792001-003-0040 3 , securing scavenge oil transfer coupling (4) to flange C. Bolts (3) (3013) are interchangeable with bolts (3013) which provide improved anti-corrosion qualities.
Remove self-locking nuts pt6a38-792001-003-0120 3 and bolts (5) pt6a38-792001-003-0110 3 securing seal retaining plates (6) and seals (7) to each side of center fireseal.
Remove self-locking nuts pt6a38-792001-003-0160 3 and bolts (8) pt6a38-792001-003-0150 3 securing seal retaining plates (9) and seals (10) to each side of rear fireseal.

Withdraw elbow (2) pt6a38-792001-003-0180 1 from short transfer tube (11) and from two front transfer tubes (12). Remove preformed packing (13) pt6a38-792001-003-0230 1 and sleeve seal (14) pt6a38-792001-003-0220 1 from elbow.
Withdraw short transfer tube (11) pt6a38-792001-003-0240 1 from reduction gearbox and remove preformed packings (15) pt6a38-792001-003-0250 2 from tube.

Withdraw two front transfer tubes (12) pt6a38-792001-003-0010 2 from scavenge oil transfer coupling (4) and remove
preformed packings (16) pt6a38-792001-003-0020 4 from each tube.
Remove scavenge oil transfer coupling (4) pt6a38-792001-003-0030 1 from two rear transfer tubes (17).

Withdraw two rear transfer tubes (17) pt6a38-792001-003-0070 2 from ports in external scavenge oil pump and remove tubes through rear and center fireseals. As tubes are pulled through fireseals, remove seal retaining plates (6) pt6a38-792001-003-0090 2 and (9) pt6a38-792001-003-0130 2 and seals
(7) pt6a38-792001-003-0100 2 and (10) pt6a38-792001-003-0140 2 .
Remove preformed packings (18) pt6a38-792001-003-0080 4 from each end of two rear transfer tubes (17).
Overhaul removed parts (Ref. 79-20-03).

procedure.title: Removal of Electrical Connector from Heated Pneumatic Lines (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.note: On 3012 and PT6A-42/-42A engines, the electrical connector receptacle will remain connected to the Py pneumatic line and is removed only when repair or replacement of parts is necessary.
procedure.step: Remove self-locking nuts pt6a38-731007-002-0080 4 , washers pt6a38-731007-002-0070 4 , and screws (1) pt6a38-731007-002-0060 4 , securing electrical connector (3) pt6a38-731007-002-0050 1 to bracket (2) and withdraw connector from bracket.
Remove clamp screws (10) and separate half-clamps from bell end fitting (9).

Unscrew bell end fitting (9) from flange mounted connector shell (6) and slide fitting and cable sleeve (13) down electrical wires. Do not allow wires to twist while unscrewing bell end fitting and ensure that braiding is not pulled back on wires.
Slide nylon sleeve (8) and rubber insulator (7) back over wires to expose soldered connections between wires and pins (14).
Using a suitable soldering iron, unsolder wires from pins (14).
Carefully pull wires through rubber insulator (7) and nylon sleeve (8).
Remove bell end fitting (9) and cable sleeve (13) from electrical cables for pneumatic lines (Py) (4) and (P3) (5, PT6A-38 and 3012).
Reassemble components of connector (3) to avoid loss of parts.
Overhaul removed parts (Ref. Chap. 73-10-07).

figure.title: Electrical Connector for Heated Pneumatic Lines

key.def: Electrical Cable - HeatedPneumatic Tube - PowerTurbine Control (Py) Line
Electrical Cable - HeatedPneumatic Tube - CompressorDischarge (P3) Line(PT6A-38 and 3012)

procedure.title: Removal of Compressor Discharge Pneumatic Line (Front Tube Assembly) (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Disconnect coupling nut (1) of front tube assembly (12) at compressor air filter (13) (3012 and PT6A-42/-42A) or at adapter assembly (18) (PT6A-38 and 3012).
Remove two bolts (11) pt6a38-731007-001-0020 pt6a38-731007-002-0020 2 securing tube flange to gas generator case.
Remove self-locking nut (7) pt6a38-731007-001-0290 pt6a38-731007-002-0290 1 and bolt (4) pt6a38-731007-001-0280 pt6a38-731007-002-0280 1 securing loop clamp (6) to support bracket (9) (3059).
Remove two self-locking nuts (8) pt6a38-722000-002-0440 2 and remove support bracket (9) pt6a38-731007-001-0260 pt6a38-731007-002-0260 1 from compressor inlet case flange.
Overhaul removed components (Ref. 73-10-07).

figure.title: Removal/Installation of Compressor Discharge Pneumatic Line

key.def: Compressor Air Filter Housing (3012 and PT6A-42/-42A)

procedure.title: Removal of Compressor Discharge Pneumatic Line (Rear Tube Assembly (Unheated): (3012 and PT6A-42/-42A)) (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Disconnect coupling nut (1) of rear tube assembly (2) at fuel control unit.
Remove self-locking nut (7) pt6a38-731007-001-0290 1 and bolt (4) pt6a38-731007-001-0280 1 securing loop clamp (6) to angle bracket (5) (3059).
Remove rear tube assembly pt6a38-731007-001-0040 1 from engine.
Remove fuel pump retaining nut (3) pt6a38-731002-001-0020 1 and remove angle bracket (5) pt6a38-731007-001-0300 1 . Reinstall nut (3) on fuel pump mounting stud.
Overhaul removed components (Ref. Chap. 73-10-07).

procedure.title: Removal of Compressor Discharge Pneumatic Line (Rear Tube Assembly (Heated) (PT6A-38 and 3012) ) (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Remove two self-locking nuts (15) pt6a38-731007-002-0230 pt6a38-726000-001-0010 1, 1 and release loop clamps (16) securing heater cable (17) to studs on flange G.
Disconnect coupling nuts (1) at fuel control unit and at adapter assembly (18).
Remove self-locking nut (7) pt6a38-731007-002-0290 1 and bolt (4) pt6a38-731007-002-0280 1 securing loop clamp (6) to angle bracket (5) (3059).
Remove rear tube assembly (14) pt6a38-731007-002-0040 1 and cable (17) pt6a38-731007-002-0050 1 from engine.
Remove fuel pump retaining nut (3) pt6a38-731002-001-0020 1 and remove angle bracket (5) pt6a38-731007-002-0300 1 . Reinstall nut (3) on fuel pump mounting stud.
Overhaul removed components (Ref. Chap. 73-10-07).

procedure.title: Removal of Adapter Assembly (PT6A-38 and 3012) (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Remove two self-locking nuts (22) pt6a38-731007-002-0100 2 and plate (21) pt6a38-731007-002-0130 1 .
Withdraw adapter assembly (18) pt6a38-731007-002-0090 1 , insulation (19) pt6a38-731007-002-0140 1 and seal (20) pt6a38-731007-002-0150 1 from rear fireseal.
Overhaul removed components (Ref. Chap. 73-10-07).

procedure.title: Removal of Propeller Governor Pneumatic Line (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Remove bolts (19)
and (21) pt6a38-731008-002-0090 pt6a38-731008-001-0080 1 securing loop clamps (18) and (20) to respective brackets (17) and (23).
Disconnect coupling nuts of heated tube assembly (1, Fig. ) from elbow on fuel control unit and from tube coupling (26) at center fireseal mount ring.

Remove self-locking nuts pt6a38-731008-002-0060 pt6a38-731008-001-0050 2 and bolts (31) pt6a38-731008-002-0070 pt6a38-731008-001-0060 2 securing seal retaining plates (32), insulation (33), seals (34) and joggled
seal retaining plate (35) pt6a38-731008-002-0050 pt6a38-731008-001-0045 1 to rear fireseal mount ring.

Withdraw heated tube assembly (1) pt6a38-731008-002-0010 pt6a38-731008-001-0010 1 from hole or slot in rear fireseal and, as tube is withdrawn, remove plates pt6a38-731008-002-0020 pt6a38-731008-001-0020 2 , insulations pt6a38-731008-002-0030 pt6a38-731008-001-0030 2 and seals pt6a38-731008-002-0040 pt6a38-731008-001-0040 2 .

On PT6A-41 engines incorporating torque limiter, disconnect coupling nuts of pneumatic tube (3) from tee fitting in front tube (2)
or (4) , as applicable, and from torque limiter. Remove tube pt6a38-731008-001-0200 1 .

Remove front pneumatic tube(s) as follows: On applicable engines (alternative front tube configuration, Ref. Fig. ), remove self-locking nut pt6a38-731008-002-0170 pt6a38-731008-001-0170 1 and bolt (28) pt6a38-731008-002-0160 pt6a38-731008-001-0160 1 securing loop clamp (29) to loop clamp on propeller reversing linkage casing, and remove spacer (30) pt6a38-731008-002-0180 pt6a38-731008-001-0180 1 located between clamps. 3049: Remove bolt (24) and self-locking nut to release loop clamp (25) from swivel-joint retaining plate attached to engine lifting bracket at flange A. On applicable engines (standard tube configuration, Ref. Fig. ), remove self-locking nut pt6a38-731008-001-0103 1 and bolt (14) pt6a38-731008-001-0102 1 securing loop clamp (15) to bracket (16) at flange A; also self-locking nut pt6a38-731008-001-0170 1 and bolt (13) pt6a38-731008-001-0150 1 securing loop clamp (11) to bracket (12) at flange C. Remove brackets
(16) pt6a38-731008-001-0104 1 and
(12) pt6a38-731008-001-035 1 from respective flanges and reinstall flange bolts and nuts. 3112: Remove bolt (7) securing loop clamp (9) to bracket (8) on flange C. Remove bracket (8) and reinstall flange bolt and nut. Disconnect coupling nuts of front tube (2) pt6a38-731008-002-0010 1 , or tubes (4)
and
(5) as applicable, from tube coupling (26) at center fireseal mount ring and from propeller governor. Remove front tube(s). 3112: The check valve incorporated in the front pneumatic tube assembly (tubes (4) and (5)) is removed during overhaul of pneumatic tubes (Ref. 73-10-08).
Remove jam nut (27) pt6a38-731008-002-0130 pt6a38-731008-001-0120 1 and remove tube coupling (26) pt6a38-731008-002-0140 pt6a38-731008-001-0130 1 from center fireseal.
Overhaul removed parts (Ref. 73-10-08).

key.def: Torque Limiter Pneumatic Tube (engines incorporating torque limiter)
Cap, Tee-Connector (engines not incorporating torque limiter)
Bracket (Attaches to control lever mounting bracket of rear linkage and cover on AGB)

procedure.title: Removal of Fuel Delivery Tubes and Flexible Hose (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Disconnect coupling nuts of flexible hose (1) pt6a38-731003-001-0010 1 from fuel control unit and fuel pump fittings, and remove hose.

On engines incorporating fuel pressure primary tube assembly (5); disconnect tube assembly (5) coupling nuts from FCU elbow fitting and from bulkhead coupling (4) on fuel pressure tube assembly (2). Remove tube assembly (5) pt6a38-731003-001-0020 1 .

On engines that make provision for a fuel flowmeter by incorporating a 3-piece tube assembly (7, 8 and 9) in place of the single tube assembly (5); disconnect tube assembly (7, 8 and 9) coupling nuts from FCU straight nipple and from bulkhead coupling (4) on fuel pressure tube assembly (2). Remove tube assembly (7) pt6a38-731003-001-0024 1 , (8) pt6a38-731003-001-0023 1 and (9) pt6a38-731003-001-0022 1 and loop clamp (6) pt6a38-731003-001-0025 1 .
Remove nut (10) pt6a38-731003-001-0030 1 from bulkhead coupling (4) on fuel pressure tube assembly (2) at rear fireseal.
Remove self-locking nut (20) pt6a38-731003-001-0060 1 and bolt (12) pt6a38-731003-001-0050 1 securing loop clamp (11) to loop clamp on ignition cable (3).
Remove bolt (18) pt6a38-792001-001-0170 1 securing loop clamp (19) to No. 2 bearing flange on pressure oil transfer tube and reinstall bolt in flange to prevent loss of part.
Remove self-locking nuts (17) pt6a38-731003-001-0110 2 and bolts (13) pt6a38-731003-001-0100 2 securing seal retaining plates (16), insulation (15), and seals (14) at each side of center fireseal.
Disconnect coupling nut of fuel pressure tube assembly (2) from flow divider and dump valve or flow divider and purge valve.

Withdraw fuel pressure tube assembly (2) pt6a38-731003-001-0120 1 through center fireseal and remove retaining plates (16) pt6a38-731003-001-0070 2 , insulation (15) pt6a38-731003-001-0090 2 , and seals (14) pt6a38-731003-001-0080 2 as tube is withdrawn.
Overhaul removed parts (Ref. 73-10-03).

figure.title: Fuel Delivery Tubes and Flexible Hose

key.def: Fuel Pressure Primary Tube Assembly (Center) (3143)Fuel Pressure Primary Tube Assembly (Center) (3143)
Basic on engines without fuel flowmeter provisionPT6A-38, A-41 and A-42 (3288)
Optional part for use on engines with fuel flowmeter provisionPT6A-41, A-42 (3288) and A-42ABasic feature of PT6A-41 engines fitted to Piper installation.

procedure.title: Removal of Ignition Cable (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Isolate power from ignition system.
Remove left and right ignition cables (1 and 2) from respective spark igniters (3 and 4).

For PT6A-38/-41 and 3370 engines only: Removal of ignition cables (3027) can be facilitated by first taking off the thermostatic bypass and check valve (Ref. Disassembly-2).
WHEN UNSCREWING COUPLING NUTS, DO NOT ALLOW BRAIDING, FERRULES OR IGNITER TO TURN AT SAME TIME.
Self-locking nut pt6a38-742000-001-0040 1 and
bolt pt6a38-742000-001-0020 1 securing loop clamps (29) pt6a38-742000-001-0050 1 and
(30) pt6a38-742000-001-0050 1 to loop clamp (31) on number 2 bearing scavenge oil tube (14) have been removed (Ref. Para. preceding). Remove loop clamps from cables. (Ref. Detail E).
Self-locking nuts pt6a38-742000-001-0040 4 and
bolts pt6a38-742000-001-0020 4 securing cable flanges (27) and fireseal support bracket (28) to rear fireseal were removed when separating No. 2 bearing scavenge tube from engine (Ref. Para. , preceding). Remove self-locking nut pt6a38-742000-001-0040 1 and bolt pt6a38-742000-001-0020 1 securing loop clamp (22) pt6a38-742000-001-0050 1 to loop clamp (23) on number 2 bearing scavenge oil tube. Remove loop clamp (22). (Ref. Detail D.) Remove self-locking nut pt6a38-742000-001-0040 1 , washer pt6a38-742000-001-0060 1 and bolt pt6a38-742000-001-0030 1 securing loop clamp (16) pt6a38-742000-001-0050 1 to bracket (15) on number 2 bearing scavenge tube (14). Remove loop clamp as required. (Ref. Detail C.) Remove
self-locking nuts pt6a38-742000-001-0040 2 and
bolts pt6a38-742000-001-0020 2 securing loop clamps (9) pt6a38-742000-001-0050 1 and (7) pt6a38-742000-001-0050 1 to brackets (10 and 6) at center fireseal. Remove loop clamps. (Ref. Details A and B.) Remove self-locking nuts pt6a38-742000-001-0040 2 and bolts pt6a38-742000-001-0020 2 securing cable flange (8) and bracket (10) pt6a38-742000-001-0070 1 to center fireseal. (Ref. Detail B.) Remove front and rear sections of ignition cable (1) pt6a38-742000-001-0010 1 through respective fireseals and remove cable. Remove
self-locking nut pt6a38-742000-001-0040 1 and
bolt pt6a38-742000-001-0020 1 securing
loop clamp (18) pt6a38-742000-001-0050 1 to loop clamp (17) on fuel delivery tube (5). Remove loop clamp (18). (Ref. Detail I.) Remove self-locking nuts pt6a38-742000-001-0040 2 and bolts pt6a38-742000-001-0020 2 securing cable flange (11) to center fireseal. (Ref. Detail F.) Remove self-locking nut pt6a38-742000-001-0040 1 and bolt pt6a38-742000-001-0020 1 securing loop clamp (12) pt6a38-742000-001-0050 1 to bracket (13) at center fireseal. Remove loop clamp. (Ref. Detail F.) Remove front and rear sections of ignition cable (2) pt6a38-742000-001-0010 1 through respective fireseals and remove cable.
Overhaul removed parts (Ref. 74-20-01).

procedure.title: Removal of Propeller Front Reversing Linkage (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Disconnect propeller reversing lever (2) from clevis (3) at front end of push-pull control terminal (4) by removing
cotterpin pt6a38-761000-003-0180 1 , castellated nut pt6a38-761000-003-0170 1 , and bolt (5) pt6a38-761000-003-0160 1 . (Ref. Detail A.)

Disconnect propeller reversing lever (2) from Beta valve plunger (6) on propeller governor (7) by removing cotterpin pt6a38-761000-003-0240 1 , washer pt6a38-761000-003-0230 1 , and
pin (8) pt6a38-761000-003-0210 1 .

Remove propeller reversing lever (2) pt6a38-761000-003-0200 1 . Tie spacer (9) pt6a38-761000-003-0190 1 and bushing (10) pt6a38-761000-003-0220 1 and attach to lever, at original locations, to prevent mixing or loss of these parts.

Disconnect propeller governor interconnecting rod (12) from front push-pull control terminal (4) by removing cotterpin pt6a38-761000-003-0120 1 , castellated nut pt6a38-761000-003-0110 1 , washer pt6a38-761000-003-0100 2 , spacer (13) pt6a38-761000-003-0090 1 and bolt (14) pt6a38-761000-003-0080 1 . Tie spacer to rod end connector to prevent loss of part (Ref. View on B).

Remove propeller governor interconnecting rod (12) pt6a38-761000-003-0150 1 from reset arm (15) by removing cotterpin pt6a38-761000-003-0070 1 , castellated nut pt6a38-761000-003-0060 1 , washer pt6a38-761000-003-0050 1 , and bolt (16) pt6a38-761000-003-0040 1 , (Ref. Detail A.)

Remove two self-locking nuts pt6a38-721000-002-0020 2 and washers pt6a38-721000-002-0030 2 securing
guide pin bracket (11) pt6a38-761000-003-0250 1 to reduction gearbox thrust bearing cover. Remove bracket
, then temporarily reinstall nuts and washers.
Overhaul removed parts (Ref. 76-10-01).

key.def: Guide Pin Bracket and Carbon Slipper Block (propeller supply item)

procedure.title: Removal of Propeller Reversing Push-pull Casing Assembly (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Disconnect clevis (17) pt6a38-761000-002-0010 1 on rear push-pull terminal (18) from propeller control cam (19) by removing cotterpin pt6a38-761000-001-0210 1 , washer pt6a38-761000-001-0200 1 and pin (20) pt6a38-761000-001-0190 1 . (Ref. View on E).
Loosen locknut pt6a38-761000-002-0020 1 and remove clevis (3) pt6a38-761000-002-0010 pt6a38-761000-002-0015 1, 1 from front push-pull control terminal (4). Remove nut from terminal (Ref. View on B).
Remove push-pull control terminal (4) pt6a38-761000-002-0100 1 from front push-pull terminal (21).
Slide front push-pull terminal (21) back over swivel joint casing (22) and unscrew ball end (23) pt6a38-761000-002-0040 1 from wire rope (24).
Remove front push-pull terminal (21) pt6a38-761000-002-0070 1 from swivel joint casing (22).

Withdraw wire rope (24) pt6a38-761000-002-0120 1 from flexible shaft casing (25) by pulling on rear push-pull terminal (18). Do not remove rear push-pull terminal and associated parts assembled on wire rope.
Remove nut and bolt (26) to release clamps located on flexible shaft casing (25) and thermocouple trim resistor (27).

Remove nuts pt6a38-761000-001-0370 2 , bolts (28) pt6a38-761000-001-0360 2 , release angle bracket (29) pt6a38-761000-001-0350 1 , and separate retaining plates (30), insulation (31) pt6a38-761000-001-0330 2 , and seals (32) pt6a38-761000-001-0340 2 , from each side of center fireseal. Insulations and seals are slit on one side to permit removal from flexible shaft casing (25), (Ref. Detail D).

Release flexible shaft casing (25) pt6a38-761000-002-0110 1 from front and rear swivel joint casings (22) and (33) by unscrewing coupling nuts (34), and withdraw casing through center fireseal. As casing is withdrawn, remove retaining plates (30) pt6a38-761000-001-0320 2 located at each side of fireseal.

Remove nut (35) pt6a38-761000-002-0090 1 and withdraw swivel joint casing (22) pt6a38-761000-002-0080 1 from engine lifting bracket (36) at flange A. If necessary, loosen nuts and bolts (37) securing swivel plate (38) to engine lifting plate to release swivel joint casing.
Remove nut (39) pt6a38-761000-002-0090 1 and withdraw rear swivel joint casing (33) pt6a38-761000-002-0060 1 from bracket (40) and rear fireseal. Do not remove second nut from casing.
Remove two self-locking nuts pt6a38-761000-003-0030 2 and bolts (37) pt6a38-761000-003-0020 2 and remove swivel-joint retaining plate (38) pt6a38-761000-003-0010 1 from engine lifting bracket (36).
Overhaul removed parts (Ref. 76-10-01).

procedure.title: Removal of Rear Linkage (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: For 3432 Engines: Remove cotterpins pt6a38-761000-001-0280 2 , castellated nuts pt6a38-761000-001-0270 2 , washers pt6a38-761000-001-0260 2 and bolts (41) pt6a38-761000-001-0250 2 and remove control rod (42) pt6a38-761000-001-0310 1 from fuel control unit arm (43) and fuel control actuating lever (44).

For 3432 Engines: Remove cotterpins pt6a38-761000-001-0280 2 , castellated nuts pt6a38-761000-001-0270 2 and bolts (41) pt6a38-761000-001-0250 2 and remove control rod (42) pt6a38-761000-001-0310 1 from fuel control unit arm (43) and fuel control actuating lever (44).

Remove two nuts pt6a38-731007-002-0230 2 from studs at flange G and disconnect electrical connector bracket (45) from control lever mounting bracket (46) and accessory gearbox housing. Remove spacer pt6a38-731007-001-0250 1 from lower stud.
Remove nut pt6a38-761000-001-0240 1 that attaches upper lug of control lever mounting bracket (46) to stud at flange G.
Remove bolt (47) pt6a38-761000-001-0100 1 that attaches control lever mounting bracket (46) to angle bracket (48) pt6a38-761000-001-0090 1 on accessory gearbox housing.

Remove control lever mounting bracket (46) pt6a38-761000-001-0230 1 (with cam box assembly) from accessory gearbox housing. If necessary, loosen two bolts that attach angle bracket (48) on accessory gearbox housing to provide clearance to remove control lever mounting bracket (46) from studs at flange G.

Remove spring (49) pt6a38-761000-001-0150 1 from pivot posts on actuating lever (44) and control lever mounting bracket (46) by removing cotterpins pt6a38-761000-001-0170 2 and washers pt6a38-761000-001-0160 2 .

Remove cotterpin pt6a38-761000-001-0050 1 , washer pt6a38-761000-001-0040 1 and shoulder pin (50) pt6a38-761000-001-0030 1 to release reversing control follower lever (51) from propeller control cam (19).
Loosen clamping bolt and remove input lever (1) from end of grooved pin (52).

Loosen clamping bolt pt6a38-761000-001-0020 1 and remove reversing control follower lever (51) pt6a38-761000-001-0010 1 and actuating lever (53) pt6a38-761000-001-0060 1 from control lever mounting bracket (46) by removing
grooved pin (52) pt6a38-761000-001-0220 1 .

Remove cotterpin pt6a38-761000-001-0130 1 , washer pt6a38-761000-001-0120 1 and pin (54) pt6a38-761000-001-0110 1 and remove propeller control cam (19) pt6a38-761000-001-0180 1 and fuel control actuating lever (44) pt6a38-761000-001-0140 1 from control lever mounting bracket (46).
Overhaul removed parts (Ref. 76-10-01).

procedure.title: Removal of Compressor Wash Ring (if fitted)
procedure.step:
Remove compressor wash ring as follows (Ref. Fig. ): Unlock and disconnect coupling nuts of upper and lower tube assemblies (6) pt6a38-723002-001-0110 1 and (7) pt6a38-723002-001-0220 1 from bulkhead tee conection (3). Remove three bolts (4) pt6a38-723002-001-0120 3 securing upper and lower tube assemblies; collect six washers (5) pt6a38-723002-001-0130 6 . Remove
cap (9) pt6a38-723002-001-0230 1 from tee connection on lower tube assembly (7); unlock and remove plain nut (8) pt6a38-723002-001-0240 1 from tee conection. Separate upper and lower tube assemblies from fireseal. Remove cap (1) pt6a38-723002-001-0200 1 from tee connection (3) pt6a38-723002-001-0190 1 ; unlock and remove nut (2) pt6a38-723002-001-0210 1 securing tee connection to rear fireseal. Remove connection. Overhaul removed parts (Ref. 72-00-02).

general.para: Personnel disassembling the engine or modules should read the Introduction Sections of this manual to familiarize themselves with the general overhaul procedures (Ref. INTRODUCTION, How to Use this Manual).

Disassembly is divided into three sections: DISASSEMBLY-1 through DISASSEMBLY-3. Unscheduled removal of the power section from gas generator assembly is found in DISASSEMBLY-3.
ENGINE DISASSEMBLY-1: EXTERNAL COMPONENTS
ENGINE DISASSEMBLY-2: ACCESSORY COMPONENTS
ENGINE DISASSEMBLY-3: MAJOR SUBASSEMBLIES

On receipt of an engine for overhaul, remove air inlet screen and examine for foreign object damage (FOD) in compressor rotor assembly. Inspect for external damage, burning, corrosion, and signs of leakage. Record all observations made at this inspection to provide reference during disassembly of engine; special notice is to be made of any discrepancy which might not be apparent after cleaning. All affected parts must be tagged to identify nature of fault and, after removal from engine, be subjected to detailed inspection before cleaning.

During inspection of engine, check that all externally mounted parts and accessories are correctly fitted; loose and/or unattached components usually indicates these parts have been replaced due to a previous unserviceability. Record all discrepancies and check against data sheets received with engine for information relating to unserviceabilities encountered during service.

Overhaul facilities may find it more expedient to remove certain parts before others, so disassembly sequences given in the text need not be strictly adhered to. Instructions for removal of some standard parts, such as loop clamps and similar attaching hardware, may be repeated in areas where such parts support more than one component.

Seal all openings as soon as possible after removal of external parts and accessory units. Place each component in a separate polyethylene bag or dust-proof container, and store on suitable racks until required for overhaul. Segregate the parts during storage to prevent impact damage.
When an engine is separated at the bolting flanges, install major assemblies in appropriate stands, cover with plastic sheeting and seal to prevent ingress of moisture and foreign material.

To prevent damaging seal grooves and lands, use plastic spatulas for removing preformed packings. Damage in these areas can cause leaks due to improper seating. Discard all preformed packings, packing retainers, backup rings, tabwashers, cotterpins and gaskets immediately after removal to prevent possible reuse of these parts.

special-tools.para: The special tools listed below are used in the following procedures.

procedure.title: Removal of Propeller Governor (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Refer to Disassembly-1, preceding for removal of governor air pressure tube.
Using propeller governor retaining nut wrench (PWC30114-09) or, (PWC30114-16), remove self-locking nuts (4) pt6a38-612000-001-0050 4 and washers (5) pt6a38-612000-001-0060 4 .

Lift propeller governor (1) pt6a38-612000-001-0030 pt6a38-612000-001-0031 pt6a38-612000-001-0032 pt6a38-612000-001-0033 1 clear of studs on reduction gearbox and remove gasket (6) pt6a38-612000-001-0070 1 .
Overhaul removed parts (Ref. 61-20-00).

procedure.title: Removal of Torque Limiter (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.note: An optional torque limiter may not be fitted on all engines.
procedure.step: Refer to Disassembly-1, preceding for removal of air pressure tube.
Using a socket or box wrench, 1-13/16 inch across flats, remove universal retainer (8) pt6a38-731009-001-0050 1 securing torque limiter to universal adapter (5) installed in reduction gearbox.
Remove preformed packing (7) pt6a38-731009-001-0060 1 from universal retainer (8).
The angular position of torque limiter should be noted to assist during reassembly. Remove torque limiter (1) pt6a38-731009-001-0100 1 from universal adapter (5).
Remove preformed packing (6) pt6a38-731009-001-0070 1 from universal adapter (5).
Using torque limiter universal adapter socket (PWC32062) remove universal adapter (5) pt6a38-731009-001-0080 1 from boss (3) on reduction gearbox.
Remove preformed packing (4) pt6a38-731009-001-0090 1 from universal adapter (5).
Reinstall universal adapter (5) in torque limiter (1) and secure, fingertight, with universal retainer (8) to prevent mixing or loss of parts.
Overhaul removed parts (Ref. 73-10-09).

procedure.title: Removal of Thermostatic Bypass and Check Valve (3009) (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Remove drain plug pt6a38-731001-001-0040 pt6a38-731001-002-0040 1 at base of oil-to-fuel heater (11) and allow residual oil in lines to drain into suitable container.
Disconnect coupling nuts at each end of tube assembly (7) and allow residual oil in lines to drain into suitable container. Remove tube pt6a38-792003-001-0200 1 and cap all tube and fitting openings.

Remove two bolts pt6a38-792003-001-0170 2 securing short transfer tube (10) and retaining plate (6) to valve housing (5). Remove retaining plate pt6a38-792003-001-0230 1 from groove in transfer tube. If difficulty is experienced in removing plate, allow it to remain loosely in position on tube.
Disengage short transfer tube pt6a38-792003-001-0220 1 from oil-to-fuel heater (11) and move tube forward into cavity in valve housing until rear end of tube clears boss on heater.

Remove two bolts pt6a38-792003-001-0030 2 and washers (4) pt6a38-792003-001-0020 2 securing valve housing to boss on compressor inlet case (2). Withdraw valve housing pt6a38-792003-001-0010 1 from inlet case complete with short transfer tube. Remove and discard preformed packing (3) pt6a38-792003-001-0070 1 from oil outlet boss on housing.
Withdraw short transfer tube (10) from valve housing and remove two preformed packings (9) pt6a38-792003-001-0210 2 from tube.
Overhaul thermostatic bypass and check valve (Ref. 79-20-03).

procedure.title: Removal of Oil-to-Fuel Heater (3009) (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Remove drain plug (4) pt6a38-731001-001-0040 pt6a38-731001-002-0040 1 and ensure that oil-to-fuel heater (1) is completely drained. Reinstall drain plug.
Remove bolts (24) pt6a38-731001-002-0130 2 and washers (23) pt6a38-731001-002-0140 2 to release elbow (21) from boss on compressor inlet case.

For Pre-SB3395 engines remove bolts (7) pt6a38-731001-001-0070 pt6a38-731001-002-0070 2 to release lower retaining plate (6) from oil-to-fuel heater (1) and remove plate pt6a38-731001-001-0060 pt6a38-731001-002-0060 1 from fuel outlet transfer tube (8).

For Post-SB3395 engines remove bolts (7) pt6a38-731001-001-0070 pt6a38-731001-002-0070 2 to release lower retaining plate (6) from oil-to-fuel heater (1) and remove plate pt6a38-731001-001-0060 pt6a38-731001-002-0060 1 from fuel outlet transfer tube (25).

Remove bolt (16) pt6a38-731001-001-0230 pt6a38-731001-002-0230 1 and washer pt6a38-731001-001-0240 pt6a38-731001-002-0240 1 securing bracket (18) to boss on oil-to-fuel heater (1), and swivel bracket away from heater.

Support oil-to-fuel heater (1), and remove
bolts (2) pt6a38-731001-001-0020 pt6a38-731001-002-0020 2 and washers (3) pt6a38-731001-001-0030 pt6a38-731001-002-0030 2 to release mounting lugs of heater from flange G on engine.

Carefully lower oil-to-fuel heater (1) to release fuel outlet and oil inlet transfer tubes (8) or (25) and (10) from heater and elbow (21) from compressor inlet case, and remove heater pt6a38-731001-001-0010 pt6a38-731001-002-0010 1 from engine with oil outlet transfer tube (19) and elbow (21) assembled.

For Pre-SB3395 engines remove preformed packings
(9) pt6a38-731001-001-0090 pt6a38-731001-002-0090 2 and (11) pt6a38-731001-001-0110 pt6a38-731001-002-0110 2 from fuel outlet and oil inlet transfer tubes (8) and (10).

For Post-SB3395 engines remove preformed packings
(9) pt6a38-731001-001-0090 pt6a38-731001-002-0090 2 and (11) pt6a38-731001-001-0110 pt6a38-731001-002-0110 2 from oil inlet and fuel outlet transfer tubes (10) and (25).
Remove preformed packing (22) pt6a38-731001-002-0150 1 from elbow (21) and withdraw elbow pt6a38-792001-001-0290 pt6a38-731001-002-0120 1 from oil outlet transfer tube (19).
Withdraw oil outlet transfer tube (19) pt6a38-731001-002-0160 pt6a38-792003-001-0220 1 from oil-to-fuel heater (1) and remove preformed packings (20) pt6a38-731001-002-0170 2 from tube.

Remove bolts (16) pt6a38-731001-001-0230 pt6a38-731001-002-0230 3 and washers (17) pt6a38-731001-001-0240 pt6a38-731001-002-0240 3 securing bracket (18) to accessory gearbox and remove brackets (15) pt6a38-731001-001-0180 pt6a38-731001-002-0180 1 and (18) pt6a38-731001-001-0190 pt6a38-731001-002-0190 1 as an assembly with pin (12) installed.
Withdraw oil inlet transfer tube (10) pt6a38-731001-001-0100 pt6a38-731001-002-0100 1 from accessory gearbox and remove preformed packing (11) from tube.

For Pre-SB3395 engines remove bolts (7) pt6a38-731001-001-0070 pt6a38-731001-002-0070 2 to release upper retaining plate (6) from fuel pump and remove plate pt6a38-731001-001-0065 pt6a38-731001-002-0065 1 from fuel outlet transfer tube (8).
For Post-SB3395 engines remove bolts (7) pt6a38-731001-001-0070 pt6a38-731001-002-0070 2 to release fuel outlet transfer tube (25) from fuel pump.

Withdraw fuel outlet transfer tube (8) pt6a38-731001-001-0080 pt6a38-731001-002-0080 1 or (25) pt6a38-731001-001-0080 pt6a38-731001-002-0080 1 from fuel pump and remove preformed packing (9) from tube.
Overhaul removed parts (73-10-01).

procedure.title: Removal of Oil-to-Fuel Heater (3009) (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Remove drain plug (4) pt6a38-731001-001-0040 pt6a38-731001-002-0040 1 and ensure that oil-to-fuel heater (1) is completely drained. Reinstall drain plug.

For Pre-SB3395 engines remove bolts (7) pt6a38-731001-001-0070 pt6a38-731001-002-0070 2 to release lower retaining plate (6) from oil-to-fuel heater (1) and remove plate pt6a38-731001-001-0060 pt6a38-731001-002-0060 1 from fuel outlet transfer tube (8).

For Post-SB3395 engines remove bolts (7) pt6a38-731001-001-0070 pt6a38-731001-002-0070 2 to release lower retaining plate (6) from oil-to-fuel heater (1) and remove plate pt6a38-731001-001-0060 pt6a38-731001-002-0060 1 from fuel outlet transfer tube (25).

Remove bolt (16) pt6a38-731001-001-0230 pt6a38-731001-002-0230 1 and washer (17) pt6a38-731001-001-0240 pt6a38-731001-002-0240 1 securing bracket (18) to boss on oil-to-fuel heater (1), and swivel bracket away from heater.

Support oil-to-fuel heater (1), and remove
bolts (2) pt6a38-731001-001-0020 pt6a38-731001-002-0020 and washers (3) pt6a38-731001-001-0030 pt6a38-731001-002-0030 2 to release mounting lugs of heater from flange G on engine.

Carefully lower oil-to-fuel heater (1) to release fuel outlet and oil inlet transfer tubes (8) or (25) and (10) from heater, and remove heater pt6a38-731001-001-0010 pt6a38-731001-002-0010 1 from engine. Oil inlet transfer tube (10) and fuel outlet transfer tube (8) or (25) will remain attached to accessory gearbox and fuel pump respectively, when oil-to-fuel heater is removed.

For Pre-SB3395 engines remove preformed packings
(9) pt6a38-731001-001-0090 pt6a38-731001-002-0090 2 and (11) pt6a38-731001-001-0110 pt6a38-731001-002-0110 2 from fuel outlet and oil inlet transfer tubes (8) and (10).

For Post-SB3395 engines remove preformed packings
(9) pt6a38-731001-001-0090 pt6a38-731001-002-0090 2 and (11) pt6a38-731001-001-0110 pt6a38-731001-002-0110 2 from oil inlet and fuel outlet transfer tubes (10) and (25).

Remove bolts (16) pt6a38-731001-001-0230 pt6a38-731001-002-0230 3 and washers (17) pt6a38-731001-001-0240 pt6a38-731001-002-0240 3 securing bracket (15) to accessory gearbox and remove brackets (15) pt6a38-731001-001-0180 pt6a38-731001-002-0180 1 and (18) pt6a38-731001-001-0190 pt6a38-731001-002-0190 1 as an assembly with pin (12) installed.
Withdraw oil inlet transfer tube (10) pt6a38-731001-001-0100 pt6a38-731001-002-0100 1 from accessory gearbox and remove preformed packing (11) from tube.

For Pre-SB3395 engines remove bolts (7) pt6a38-731001-001-0070 pt6a38-731001-002-0070 2 to release upper retaining plate (6) from fuel pump and remove plate pt6a38-731001-001-0065 pt6a38-731001-002-0065 1 from fuel outlet transfer tube (8).
For Post-SB3395 engines remove bolts (7) pt6a38-731001-001-0070 pt6a38-731001-002-0070 2 to release fuel outlet transfer tube (25) from fuel pump.

Withdraw fuel outlet transfer tube (8) pt6a38-731001-001-0080 pt6a38-731001-002-0080 1 or (25) pt6a38-731001-001-0080 pt6a38-731001-002-0080 1 from fuel pump and remove preformed packing (9) from tube.
Overhaul oil-to-fuel heater (Ref. 72-10-00).

procedure.title: Removal of Fuel Control Unit (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Refer to Disassembly-1, for removal of fuel inlet flexible hose (3), fuel pressure line (4), compressor pressure heated tube (13), governor air pressure heated tube (14), and propeller reversing linkage control rod (2). Following removal of oil-to-fuel heater (Ref. Para. ), it maybe more convenient to remove the fuel control unit with fuel pump attached (Ref. Para. ), then separate units on the bench.
Loosen self-locking nuts (5) securing fuel control unit (1) to studs on fuel pump (7).
Support fuel control unit (1) and remove self-locking nuts (5) pt6a38-732000-001-0020 4 and washers (6) pt6a38-732000-001-0030 4 .

Remove preformed packing (9) pt6a38-732000-001-0050 1 from counterbored recess in face of fuel pump (7). Do not remove fuel control arm extension (12), fuel control arm (11), and serrated spacer (10), from fuel control unit (1) at this time.
Overhaul removed parts (Ref. 73-20-00).

procedure.title: Removal of Fuel Pump (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Refer to Paragraphs and , preceding, for removal of oil-to-fuel heater and fuel control unit (1), respectively.
Loosen self-locking nuts (3) securing fuel pump (2) to studs on accessory gearbox (6).
Support fuel pump (2), and remove self-locking nuts (3) pt6a38-731002-001-0020 3 and washers (4) pt6a38-731002-001-0030 3 .
Remove fuel pump (2) pt6a38-731002-001-0010 1 and gasket (5) pt6a38-731002-001-0110 1 from studs on accessory gearbox (6).
Overhaul removed parts (Ref. 73-10-02).

key.def: Fuel Pump to Fuel Control Unit Flexible Hose
Fuel Transfer Tube to Oil-to-Fuel Heater (Pre-SB3395)
Fuel Transfer Tube to Oil-to-Fuel Heater (Post-SB3395)

procedure.title: Removal of Oil Filter Element and Filter Housing and Check Valve Assembly (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Remove four self-locking nuts (8) pt6a38-792002-001-0020 4 and washers (9) pt6a38-792002-001-0030 4 securing oil filter cover (7) to compressor inlet case mounting flange (1).
Remove cover (7) pt6a38-792002-001-0010 1 from inlet case (1) and discard preformed packing (5) pt6a38-792002-001-0050 1 . Leave stepped spacer (6) in position.

WHEN REMOVING FILTER ELEMENT WITH PULLER DO NOT OVERTIGHTEN THE KNURLED NUT OTHERWISE DAMAGE TO THE CENTER TUBE SUPPORT COULD OCCUR.Withdraw filter element (3) from oil filter housing (12) using oil filter element puller (PWC30556): Run the knurled nut (15) to end of thread at knurled end of rod (16). Turn rod (16) into collet assembly (17) until stepped end of rod clears collet teeth. Install puller body (14) over oil filter housing (12) and seat housing in counterbore of puller body. Push rod (16) into puller body (14) until collet teeth engage behind inner bore of filter element end cover. Carefully turn rod (16) out of puller body (14) until collet teeth lock into position. Turn knurled nut (15) clockwise to withdraw filter element (3). Remove puller and filter element (3) pt6a38-792002-001-0070 1 from oil filter housing (12); remove element from puller and discard preformed packings (2) pt6a38-792002-001-0080 1 and (4) pt6a38-792002-001-0060 1 .

TO PREVENT DAMAGE TO CHECK AND BYPASS VALVE, CAUSED BY VALVE SLIDING OUT OF FILTER HOUSING (3066), HOLD HOUSING WITH OPEN END FACING UPWARD ON REMOVAL FROM INLET CASE.Withdraw oil filter housing and check valve assembly (12) from compressor inlet casing (1) with oil filter housing puller (PWC30328) or (PWC50726): Remove puller head (18) from nut (19). Spread both halves of head (18) at threaded end, insert opposite end into oil filter housing (12), then release head ensuring that it engages the internal shoulder of housing. Install nut (19) on head (18) to hold head in position. Extract oil filter housing (12) pt6a38-792002-001-0160 pt6a38-792002-001-0320 1 by repeatedly sliding weight (20) along rod (21) to strike jam nuts (22). Remove puller from oil filter housing (12); remove and discard preformed packings (10) pt6a38-792002-001-0140 1 and (13) pt6a38-792002-001-0230 pt6a38-792002-001-0330 1 . Overhaul removed parts (Ref. 79-20-02).

procedure.title: T5 Trim Thermocouple and Terminal Block (3316) (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Remove bolts (5) pt6a38-772001-003-0100 pt6a38-772001-003-0110 1, 1 (3114) or nuts (6) pt6a38-772001-003-0105 pt6a38-772001-003-0115 1, 1 (3114) and disconnect leads from terminal posts. Replace bolts or nuts after disconnection.
Remove self-locking nut and bolt securing loop clamp (2) to similar clamp on flexible shaft casing.

3039 and 3373: remove two self-locking nuts pt6a38-772001-003-0070 2 and bolts (12) pt6a38-772001-003-0060 2 , and separate
protective cover (13) pt6a38-772001-003-0050 1 and trim thermocouple from center fireseal.

30393373: remove
self-locking nuts pt6a38-772001-003-0070 2 and bolts (12) pt6a38-772001-003-0060 2 securing trim thermocouple to center fireseal.
Remove loop clamp (2) pt6a38-772001-003-0080 1 , and withdraw trim thermocouple (1) pt6a38-772001-003-0010 1 through fireseal.

Remove two bolts (7) pt6a38-772001-003-0130 2 and separate T5 thermocouple terminal block (8) pt6a38-772001-003-0120 1 and gasket (9) pt6a38-772001-003-0140 1 from gas generator case mounting boss (10).
Overhaul removed parts (Ref. 77-20-01).

procedure.title: T5 Trim Thermocouple and Terminal Block 3316 (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Remove nuts (15) pt6a38-772001-003-0105 1 and (16) pt6a38-772001-003-0115 1 and disconnect leads from terminal posts. Replace nuts after disconnection.
Remove self-locking nut and bolt securing loop clamp (2) to similar clamp on flexible shaft casing.

3039 and 3373: remove two self-locking nuts pt6a38-772001-003-0070 2 and bolts (12) pt6a38-772001-003-0060 2 , and separate
protective cover (13) pt6a38-772001-003-0050 1 and trim thermocouple from center fireseal.

30393373: remove
self-locking nuts pt6a38-772001-003-0070 2 and bolts (12) pt6a38-772001-003-0060 2 securing trim thermocouple to center fireseal.
Remove loop clamp (2) pt6a38-772001-003-0080 1 , and withdraw trim thermocouple (1) pt6a38-772001-003-0010 1 through fireseal.

Remove two bolts (22) and nuts (17) from the
harness terminal (18) pt6a38-772001-003-0160 1 and separate from flange C.
Overhaul removed parts (Ref. 77-20-01).
