It is recommended that retaining plate (3158) be replaced with a thicker plate (3158) to improve the oil seal between valve cover and housing, and to ensure adequate clearance when a fuel pressure tube is installed on engines providing for a fuel flow meter. The thicker plate necessitates replacement of bolts (3158) with longer bolts (3158). Install tube assembly (7) pt6a38-792003-001-0200 1 between bypass port on valve housing and scavenge line adapter at rear of engine. Tighten coupling nuts, torque 450 to 500 lb.in., and lockwire (PWC05-089). Check for oil leaks during engine test (Ref. Testing).

procedure.title: Torque Limiter (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: With the torque limiter overhauled and assembled to Chapter 73-10-09, proceed as follows: The torque limiter, an option, may not be installed on all engines. Install preformed packing (4) pt6a38-731009-001-0090 1 on universal adapter (5) pt6a38-731009-001-0080 1 . Install universal adapter (5) in torque transmitter boss on front case of reduction gearbox. Using adapter socket (PWC32062) tighten adapter and torque 375 to 425 lb.in. Install preformed packing (6) pt6a38-731009-001-0070 1 in groove on front face of universal adapter (5) and install torque limiter (1) pt6a38-731009-001-0100 1 angled at same relative position as noted during disassembly. Install preformed packing (7) pt6a38-731009-001-0060 1 on universal retainer (8) pt6a38-731009-001-0050 1 and insert retainer into universal adapter. Using a 1-13/16 inch (across flats) socket or box wrench, tighten retainer and torque (REF. NO. 1277, Fits and Clearances). Lockwire (PWC05-089) torque limiter components as applicable. Connect air pressure delivery tubes, and pressure test pneumatic system in accordance with appropriate procedure of Final Assembly-3.

procedure.title: Propeller Governor (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Because the speed set lever and stop bracket assembly can become loose on propeller governor (3146) and create inadequate clamping action, corrective procedures (3146/3152) should be implemented.

Propeller governor (3152) incorporates an improved speed setting stop and a socket head clamping screw. Install propeller governor as follows: Refer to general information paragraph (Final Assembly). Lightly lubricate
preformed packing pt6a38-612000-001-0020 1 and install on nipple (2) pt6a38-612000-001-0010 1 . Screw nipple into Py port in propeller governor (1) pt6a38-612000-001-0030 1 . Tighten and torque nipple 65 to 75 lb.in. Install new
gasket (6) pt6a38-612000-001-0070 1 over studs on propeller governor mounting pad on reduction gearbox, ensuring that raised side of gasket (if applicable) faces upward. Install propeller governor over studs and engage drive splines. If necessary, rotate propeller shaft to assist engagement. Check governor flange is fully seated on gasket before installing nuts. Assemble washer (5) pt6a38-612000-001-0060 4 and nuts (4) pt6a38-612000-001-0050 4 on studs, and using wrench (PWC30114-09) or (PWC30114-16) in conjunction with a standard torque wrench, torque nuts evenly 150 to 170 lb.in. Reference should be made to the appropriate procedure in Final Assembly-3 for pressure tests, and connection of linkage and Py tube.

title.xref: Oil Filter Element, Filter Housing and Check Valve Assembly

general.para: Personnel engaged in the final assembly of the engine should read the Introduction section of this manual to familiarize themselves with general overhaul procedures (Ref. INTRODUCTION, How to Use this Manual).
Refer to Figure 501 for bracket location before finally making any flange joint.
Do not allow loop clamps to move cables from their natural contour when tightening attachment bolts, as chafing of cable will result.

Because engines are under a continuing program of improvement in design and manufacture, certain parts or details may change when refinements are introduced by Service Bulletins (SB). These SBs which may affect assemblies, sub-assemblies, accessories, external components and associated parts must be grouped, assembled and installed in accordance with engine model and SB standard from the appropriate chapter of this manual and the IPC.

Final Assembly is divided into three sections:
FINAL ASSEMBLY-1: MODULES AND MAJOR SUBASSEMBLIES
FINAL ASSEMBLY-2: ACCESSORY COMPONENTS
FINAL ASSEMBLY-3: EXTERNAL COMPONENTS .

consumables.para: The consumable materials listed below are used in the following procedures.

special-tools.para: The special tools listed below are used in the following procedures.

procedure.title: Install Center Fireseal (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Offer top center fireseal (1) pt6a38-723001-001-0010 1 to engine and secure to two support brackets (2) with
bolts (8) pt6a38-723001-001-0080 2 , washers (19) pt6a38-723001-001-0090 2 and self-locking nuts (20) pt6a38-723001-001-0100 2 . Insert bolts from rear. Tighten nuts fingertight only.

Offer bottom center fireseal (5) pt6a38-723001-001-0050 1 to engine, and secure to two support brackets (2) with
bolts (17) pt6a38-723001-001-0080 2 and self-locking nuts (18) pt6a38-723001-001-0100 2 . Insert bolts from rear.
Attach top fireseal to bottom fireseal with four bolts (6) pt6a38-723001-001-0080 4 and nuts (7) pt6a38-723001-001-0100 4 . Tighten nuts and torque 32 to 36 lb.in.
Tighten and torque nuts, fitted during steps and , 32 to 36 lb.in. For installation of external lines and components passing through fireseal, refer to the relevant paragraphs following.

procedure.title: Install Rear Fireseal (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Offer up top rear fireseal pt6a38-723002-001-0010 1 to engine and locate on bracket attached to breather boss cap at 11 o'clock position on air inlet case. Secure to bracket with two bolts pt6a38-723002-001-0090 2 and self-locking nuts pt6a38-723002-001-0100 2 . Tighten nuts and torque 32 to 36 lb.in.

Attach support bracket (10) to bottom rear fireseal (4) pt6a38-723002-001-0050 1 with two bolts (16) pt6a38-742000-001-0020 2 and nuts (12) pt6a38-742000-001-0040 2 . Tighten nuts fingertight only. Nuts are to be tightened and torqued after installation of ignition cables (Ref. Para. )

Offer up bottom rear fireseal mounting ring (4) to engine and secure to top rear fireseal mounting ring (3) with two bolts (9) pt6a38-723002-001-0090 2 and nuts (14) pt6a38-723002-001-0100 2 . On 3258 engines, install up to four spacers (21) maximum between top and bottom mounting rings to reduce distortion of mounting ring joining brackets.

Torque nuts (14) 32 to 36 lb.in. Ensure that hole in bracket (10) aligns with hole for bolt (13) in scavenge oil tube boss at 6 o'clock position on air inlet case. For installation of external lines and components passing through fireseal, refer to relevant following paragraphs of this section.

procedure.title: Installation of Fuel Tubes and Flexible Hose (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Engage coupling nut at each end of flexible hose (1) pt6a38-731003-001-0010 1 with fuel pump and FCU fittings, and torque nuts 170 to 200 lb. in. Secure nuts with lockwire (PWC05-089). Check that hose fits snugly between FCU and fuel pump fittings without forcing or twisting, and that adequate clearance exists between hose and reversing linkage mechanisms.

Install a seal retaining plate (16) pt6a38-731003-001-0070 1 , seal retaining plate insulation (15) pt6a38-731003-001-0090 1 and fuel line seal (14) pt6a38-731003-001-0080 1 over coupling nut on fuel pressure tube assembly (2) pt6a38-731003-001-0120 1 . Insulation is to be fitted with foil side toward seal.

Insert fuel pressure tube assembly (2), coupling nut leading, forward through hole in center fireseal. Install second fuel line seal (14) pt6a38-731003-001-0080 1 , seal retaining plate insulation (15) pt6a38-731003-001-0090 1 and seal retaining plate (16) pt6a38-731003-001-0070 1 over coupling nut and position near center fireseal.
Fit bulkhead coupling (4) through hole in rear fireseal and retain bulkhead coupling with loosely fitted nut (10) pt6a38-731003-001-0030 1 .

Secure front end of fuel pressure tube assembly (2) to flow divider and dump valve or flow divider and purge valve with coupling nut, and torque nut 90 to 100 lb. in. Secure nut with lockwire (PWC05-089).
Torque nut (10) pt6a38-731003-001-0030 1 90 to 100 lb. in., and secure with lockwire (PWC05-089).

Secure seal retaining plates (16), insulation (15) and seals (14) to center fireseal using two bolts (13) pt6a38-731003-001-0100 2 and self-locking nuts (17) pt6a38-731003-001-0110 2 . Tighten nuts to obtain firm contact; then tighten a further 180 degrees.

Install loop clamp (11) pt6a38-731003-001-0040 1 and secure to ignition harness clamp (Ref. Para. ) with bolt (12) pt6a38-731003-001-0050 1 and self-locking nut (20) pt6a38-731003-001-0060 1 . Torque nut 36 to 40 lb. in.
Install loop clamp (19) pt6a38-731003-001-0040 1 and position to align with attachment bolt for flange of No. 2 bearing pressure oil connector. Install and tighten bolt (Ref. Para. )

On engines incorporating fuel pressure primary tube assembly (5) pt6a38-731003-001-0020 1 : Secure assembly (5) to bulkhead coupling (4) and elbow fitting at FCU. Torque coupling nuts 90 to 100 lb. in., and secure with lockwire (PWC05-089).

Secure assembly (7) pt6a38-731003-001-0024 1 , (8) pt6a38-731003-001-0023 1 and (9) pt6a38-731003-001-0022 1 to bulkhead coupling (4) and straight nipple fitting at FCU. Torque coupling nuts 90 to 100 lb. in., and secure with lockwire (PWC05-089). Fuel pressure primary tube (7, 3143) is similar to tube (7, 3143), but is routed so as to ensure adequate clearance between the tube and the bolt securing check valve retaining plate to the thermostatic bypass and check valve.
Check lines for leaks during engine testing (Ref. Testing).

figure.title: Fuel Delivery Tubes and Flexible Hose

key.def: Fuel Pressure Primary Tube Assembly (Center) (3143)**Fuel Pressure Primary Tube Assembly (Center) (3143)**
Basic on engines without fuel flowmeter provisionPT6A-38, A-41 and A-42 (3288)
Optional part for use on engines with fuel flowmeter provisionPT6A-41, A-42 (3288) and A-42ABasic feature of PT6A-41 engines fitted to Piper installation.

procedure.title: Installation of Compressor Wash Ring (if fitted) (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.caution: PROTECT AIR INLET SCREEN AREA TO PREVENT OBJECTS FROM FALLING INTO AIR INLET CASE DURING INSTALLATION. SHOULD ANYTHING PASS THROUGH SCREEN, STOP FURTHER WORK ON ENGINE UNTIL OBJECT IS RECOVERED.
procedure.step: Maneuver lower tube assembly (7) pt6a38-723002-001-0220 1 into position around narrow cone section of engine casing. Move assembly rearward over air inlet screen and enter tee connection in appropriate fireseal aperture. Loosely install plain nut (8) pt6a38-723002-001-0240 1 .

Secure lower tube assembly (7) to fireseal with
bolt (4) pt6a38-723002-001-0120 1 and two flat washers (5) pt6a38-723002-001-0130 2 inserted between bracket and fireseal. Torque bolts 36 to 40 lb. in.

Tighten plain nut (8) to secure lower end of tube connection to fireseal; torque 38 to 42 lb in., and lockwire (PWC05-089). Secure cap (9) pt6a38-723002-001-0230 1 to connector, tighten cap, torque 65 to 75 lb.in., and lockwire (PWC05-089).
Insert bulkhead tee (3) pt6a38-723002-001-0190 1 in fireseal aperture and secure fingertight with plain nut (2) pt6a38-723002-001-0210 1 .

Secure upper tube assembly (6) pt6a38-723002-001-0110 1 to fireseal at two locations with two bolts (4) pt6a38-723002-001-0120 2 and four flat washers (5) pt6a38-723002-001-0130 4 inserted in pairs between bracket and fireseal. Tighten bolts and torque 36 to 40 lb.in.

Screw coupling nuts of both tube assemblies fingertight on tee-connection (3). Ensure that tee-connector is correctly aligned, retain in this position, then torque plain nut (2) 70 to 80 lb.in., and lockwire (PWC05-089).
Torque tube (6) and (7) coupling nuts to tee-connector (3) 270 to 300 lb.in.; secure together and to fireseal lug with lockwire (PWC05-089).
Secure cap (1) pt6a38-723002-001-0200 1 to tee-connector (3); tighten cap, torque 110 to 120 lb.in., and lockwire (PWC05-089).

figure.title: Installation of Compressor Wash Ring (if fitted)

procedure.title: Pressure Oil Transfer Tube (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.caution: IT IS ESSENTIAL THAT TUBES ARE NOT SUBJECTED TO BENDING OR COMPRESSION STRESSES DURING INSTALLATION OF TUBE ASSEMBLY. UNDER NO CIRCUMSTANCES SHOULD TUBES BE FORCED INTO OR OUT OF POSITION.
procedure.step:
Temporarily install oil transfer tubes (3099/3123) to check and correct tube assembly alignment: On PT6A-41/-42 engines, transfer tube assembly (14, 3099, 3173) is replaced with a similar assembly (3173) having increased bend radii, to reduce the possibility of tube deformation during cold starts due to pressure surges. Place seal retaining plate (7) pt6a38-792001-001-0230 1 , seal (8) pt6a38-792001-001-0260 1 and front retaining plate heat shield (9) pt6a38-792001-001-0250 1 over rear end of tube (14) pt6a38-792001-001-0160 1 , and seal retaining plate (21) pt6a38-792001-001-0090 1 , retaining plate heat shield (22) pt6a38-792001-001-0100 1 and seal (23) pt6a38-792001-001-0110 1 over front end of tube (14). Slide both sets towards No. 2 bearing supply flange (16). Assemble preformed packing (17) pt6a38-792001-001-0220 1 in spigot groove on flange (16) of tube assembly (14). Insert forward end of transfer tube (14) through center fireseal, then reverse rear end of tube into rear fireseal. Locate rear retaining plate heat shield (9) pt6a38-792001-001-0250 1 , seal (8) pt6a38-792001-001-0260 1 and seal retaining plate (7) pt6a38-792001-001-0230 1 over rear of tube (14). Slide both sets of parts (7), (8) and (9) toward rear fireseal. Secure clamp (12) pt6a38-792001-001-0286 1 and bracket (13) pt6a38-792001-001-0285 1 on tube assembly (14) with nut and bolt. Do not tighten nut at this stage. Secure both sets of parts (7), (8) and (9) with three bolts and nuts. Do not tighten nuts. One of these bolts also secures bracket (13) to the fireseal mount ring. Assemble preformed packing (24) pt6a38-792001-001-0080 1 in groove at each end of tube (25) pt6a38-792001-001-0070 1 , and insert tube into transfer tube (14). Place retaining plate heat shield (22) pt6a38-792001-001-0100 1 , seal (23) pt6a38-792001-001-0110 1 and
seal retaining plate (21) pt6a38-792001-001-0090 1 over transfer tube (25). Assemble external coupling (30) pt6a38-792001-001-0030 1 over free end of transfer tube (25). Retain coupling (30) to flange C with two D-head bolts, washers and nuts. Do not tighten nuts. Slide both sets of parts (21), (22) and (23) toward center fireseal and secure loosely with two bolts and nuts. Locate preformed packing (1) pt6a38-731007-001-0215 1 on housing (2) pt6a38-731007-001-0211 1 or elbow (6) pt6a38-792001-001-0290 1 , as applicable to installation requirement. Secure housing or elbow on compressor inlet case with two washers (3) pt6a38-792001-001-0310 2 and bolts (4) pt6a38-731007-001-0136 2 or (5) pt6a38-792001-001-0300 2 ; torque bolts 36 to 40 lb.in., but do not lockwire at this stage. Maneuver transfer tubes carefully, aligning No. 2 bearing supply flange (16), spigot and preformed packing with mounting position on gas generator case. Do not install transfer tube (11) for this clearance and alignment check. Tighten nuts securing both sets of parts (7), (8), (9), (21), (22) and (23) until firm contact is made, then torque nuts by tightening a further 180 degrees. Tighten nut and bolt securing clamp (12) and bracket (13) and torque 36 to 40 lb.in. Tighten nuts securing
coupling (30) pt6a38-792001-001-0030 1 and torque 36 to 40 lb.in.

figure.title: Installation of Pressure Oil Transfer Tubes

key.def: Ignition Cable Support Bracket (PT6A-38/-41/-42 Engines and 3426 (PT6A-42A) Engines)
Pressure Oil Tube Seal Retaining Plate (3123)

procedure.title: Check Tube Alignment (3099/3123) (Ref. Fig. , Sheet 2)
procedure.step: Examine apertures in center and rear fireseals and retaining plates (7) and (21) for a 0.050 inch clearance around transfer tube (14).
Should it be necessary, hand dress apertures in fireseals and retaining plates to obtain this clearance with transfer tube (14).

Check alignment of aperture in elbow (6) or P3 air filter housing (2) with tube assembly (14). Under normal circumstances, the alignment should not deviate from its true position, unless displaced through obvious reasons.
Examine for gap between No. 2 bearing supply flange (16) and mounting boss on gas generator case. Should a gap exist, do not force flange into position.

Measure gap, less thickness of gasket (18), and select the appropriate classification and number of alignment spacers (19) (Ref. Table ). Spacers will be installed on No. 2 bearing supply flange (16) during assembly at a later stage. The number and classification of spacers must be recorded.
Spacer Classification
CLASSDIMENSION (THICKNESS)
10.004 to 0.006 inch
20.008 to 0.012 inch
30.017 to 0.023 inch
Maximum of three spacers of the same, or mixed, class may be used.
Remove bolts (4) or (5) and washers (3) and separate filter housing or elbow from inlet case. Discard preformed packing (1).
Remove nut and bolts securing parts (7), (8), (9), (21), (22) and (23).
Separate rear parts (7), (8) and (9) from rear fireseal and transfer tube (14).

procedure.title: Installation of Oil Transfer Tubes (3099/3123) (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: DO NOT BEND OR FORCE TUBE OUT OF POSITION DURING ASSEMBLY OF PRESSURE OIL TRANSFER TUBES. WHEN REMOVING ANY SINGLE TUBE, THE ADJACENT TUBE, COUPLING, ELBOW OR FILTER BODY, TOGETHER WITH SEAL RETAINING PLATES, MUST BE REMOVED.Install preformed packing (10) pt6a38-792001-001-0150 1 in groove at each end of transfer tube (11).

Insert transfer tube (11) pt6a38-792001-001-0286 1 into tube assembly (14) pt6a38-792001-001-0160 1 , and position heat shield (9) pt6a38-792001-001-0250 1 , seal (8) pt6a38-792001-001-0260 1 and seal retaining plate (7) pt6a38-792001-001-0230 1 over tube against rear fireseal. On PT6A-41/-42 engines, transfer tube assembly (14, 3099, 3173) is replaced with a similar assembly (3173) having increased bend radii, to reduce the possibility of tube deformation during cold starts due to pressure surges.

Assemble gasket (18) pt6a38-792001-001-0210 1 and spacers (19) pt6a38-792001-001-0200 3 (previously calculated and recorded) on No. 2 bearing supply flange (16). The maximum number of spacers must not exceed three.
Assemble new preformed packing (1) pt6a38-731007-001-0215 1 on P3 air filter housing (2) pt6a38-731007-001-0211 1 or elbow (6) pt6a38-792001-001-0290 1 , as applicable to installation requirement.

Position housing or elbow over transfer tube (11) and locate on inlet case. Secure with two washers (3) pt6a38-792001-001-0310 2 and bolts (4) pt6a38-731007-001-0136 2 or (5) pt6a38-792001-001-0300 2 , and torque bolts 36 to 40 lb.in. Lock bolts using lockwire (PWC05-089).

Secure both sets of seal retaining plates (7), seals (8) and retaining plate heat shields (9) to rear fireseal with bolts and nuts. One of the bolts also secures bracket (13) pt6a38-792001-001-0285 1 to fireseal. Do not torque nuts. Position bolt heads on compressor air inlet side of both center and rear fireseals.

Secure both sets of seal retaining plates (21) pt6a38-792001-001-0090 1 , retaining plate heat shields (22) pt6a38-792001-001-0100 1 and seals (23) pt6a38-792001-001-0110 1 to center fireseal with bolts and nuts. Do not torque nuts.
Recheck alignment of flange (16) (spacers already installed) with gas generator case mounting boss.

For PT6A-38/-41/-42 Engines and 3426 (PT6A-42A) Engines: Position ignition cable support bracket (20) pt6a38-792001-001-0190 1 on the outside of flange (16) and loop clamp of fuel delivery tube on the inside of flange. Attach loosely with two washers and bolts. The ignition cable support bracket (20) is omitted on 3426 Engines.

Install preformed packings (28) pt6a38-792001-001-0020 1 in groove at each end of transfer tube (29) pt6a38-792001-001-0010 1 , and preformed packing (26) pt6a38-792001-001-0370 1 in groove of elbow (27) pt6a38-792001-001-0340 1 .
Assemble elbow (27) on one end of tube (29), and insert other end of tube into coupling (30) pt6a38-792001-001-0030 1 at flange C.
Position elbow (27) on reduction gearbox and secure with two bolts and washers. Tighten bolts, torque 36 to 40 lb.in., and lockwire (PWC05-089).

Tighten nuts, securing seal retaining plates (7) and (21), seals (8) and (23) and retaining plate heat shields (9) and (22) to fireseals, until firm contact is made, then torque by further tightening 180 degrees.
Tighten and torque bolts securing flange (16) to gas generator case 36 to 40 lb.in., and lockwire (PWC05-089).
Install clamp (15) pt6a38-792001-001-0380 1 on tube (14) and secure to clamp on fuel delivery line with bolt and self-locking nut. Tighten nut and torque 36 to 40 lb. in.

procedure.title: Installation of Oil Transfer Tubes (3123) (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
DO NOT BEND OR FORCE TUBE OUT OF POSITION DURING ASSEMBLY OF PRESSURE OIL TRANSFER TUBES. WHEN REMOVING ANY SINGLE TUBE, THE ADJACENT TUBE, COUPLING, ELBOW OR FILTER BODY, TOGETHER WITH SEAL RETAINING PLATES, MUST BE REMOVED.Assemble tube seal retaining plate (36) pt6a38-792001-001-0250 1 , seal (35) pt6a38-792001-001-0255 1 and
seal retaining plate (34) pt6a38-792001-001-0256 1 over rear end of transfer tube (14) pt6a38-792001-001-0160 1 , and seal retaining plate (21) pt6a38-792001-001-0090 2 , retaining plate heat shield (22) pt6a38-792001-001-0100 2 and seal (23) pt6a38-792001-001-0110 2 over front end of tube (14). Slide both sets toward No. 2 bearing supply flange (16). On PT6A-41/-42 engines, transfer tube assembly (14, 3099, 3173) is replaced with a similar assembly (3173) having increased bend radii, to reduce the possibility of tube deformation during cold starts due to pressure surges.
Install preformed packing (17) pt6a38-792001-001-0220 1 in spigot groove on flange (16) of tube assembly (14).
Insert forward end of transfer tube (14) through center fireseal, then reverse rear end of tube into rear fireseal.
Place seal retaining plate (36), seal (35) and seal retaining plate (34) on transfer tube (14) against rear fireseal mount ring.
Position seal (23), retaining plate heat shield (22) and tube seal retaining plate (21), also on transfer tube (14), against center fireseal mount ring.
Install preformed packing (10) pt6a38-792001-001-0153 1 in groove at each end of transfer tube (11) pt6a38-792001-001-0286 1 , and insert tube into transfer tube (14)

Install retaining plate heat shield (32) pt6a38-792001-001-0240 2 , seal (33) pt6a38-792001-001-0260 1 , retaining plate heat shield (32) and tube retaining plate (31) pt6a38-792001-001-0230 1 over tube (11) and loosely against rear fireseal mount ring.
Place gasket (18) pt6a38-792001-001-0210 1 on No. 2 bearing supply flange (16).
Install preformed packing (1) pt6a38-731007-001-0215 1 on P3 air filter housing (2) pt6a38-731007-001-0211 1 on elbow (6) pt6a38-731007-001-0290 1 , as applicable to installation requirement.

Position housing or elbow over transfer tube (11) and locate on inlet case. Secure with two washers (3) pt6a38-792001-001-0310 2 and bolts (4) pt6a38-792001-001-0136 2 or (5) pt6a38-792001-001-0285 2 , and torque bolts 36 to 40 lb.in. Lock bolts using lockwire (PWC05-089).

DO NOT USE FORCE WHEN PRESSING TRANSFER TUBE SPIGOT INTO BOSS ON GAS GENERATOR CASE, AS DAMAGE TO PREFORMED PACKING CAN ULTIMATELY RESULT IN OIL LEAKAGE.Gently ease flange (16) spigot (parts (17) and (18) already installed) into No. 2 bearing supply boss on gas generator case. Do not insert retaining bolts at this stage.
Assemble preformed packing (24) in groove at each end of transfer tube (25); insert tube into transfer tube (14).
Loosely assemble seal (23), retaining plate heat shield (22) and tube seal retaining plate (21), over transfer tube (25) pt6a38-792001-001-0070 1 , against center fireseal mount ring.
Assemble coupling (30) over free end of transfer tube (25); secure coupling to flange C with two D-head bolts, washers and nuts fingertight.

Install preformed packing (28) pt6a38-792001-001-0020 1 in groove at each end of transfer tube (29) pt6a38-792001-001-0010 1 , and preformed packing (26) pt6a38-792001-001-0370 1 in groove of elbow (27) pt6a38-792001-001-0340 1 .

Install elbow (27) on one end of tube (29) and insert other end into coupling (30). Secure elbow to reduction gearbox with washers and two bolts; tighten bolts, torque 36 to 40 lb.in. and lockwire (PWC05-089).

With both ends of oil pressure tube installation firmly secured by air filter housing (2) or elbow (6), and elbow (27), check that each transfer tube is correctly engaged in its appropriate position, and No. 2 bearing supply flange (16) is firmly seated on gas generator case.

Align retaining plate heat shields (32), seal (33) and tube retaining plate (31) on one side of rear fireseal, and seal retaining plate (34), seal (35) and tube seal retaining plate (36) on the other side. Secure both sets to rear fireseal with bolts and nuts until firm contact is made, then further tighten 180 degrees. Position bolt heads on compressor air inlet side of both center and rear fireseals.
Align seal retaining plate (21), heat shield (22) and seal (23) on both sides of center fireseal and secure together with bolts and nuts until firm contact is made, then further tighten 180 degrees.

Tighten two self-locking nuts and bolts securing
coupling (30) pt6a38-792001-001-0030 1 to flange C and torque 36 to 40 lb.in.
Ensure that no gap exists between flange (16) of transfer tube (14) and mating surface on gas generator case.

For PT6A-38/-41/-42 Engines and 3426 (PT6A-42A) Engines: Locate ignition cable support bracket (20) pt6a38-792001-001-0190 1 on outside of flange (16) and loop clamp of fuel delivery tube on inside flange; attach to gas generator case with two washers and bolts. Tighten and torque bolts 36 to 40 lb.in., and lockwire (PWC05-089). The ignition cable support bracket (20) is omitted on 3426 Engines
Install clamp (15) pt6a38-792001-001-0380 1 on tube (14) and secure to clamp on fuel delivery tube with bolt and self-locking nut. Tighten nut and torque 36 to 40 lb.in.

procedure.title: No. 2 Bearing Scavenge Oil Tube (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Install preformed packings (12) pt6a38-792001-002-0070 1 and (7) pt6a38-792001-002-0080 1 on front and rear flanges (10) and (8) of No. 2 bearing scavenge tube (9) pt6a38-792001-002-0010 1 . Install gasket (11) pt6a38-792001-002-0060 1 on front flange.
Pass front end of scavenge tube through rear fireseal and locate flanges on respective bosses on gas generator and compressor inlet cases.

Locate rear fireseal support bracket (6) pt6a38-792001-002-0050 1 on front hole of scavenge tube rear flange (8). Attach flange and bracket to boss with two bolts (15) pt6a38-792001-002-0020 2 and plain washers (16) pt6a38-792001-002-0030 2 . Tighten bolts, torque 36 to 40 lb.in., and lockwire (PWC05-089).

For PT6A-38/-41/-42 Engines and 3426 (PT6A-42A) Engines: Locate fuel and air line support bracket (13) pt6a38-792001-002-0040 1 on inner hole on front flange (10). Attach bracket and flange to gas generator case with two bolts (15) pt6a38-792001-002-0020 2 and plain washers (16). Tighten bolts, torque 36 to 40 lb.in., and lockwire (PWC05-089). The fuel and air line support bracket (13) is omitted on 3426 Engines.

Install seals (4) pt6a38-792001-002-0120 2 and seal-retaining plate assemblies (3) pt6a38-792001-002-0110 1 and (5) pt6a38-792001-002-0100 1 on scavenge tube. Secure assemblies and seals to rear fireseal with two retaining plates (2) pt6a38-792001-002-0090 2 , four bolts pt6a38-792001-002-0130 4 and
self-locking nuts pt6a38-792001-002-0140 4 . Tighten nuts to obtain firm contact then further tighten 180 degrees.

Install support clamp (1) pt6a38-792001-002-0150 1 on No. 2 bearing scavenge tube (9). Attachment of support clamp to ignition cable, and bracket (6) to rear fireseal will be accomplished during installation of ignition cables (Ref. Para. following).

figure.title: Installation of No. 2 Bearing Scavenge Oil Tube

key.def: Fuel and Air Line Support Bracket (PT6A-38/-41/-42 Engines and 3426 (PT6A-42A) Engines)

procedure.title: Dual Scavenge Oil Tubes (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Install preformed packings (18) pt6a38-792001-003-0080 2 on each end of rear transfer tubes (17) pt6a38-792001-003-0070 2 .

Loosely install scavenge line seals (7) pt6a38-792001-003-0100 2 and (10) pt6a38-792001-003-0140 2 , and seal retaining plates (6) pt6a38-792001-003-0090 2 and
(9) pt6a38-792001-003-0130 2 on respective fireseals with bolts and self-locking nuts. Bolt heads at center and rear fireseals must be located on air inlet face of respective fireseals.
Insert rear transfer tubes (17) through center and rear fireseal and associated seals and connect to respective ports on external scavenge pump.

Install transfer coupling (4) pt6a38-792001-003-0030 1 on rear transfer tubes and locate coupling on front face of flange C. Ensure dowels on coupling engage corresponding holes in flange. Loosely secure coupling to flange with three D-head bolts (3) pt6a38-792001-003-0040 3 (3013), plain washers pt6a38-792001-003-0050 3 and self-locking nuts pt6a38-792001-003-0060 3 .
Install preformed packings (15) pt6a38-792001-003-0251 1 on short transfer tube (11) pt6a38-792001-003-0240 1 and insert tube into boss on reduction gearbox case.

Install sleeve seal (14) pt6a38-792001-003-0220 1 and preformed packing (13) pt6a38-792001-003-0230 1 in No. 3 and 4 bearing scavenge port of front scavenge oil transfer elbow (2) pt6a38-792001-003-0180 1 .
Install preformed packings (16) pt6a38-792001-003-0021 2 on each end of front transfer tubes (12) pt6a38-792001-003-0011 1 . Insert tubes into respective ports on oil transfer elbow (2).

Locate oil transfer elbow and tubes under reduction gearbox case. Insert short transfer tube (11) into port on oil transfer elbow (2) and rear end of transfer tubes (12) into respective ports on transfer coupling (4).

Locate oil transfer elbow on mounting boss of reduction gearbox case, ensuring packing and sleeve mate with corresponding hole in boss. Secure elbow (2) with three bolts (1) pt6a38-792001-003-0190 pt6a38-792001-003-0200 2, 1 and plain washers pt6a38-792001-003-0210 1 . Tighten bolts, torque 36 to 40 lb.in., and lockwire (PWC05-089).
Tighten self-locking nuts securing oil transfer coupling (4) to flange C and torque 32 to 36 lb.in.
Tighten self-locking nuts securing transfer tube seals and seal retaining plates to respective fireseals; torque until firm contact plus 180 degrees.
Check for leaks (Ref. Testing).

procedure.title: Assembly of Ignition Cables (PT6A-42A Engines) (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.caution: UNDER NO CIRCUMSTANCES IS ANY LUBRICANT CONTAINING GREASE OR SILICONE, OR ANY LUBRICANTS SUCH AS PETROLATUM TO BE USED ON ANY IGNITION COMPONENT.
DO NOT LET ANY LUBRICANT CONTACT CENTRAL CONDUCTORS OF CABLES. CONTACT MAY RESULT IN A HIGH RESISTANCE PATH WHICH COULD GENERATE HEAT AND OXIDATION.
DO NOT APPLY LUBRICANT ON ANY CABLES HAVING TEFLON INSULATED SLEEVES.
procedure.step: For PT6A-42A Engines installed on Piper Meridian aircraft: Ignition cables for this installation are not routed on the engine: For instructions on installation of ignition cables, refer to Piper Meridian Aircraft Maintenance Manual PA-46-500TP, Malibu Meridian, Chapter 74-20-00. Ignition cables should be wrapped in a coil and secured to the engine with a tie down strap (PWC05-111) for shipping.

procedure.title: Assembly of Ignition Cables (PT6A-38/-41 and 3370 PT6A-42 Engines) (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.caution: UNDER NO CIRCUMSTANCES IS ANY LUBRICANT CONTAINING GREASE OR SILICONE, OR ANY LUBRICANTS SUCH AS PETROLATUM TO BE USED ON ANY IGNITION COMPONENT.
DO NOT LET ANY LUBRICANT CONTACT CENTRAL CONDUCTORS OF CABLES. CONTACT MAY RESULT IN A HIGH RESISTANCE PATH WHICH COULD GENERATE HEAT AND OXIDATION.
DO NOT APPLY LUBRICANT ON ANY CABLES HAVING TEFLON INSULATED SLEEVES.
procedure.step: DO NOT ALLOW BRAIDING, FERRULES OR IGNITER PLUG TO TURN WHEN SCREWING ON COUPLING NUTS.Install overhauled ignition cables (1) pt6a38-742000-001-0010 1 and (2) pt6a38-742000-001-0010 1 (Ref. 74-20-00) between center and rear fireseals passing cable ends through respective holes in fireseals.

Install cable flanges (27) on rear fireseal and secure with four bolts and self-locking nuts. Top two bolts also secure fireseal support bracket (28) pt6a38-792001-002-0050 1 . Tighten nuts and torque 36 to 40 lb.in. (Ref. Detail J.). When securing hardware to fireseals, bolts must be installed with heads on air inlet side of fireseals.

Install cable flanges (8) and (11) on center fireseal, position bracket (10) pt6a38-742000-001-0070 1 on front face of fireseal and secure with bolts and self-locking nuts. Tighten nuts and torque 36 to 40 lb.in. (Ref. Details B. and F.).
Lightly spray rubber insulated ends of cable conductors with fluorocarbon dry spray lubricant (PWC06-005B).

DO NOT ALLOW BRAIDING, FERRULES OR IGNITER PLUG TO TURN WHEN SCREWING ON COUPLING NUTS.Connect coupling nuts at end of ignition cables (1) and (2) to respective spark igniters (3) and (4) and connectors on ignition exciter. Screw couplings onto mating threads by hand, making sure that no binding occurs between coupling nut and cable. Tighten coupling nuts and torque fingertight plus 45 degrees. Wirelock coupling nuts at ignition exciter with lockwire (PWC05-089).

Install two loop clamps (29) pt6a38-742000-001-0050 1 and (30) pt6a38-742000-001-0050 1 on rear end of ignition cables (1) and (2) and position adjacent to loop clamp (31) pt6a38-742000-001-0090 1 on No. 2 bearing scavenge oil tube (14) pt6a38-792001-002-0010 1 . Pass two cables beneath oil tube and secure loop clamps with bolt and self-locking nut. Tighten nut and torque 36 to 40 lb.in. (Ref. Detail E.).

Install loop clamp (22) pt6a38-742000-001-0050 1 on ignition cable (1) and secure to loop clamp (23) pt6a38-742000-001-0050 1 on No. 2 bearing scavenge oil tube with bolt and self-locking nut. Tighten nut and torque 36 to 40 lb.in. (Ref. Detail D.)

Install loop clamp (16) pt6a38-742000-001-0050 1 on ignition cable (1) and secure to bracket (15) pt6a38-792001-002-0040 1 at No. 2 bearing flange fitting with bolt, washer and self-locking nut. Tighten nut and torque 36 to 40 lb.in. (Ref. Detail C.).
Install loop clamp (9) pt6a38-742000-001-0050 1 on ignition cable (1) and secure to bracket (10) with bolt and self-locking nut. Tighten nut and torque 36 to 40 lb.in. (Ref. Detail B.).

Install loop clamp (7) pt6a38-742000-001-0050 1 on ignition cable (1) and secure loop clamp, bracket (6) pt6a38-742000-001-0080 1 and center fireseal to bracket on gas generator case with bolt and self-locking nut. Tighten nut and torque 36 to 40 lb.in. (Ref. Detail A.).

Install loop clamp (18) pt6a38-742000-001-0050 1 on ignition cable (2) and secure to loop clamp (17) pt6a38-742000-001-0050 1 on fuel delivery tube (5) pt6a38-731003-001-0120 1 with bolt and self-locking nut. Tighten nut and torque 36 to 40 lb.in. (Ref. Detail I.).

Install loop clamp (26) pt6a38-742000-001-0050 1 on ignition cable (2) and secure to loop clamp (25) pt6a38-742000-001-0050 1 on pressure oil tube (24) pt6a38-792001-001-0160 1 with bolt and self-locking nut. Tighten nut and torque 36 to 40 lb.in. (Ref. Detail H.).

Install loop clamp (19) pt6a38-742000-001-0050 1 on ignition cable (2) and secure to bracket (20) pt6a38-792001-001-0190 1 at No. 2 bearing pressure oil connection (21) with bolt and self-locking nut. Tighten nut and torque 36 to 40 lb.in. (Ref Detail G.).

Install loop clamp (12) pt6a38-742000-001-0050 1 on ignition cable (2) and secure loop clamp, bracket (13) pt6a38-742000-001-0070 1 and center fireseal to bracket on gas generator case. Tighten nut and torque 36 to 40 lb.in. (Ref. Detail F.).

procedure.title: Assembly of Ignition Cables (PT6A-38/-41 and 3370 PT6A-42 Engines) (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.caution: UNDER NO CIRCUMSTANCES IS ANY LUBRICANT CONTAINING GREASE OR SILICONE, OR ANY LUBRICANTS SUCH AS PETROLATUM TO BE USED ON ANY IGNITION COMPONENT.
DO NOT LET ANY LUBRICANT CONTACT CENTRAL CONDUCTORS OF CABLES. CONTACT MAY RESULT IN A HIGH RESISTANCE PATH WHICH COULD GENERATE HEAT AND OXIDATION.
DO NOT APPLY LUBRICANT ON ANY CABLES HAVING TEFLON INSULATED SLEEVES.
procedure.step: Connect coupling nuts at end of ignition cables (1) and (2) to respective spark igniters (3) and (4) and connectors on ignition exciter.

Screw couplings onto mating threads by hand, making sure that no binding occurs between coupling nut and cable. Tighten coupling nuts and torque fingertight plus 45 degrees. Wirelock coupling nuts at ignition exciter with lockwire (PWC05-089).
Wrap ignition cables in a coil and secure to tubing with tiedown strap (PWC05-111).

procedure.title: Propeller Reversing Linkage (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Remove all protective material introduced on completion of overhaul (Ref. 76-10-00) and lubricate all bearings by rotating bearing outwards and applying grease (PWC04-001). The following instructions should be complied with: These general instructions and procedures are for installation when a test cell facility acceptable to the reversing propeller configuration is available; some of the procedures may be best accomplished in the test cell. Should test cell be of non-reversing propeller configuration (for instance, when testing against a dynamometer), procedures detailed in subparagraphs to inclusive are to be implemented after engine final acceptance test and prior to shipment of engine. These instructions are given primarily for shipping purposes, as the resultant rigging may differ quite considerably from that required when the engine is installed in the airframe. At engine installation by the airframe manufacturer, the linkage is adjusted to suit a particular airframe configuration. Adjustments may include altering rod lengths, moving clevis pins to different holes and, if necessary, selecting a different cam to obtain the necessary power response characteristics. The final rigging arrangement is part of the aircraft certification requirement, detailed in the aircraft Maintenance Manual. Therefore, when an engine is reinstalled in the aircraft after overhaul or repair, the engine should be rigged in accordance with the aircraft Maintenance Manual and not in accordance with the PWC Engine Maintenance or Overhaul Manual.

key.def: Guide Pin Bracket and Carbon Slipper Block (Propeller Supply) (Ref.)

procedure.title: Assemble Rear Linkage Cam Box (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Position propeller control cam (19) pt6a38-761000-001-0180 1 and actuating lever (44) pt6a38-761000-001-0140 1 between bosses on control lever mounting bracket (46) pt6a38-761000-001-0230 1 , align holes in each part, and insert pin (54) pt6a38-761000-001-0110 1 . Secure pin with washer pt6a38-761000-001-0120 1 and cotterpin pt6a38-761000-001-0130 1 .

Slide fork end of reversing control follower lever (51) pt6a38-761000-001-0010 1 over propeller control cam (19), align holes in lever with cam slot and insert shoulder pin (50) pt6a38-761000-001-0030 1 . Secure shoulder pin with washer pt6a38-761000-001-0040 1 and cotterpin pt6a38-761000-001-0050 1 .

Insert actuating lever (53) pt6a38-761000-001-0060 1 , with adjuster (55) pt6a38-761000-001-0070 1 uppermost, between follower lever (51) and boss on arm of control lever mounting bracket (46). Align follower lever and actuating lever and insert grooved pin (52) pt6a38-761000-001-0220 1 through bracket and two levers.

Press grooved pin (52) firmly into mounting bracket (46) and secure pin and levers (51) and (53) by tightening clamping bolt on follower lever (51). Torque bolt 32 to 36 lb.in., and lockwire (PWC05-089).

Install spring (49) pt6a38-761000-001-0150 1 between posts on actuating lever (44) and control lever mounting bracket (46) and secure to each post with washer pt6a38-761000-001-0160 2 and cotterpin pt6a38-761000-001-0170 2 .

procedure.title: Install Rear Linkage (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Place assembly of rear linkage cam box on accessory gearbox housing and insert two studs located at flange G into lugs of control lever mounting bracket (46).
Align center lug of control lever mounting bracket (46) with angle bracket (48) pt6a38-761000-001-0090 1 on accessory gearbox housing; install bolt (47) pt6a38-761000-001-0100 1 , but do not tighten.
Install spacer on stud located at flange G directly below bottom lug on control lever mounting bracket (46).

Position electrical connector bracket (45) pt6a38-731007-001-0240 1 on studs located at bottom lug of control lever mounting bracket (46) and spacer. Install three nuts to attach the two brackets to flange G. Tighten nuts and torque 32 to 36 lb.in.
Tighten three bolts in angle bracket (48), torque 32 to 36 lb.in., and lockwire (PWC05-089).

Check that adjuster (55) and locknut are installed from rear face of actuating lever (53) and with end of adjuster contacting shoulder pin (50), adjust to obtain an angle of 85 degrees, plus or minus one degree, between centers of grooved pin (52), shoulder pin (50) and pin (54). Tighten locknut on adjuster (55), torque 32 to 36 lb.in., but do not lockwire at this stage.

Turn fuel control unit arm (43) pt6a38-732000-001-0110 1 counterclockwise, then clockwise, until internal pick-up point in fuel control unit is felt. Back off arm counterclockwise just clear of pick-up point and hold in this position. Angle of arm (43) should be 22 degrees, plus or minus one degree, below longitudinal axis of engine and facing rear. Adjust angle, if necessary, by removing
arm override extension (56) pt6a38-732000-001-0100 1 and rotating arm on serrated spacer (57) pt6a38-732000-001-0120 1 . Reinstall and tighten arm extension; torque 25 to 35 lb.in.

For 3432 Engines: Adjust length of control rod (42) pt6a38-761000-001-0310 1 until centers of rod end connectors align with outer hole in actuating lever (44) pt6a38-761000-001-0140 1 and inner hole in fuel control unit arm (43) pt6a38-732000-001-0110 1 , respectively, with lever and arm held in positions outlined in foregoing steps and . Attach control rod to lever and arm with
bolts (41) pt6a38-761000-001-0250 2 , washers pt6a38-761000-001-0260 1 and castellated nuts pt6a38-761000-001-0270 2 . Tighten nuts, torque (REF. NO. 1258, Fits & Clearances) and install cotterpins pt6a38-761000-001-0280 .

For 3432 Engines: Adjust length of control rod (42) pt6a38-761000-001-0310 1 until centers of rod end connectors align with outer hole in actuating lever (44) pt6a38-761000-001-0140 1 and inner hole in fuel control unit arm (43) pt6a38-732000-001-0110 1 , respectively, with lever and arm held in positions outlined in foregoing steps and . Attach control rod to lever and arm with
bolts (41) pt6a38-761000-001-0250 2 and castellated nuts pt6a38-761000-001-0270 2 . Tighten nuts, torque (REF. NO. 1258, Fits & Clearances) and install cotterpins pt6a38-761000-001-0280 2 .
Install input lever (1) on end of grooved pin (52) pt6a38-761000-001-0220 1 and attach by tightening clamping bolt on lever. Do not torque bolt or lockwire until final adjustments are completed.

procedure.title: Install Propeller Reversing Push-pull Casing Assembly (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Install front swivel joint retaining plate (38) pt6a38-761000-003-0010 1 on engine lifting bracket, and secure loosely with two bolts (37) pt6a38-761000-003-0020 2 and self-locking nuts pt6a38-761000-003-0030 2 . Insert front swivel joint casing (22) pt6a38-761000-002-0080 1 through slots in lifting bracket and retaining plate, and secure with nut (35) pt6a38-761000-002-0090 1 .
Tighten nuts on bolts (37) which secure swivel plate (38) to engine lifting bracket (36) pt6a38-721000-001-0030 1 and torque 32 to 36 lb.in.
Tighten nut (35) on front swivel joint casing (22), torque 200 to 225 lb.in., and lockwire (PWC05-089).

Insert rear swivel joint casing (33) pt6a38-761000-002-0060 1 into bracket (40) pt6a38-761000-001-0420 1 and rear fireseal and install nut (39) pt6a38-761000-002-0090 2 . Do not tighten nut at this stage.

Place one retaining plate (30) pt6a38-761000-001-0320 2 on flexible shaft casing (25) pt6a38-761000-002-0110 1 and pass end through center fireseal; as it passes through fireseal, place second retaining plate on casing.

Connect flexible shaft casing (25) to front and rear swivel joint casings (22) and (33), tighten coupling nuts (34), and torque 40 to 60 lb.in. Ensure that nuts (39) on rear swivel joint casing (33) are loose to allow flexible shaft casing (25) to be centralized at center fireseal.
Tighten nuts (39) on rear swivel joint casing evenly, torque 80 to 100 lb.in., and lockwire (PWC05-089).

Position seals (32) pt6a38-761000-001-0340 1 on flexible shaft casing (25) at each side of center fireseal, followed by insulation (31) pt6a38-761000-001-0330 2 . Secure seals, insulation, and retaining plates (30) pt6a38-761000-001-0320 2 to center fireseal with two bolts (28) pt6a38-761000-001-0360 2 and nuts, with angle bracket (29) pt6a38-761000-001-0350 1 located under head of lower bolt pt6a38-761000-001-0390 1 . Tighten nuts pt6a38-761000-001-0400 1 until firm contact is made plus 180 degrees. Foil side of insulation should be adjacent to seal.

Secure clamps on flexible shaft casing (25) and thermocouple trim harness (27) pt6a38-772001-003-0010 1 with bolt (26) and nut. Tighten nut and torque 32 to 36 lb.in. Check alignment and ensure that bending loads are not applied to parts. Preceding step should be accomplished following complete installation of trim harness (Ref. Para. ).

Insert end of wire rope (24) pt6a38-761000-002-0120 1 into rear swivel joint casing (33), through flexible shaft casing (25), and into front swivel joint casing (22), until rear push-pull terminal (18) pt6a38-761000-002-0050 1 is completely over sleeve of rear swivel joint casing.
Slide front push-pull terminal (21) pt6a38-761000-002-0070 1 over wire rope (24) and over sleeve of front swivel joint casing (22).

Screw ball end (23) pt6a38-761000-002-0040 1 on wire rope (24) until approximately 5/8 inch of wire rope extends from ball end. Position push-pull control terminal (4) pt6a38-761000-002-0100 1 over end of wire rope to make contact with ball end and check that wire rope is installed far enough in control terminal by viewing through inspection hole. Adjust ball end as necessary.

Hold push-pull control terminal (4) against ball end (23) and screw front push-pull terminal (21) on control terminal to clamp ball end. Tighten front push-pull terminal, torque 40 to 50 lb.in., and lockwire (PWC05-089).
Install locknut and rod end clevis (3) pt6a38-761000-002-0015 1 on push-pull control terminal (4). Do not tighten nut at this stage.

procedure.title: Install Front Linkage (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Install guide pin bracket (11) pt6a38-761000-003-0250 1 on reduction gearbox thrust bearing cover flange at stud positions 2 and 3 o'clock (viewed from front). Secure bracket with existing flange self-locking nuts, discard washers (Ref. 72-10-00, SUB-ASSEMBLY); torque nuts 145 to 165 lb.in.

Check that propeller-supply carbon slipper block (11) is installed on propeller reversing lever (2) pt6a38-761000-003-0200 1 and press bushing (10) pt6a38-761000-003-0220 1 into center hole of lever. Check that slipper block spindle rotates freely in lever.

Position carbon slipper block (11) in test cell propeller feed back ring and insert center bosses of propeller reversing lever (2) into clevis on Beta valve plunger (6) of propeller governor (7). Secure lever in clevis with pin (8) pt6a38-761000-003-0210 1 , washer pt6a38-761000-003-0230 1 , and cotterpin pt6a38-761000-003-0240 1 .

Set push-pull control in fully forward position, ensure that governor reset arm (15) is on maximum stop, and hold Beta valve plunger (6) with base of slot in clevis flush with outer rim of valve stop nut. With parts positioned as stated, adjust length of interconnecting rod (12) pt6a38-761000-003-0150 1 to align centers of rod end connectors with outer hole in reset arm and hole in push-pull control terminal (4), respectively. Tighten nuts at rod end connectors, torque 32 to 36 lb. in., and lockwire (PWC05-089) each nut to adjacent connector.

Secure lower end of interconnecting rod (12) to outer hole in reset arm (15) with bolt (16) pt6a38-761000-003-0040 1 , washer pt6a38-761000-003-0050 1 , and castellated nut. Secure upper end of rod to push-pull control terminal (4) with bolt (14), washers, spacer (13) and castellated nut, installing spacer between terminal and rod end connector. Tighten nuts, torque 24 to 36 lb.in., back off each nut to align nearest locking hole, and install cotterpins pt6a38-761000-003-0070 1 .

Set push-pull control in fully forward position, pull propeller reversing lever (2) forward, and adjust clevis (3) on push-pull control terminal (4) to align holes in clevis with hole in upper end of lever. Tighten lock nut against clevis (3), torque 65 to 85 lb.in., and lockwire (PWC05-089) nut to clevis.

Press spacer (9) into upper hole in propeller reversing lever (2) and secure lever in clevis (3) with bolt (5) pt6a38-761000-003-0160 1 and castellated nut pt6a38-761000-003-0170 1 . Tighten nut, torque 24 to 36 lb.in., and install cotterpin pt6a38-761000-003-0120 1 .

Pull forward on propeller reversing lever (2) and rotate input lever (1) to position shoulder pin (50) at maximum power in forward end of slot in propeller control cam (19). With parts held in positions stated, adjust rod end clevis (17) pt6a38-761000-002-0010 1 to align holes in clevis with center hole in control cam (19) so that pin (20) pt6a38-761000-001-0190 1 will slip through aligned holes.
Lengthen push-pull control by winding clevis (17) out one half turn and tighten locknut against clevis. Torque nut 65 to 85 lb. in., and lockwire (PWC05-089) nut to clevis.
Secure clevis (17) to center hole of propeller control cam (19) with pin (20), washer, and cotterpin.

procedure.title: Installation Checks
procedure.step: Check for full and free movement by operating input lever.
Ensure that all jam nuts are lockwired and cotterpins installed in castellated nuts.

procedure.title: Propeller Governor Pneumatic Tubes (Ref. Figs. )
procedure.step:
On completion of overhaul, remove all protective materials introduced (Ref. 73-10-08), and proceed as follows: Install bulkhead tube coupling pt6a38-731008-001-0130 1 (26, Fig. ) in center fireseal, towards rear and secure with jam nut (27) pt6a38-731008-001-0120 1 . Tighten nut, torque 38 to 42 lb. in., and lockwire (PWC05-089). Install heated tube assembly (1) pt6a38-731008-001-0010 1 between FCU and bulkhead coupling tube. Carefully position tube in relevant hole or slot in rear fireseal. Install
air line seal (34) pt6a38-731008-001-0040 1 , seal insulation (33) pt6a38-731008-001-0030 1 and seal retaining plate (32) pt6a38-731008-001-0020 1 on both ends of tube. Secure tube assembly to FCU and bulkhead coupling with coupling nuts. Tighten nuts, and torque 90 to 100 lb.in. Do not lockwire at this stage. Seals and insulation are slit for ease of assembly. Foil side of insulation to be adjacent to seal. Position slits diametrically opposite. Position seal retaining plate (35) pt6a38-731008-001-0045 1 (if applicable) over tube assembly (1) adjacent to rear fireseal so that the joggled portion of retaining plate fits into fireseal slot. Slide seals (34), insulation (33) and retaining plates (32) up to rear fireseal and seal retaining plate (35) and secure with two bolts (31) pt6a38-731008-001-0060 2 and self-locking nuts pt6a38-731008-001-0050 2 . Bolt heads are to be forward, on air inlet side. Tighten nuts and torque until firm contact is made plus 180 degrees. Route electrical lead (22) of rear heated tube (1) over accessory gearbox housing and secure to brackets (17) pt6a38-761000-001-0090 1 and (23) pt6a38-731008-001-0092 1 with loop clamps (18) pt6a38-731008-001-0070 1 and (20) pt6a38-731008-001-0070 1 . Secure clamps with nuts and bolts (19) pt6a38-731008-001-0060 1 and (21) pt6a38-731008-001-0080 1 . Tighten nuts and torque 36 to 40 lb.in. DELETED. DELETED. Install front tube pt6a38-731008-001-0115 1 (2 Fig. ) or (3112) tube and check valve assembly (4) pt6a38-731008-001-0260 1 , (5) pt6a38-731008-001-0220 1 , and (6) pt6a38-731008-001-0250 1 between bulkhead tube coupling (26) pt6a38-731008-001-0130 1 at center fireseal and straight nipple at propeller governor. Secure tube assembly to coupling tube and straight nipple with coupling nuts. Tighten nuts and torque 90 to 100 lb. in. Do not lockwire at this stage. On applicable engines, install air pressure tube (3) pt6a38-731008-001-0270 1 between tee coupling on front tube (2) or (4) and optional torque limiter. Secure tube with coupling nuts. Tighten nuts and torque 90 to 100 lb.in. If torque limiter is not fitted, install blanking cap at tee coupling and torque 90 to 100 lb.in.

Depending on tubing arrangement (Ref. Fig. ), install clamps as follows: PT6A-41 engines: Position
loop clamp (29) pt6a38-731003-001-0040 1 on front tube (2) and corresponding loop clamp on propeller reversing linkage casing adjacent to flange C, and secure with bolt (28), spacer (30) and self-locking nut. Tighten nut and torque 36 to 40 lb.in. PT6A-41 and -42 engines: Position loop clamp (15) pt6a38-731008-001-0101 1 on front tube (2) or (4) and secure to
bracket (16) pt6a38-731008-001-0104 1 , attached to flange A, with bolt (14) pt6a38-731008-001-0102 1 and self-locking nut. Tighten nut and torque 36 to 40 lb.in. Position loop clamp (11) pt6a38-731008-001-0140
on front tube (2) or (4) and secure to bracket (12) pt6a38-731008-001-0135 1 , attached to flange C, with bolt (13) pt6a38-731008-001-0150 1 and self-locking nut pt6a38-731008-001-0170 1 . Tighten nut and torque 36 to 40 lb.in. PT6A-41 (3112) engines: Position loop clamp (9) pt6a38-731008-001-0230 1 on body of check valve (6) pt6a38-731008-001-0250 1 and secure to bracket (8) pt6a38-731008-001-0240 1 , attached to flange C, with bolt (7) and self-locking nut. Tighten nut and torque 30 to 40 lb.in. PT6A-38 (3049) engines: Secure loop clamp (25) pt6a38-731008-002-0200 1 to swivel joint retaining plate attached to engine lifting bracket on flange A with bolt (24) pt6a38-731008-002-0210 1 and self-locking nut. Torque nut 36 to 40 lb.in. Do not lockwire components until completion of pressure test. Pressure test pneumatic tubes (Ref. Para. ).

key.def: Torque Limiter Pneumatic Tube - (engines incorporating torque limiter)
Cap, Tee-connector (engines not incorporating torque limiter)
Bracket (Attaches to control lever mounting bracket of rear linkage and boss cover on AGB.

procedure.title: Compressor Discharge (P3) Pneumatic Line (3012) (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Remove all protective treatment from pneumatic line components, applied during overhaul.

Install adapter assembly (PT6A-38 and 3012) as follows: Install adapter assembly (18) pt6a38-731007-002-0090 1 , insulation (19) pt6a38-731007-002-0140 1 and seal (20) pt6a38-731007-002-0150 1 on rear side of rear fireseal. Install
plate (21) pt6a38-731007-002-0130 1 on front side of fireseal, and secure assembly with two self-locking nuts (22) pt6a38-731007-002-0100 2 . Torque nuts to obtain firm contact of components, then continue further 180 degrees rotation.

Install heated rear tube assembly (PT6A-38 and 3012) as follows: Install rear tube assembly (14) between fuel control unit and adapter assembly (18). Connect both coupling nuts (1) pt6a38-731007-001-0040 1 , and torque 90 to 100 lb.in. If 3059 is embodied, remove fuel pump retaining nut (3) pt6a38-731007-001-0230 1 and plain washer. Install angle bracket (5) pt6a38-731007-002-0300 1 on pump mounting stud, and secure with nut (3); omit plain washer. Torque nut 75 to 85 lb.in. Secure loop clamp (6) pt6a38-731007-002-0270 1 to bracket (5) with bolt (4) pt6a38-731007-002-0280 2 and self-locking nut (7) pt6a38-731007-002-0290 2 . Torque nut 36 to 40 lb.in. Secure heater cable (17) pt6a38-731008-002-0010 1 to flange G with two loop clamps (16) pt6a38-731007-002-0220 2 and self-locking nuts (15) pt6a38-731007-002-0230 2 . Torque nuts 36 to 40 lb.in. Connect heater cable conductors to electrical connector pins (Ref. Para. , following).

Install front tube assembly, as follows: Install front tube assembly (12) pt6a38-731007-002-0040 1 between
adapter assembly (18) pt6a38-731007-002-0090 1 (PT6A-38, and PT6A-41 (3012) engines), or alternatively,
compressor air filter (13) pt6a38-731007-001-0133 1 , and flange mounting on gas generator case. Secure tube flange and gasket (10) pt6a38-731007-002-0030 1 with two bolts (11) pt6a38-731007-002-0020 2 , and connect coupling nut (1). Leave bolts and coupling loose at this stage. 3059; install support bracket (9) pt6a38-731007-001-0260 1 on compressor inlet case flange F with two
self-locking nuts (8) pt6a38-722000-002-0440 2 . Torque nuts 32 to 36 lb.in. Tube connections and loop clamp (if fitted) will be installed and torqued after pressure test of pneumatic lines.

figure.title: Installation of Compressor Discharge Pneumatic Line

key.def: Compressor Air Filter Housing (3012 and PT6A-42/-42A)

procedure.title: Compressor Discharge (P3) Pneumatic Line ( 3012) (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Remove all protective treatment from pneumatic line components, applied during overhaul.

Install unheated rear tube assembly (3012 and PT6A-42/-42A) as follows: Install rear tube assembly (2) pt6a38-731007-002-0040 1 between fuel control unit and compressor air filter housing (13) pt6a38-731007-001-0133 1 connections. Connect both coupling nuts (1), and torque 90 to 100 lb. in. 3059; remove fuel pump retaining nut (3) pt6a38-731007-001-0230 1 and plain washer. Install angle bracket (5) pt6a38-731007-001-0300 1 on pump mounting stud, and secure with nut (3); omit plain washer. Torque nut 75 to 85 lb.in. Secure loop clamp (6) pt6a38-731007-001-0270 1 to bracket (5) with bolt (4) pt6a38-731007-001-0280 2 and self-locking nut (7) pt6a38-731007-001-0290 2 . Torque nut 36 to 40 lb.in.

Install front tube assembly, as follows: Install front tube assembly (12) pt6a38-731007-002-0010 1 between
adapter assembly (18) pt6a38-731007-002-0090 1 , or alternatively, compressor air filter (13), and flange mounting on gas generator case. Secure tube flange and gasket (10) pt6a38-731007-002-0030 1 with two bolts (11) pt6a38-731007-002-0020 2 , and connect coupling nut (1). Leave bolts and coupling loose at this stage. 3059; install support bracket (9) pt6a38-731007-001-0260 1 on compressor inlet case flange F with two self-locking nuts (8) pt6a38-722000-002-0440 2 . Torque nuts 32 to 36 lb.in. Tube connections and loop clamp (if fitted) will be installed and torqued after pressure test of pneumatic lines.

procedure.title: Electrical Connector Receptacle for Heated Pneumatic Lines (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Procedure relocated to 73-10-08 REPAIR..

figure.title: Electrical Connector for Heated Pneumatic Line

procedure.title: Pressure Test Pneumatic Tubes (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: On completion of installation of pneumatic lines, pressure test as follows: Remove bolts (11) and disconnect coupling nut (1) of front tube assembly (12). Remove tube assembly and gasket (10) from engine. Connect open port of adapter assembly (18) or compressor air filter housing (13), as applicable, to a clean, dry compressed air supply regulated at 80 plus/minus 5 psig. Apply leak-detecting fluid (PWC05-007) over all connection points in the pneumatic system, and inspect for leaks. No leakage, other than from two bleed holes in fuel control unit, one bleed hole in propeller governor, and one bleed hole in torque limiter (where fitted), is permitted. Rectify any non-permissible leakage and repeat pressure test. When pressure test is satisfactory, wipe off all traces of detecting fluid. Disconnect air pressure supply. Install front tube assembly (12) and new gasket (10). Connect coupling nut, and install bolts (11). Torque coupling 90 to 100 lb.in., and flange bolts (REF. NO. 1265, Fits and Clearances). If 3059 is embodied, secure loop clamp (6) of front tube assembly (12) to support bracket (9) with bolt (4) and self-locking nut (7). Torque nut 32 to 36 lb. in. Wirelock all coupling nuts in pneumatic system, but leave flange bolts (11) unlocked. Re-torque and wirelock these bolts after engine test (PWC05-089).

procedure.title: T5 Trim Thermocouple and Thermocouple Block (3316) (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Apply a thin even film of jointing compound (PWC09-005) to each side of gasket (9) pt6a38-772001-003-0140 1 .

Install gasket (9) on gas generator case mounting boss (10), and install T5 thermocouple terminal block (8) pt6a38-772001-003-0120 1 with AL (alumel) terminal post to rear of engine. Secure parts with two bolts (7) pt6a38-772001-003-0130 2 (3135) or two self-locking bolts (7) (3135), and torque 32 to 36 lb. in. 3135 bolt; lockwire (PWC05-089). Wipe of excess jointing compound.

Connect T5 harness lead terminals to AL (alumel) and CR (chromel) terminal posts of terminal block (8) and secure with
bolts pt6a38-772001-003-0110 pt6a38-772001-003-0110 1 (3114) or nuts (3114) (5) pt6a38-772001-003-0115 1 and (6) pt6a38-772001-003-0105 1 . 3039 and 3373; the class of trim thermocouple is determined from data established during engine testing.

3039; insert trim thermocouple (1) pt6a38-772001-003-0010 1 through center fireseal (from front), and secure flange and protective cover (13) pt6a38-772001-003-0050 1 to fireseal with two bolts (12) pt6a38-772001-003-0060 2 and self-locking nuts pt6a38-772001-003-0070 2 . Make sure bolt heads are on rear side of fireseal, then torque nuts 36 to 40 lb.in.

3039 and 3373; insert trim thermocouple (1) pt6a38-772001-003-0010 1 through center fireseal (from front), and secure to fireseal with two bolts (12) pt6a38-772001-003-0060 2 and self-locking nuts pt6a38-772001-003-0070 1 . Make sure bolt heads are on rear side of fireseal, then torque nuts 36 to 40 lb. in.
Install loop clamp (2) pt6a38-772001-003-0080 1 onto probe, and secure to similar clamp on casing for reversing linkage mechanism with bolt and self-locking nut. Torque nut 36 to 40 lb. in.

Connect lugs of both harnesses (trim thermocouple (3) and T5 (4)) to respective AL (alumel) and CR (chromel) posts on terminal block (8). Secure lugs with bolts pt6a38-772001-003-0110 pt6a38-772001-003-0100 1 (3114) or nuts (3114) (5) pt6a38-772001-003-0115 1 and (6) pt6a38-772001-003-0105 1 ; do not torque at this stage (Ref. Testing).

figure.title: T5 Trim Thermocouple and T5 Terminal Block

key.def: Protective Cover - PT6A-41 (3039 and 3373), PT6A-42 (3373) and PT6A-42A (3373)
Trim Resistor Access Hole - PT6A-41 (3039 and 3373), PT6A-42 (3373) and PT6A-42A (3373)

procedure.title: T5 Trim Thermocouple and Thermocouple Block (3316) (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Apply a thin even film of jointing compound (PWC09-005) to each side of gasket (21) pt6a38-772001-003-0140 1 .

Install gasket (21) on gas generator case mounting boss, and install cover (20) pt6a38-772001-003-0145 1 . Secure parts with two bolts (19) pt6a38-772001-003-0130 2 , and torque 32 to 36 lb. in.; lockwire (PWC05-089). Wipe of excess jointing compound.
Install the T5 thermocouple terminal (18) pt6a38-772001-003-0160 1 and secure with two bolts (22) pt6a38-723004-001-0210 2 and nuts (17) pt6a38-723004-001-0220 2 . Torque nuts 36 to 40 lb.in.

Connect T5 harness lead terminals to AL (alumel) and CR (chromel) terminal posts of thermocouple terminal (18) and secure with nuts (15) and (16). 3039 and 3373; the class of trim thermocouple is determined from data established during engine testing.

3039; insert trim thermocouple (1) pt6a38-772001-003-0010 1 through center fireseal (from front), and secure flange and protective cover (13) pt6a38-772001-003-0050 1 to fireseal with two bolts (12) pt6a38-772001-003-0060 2 and self-locking nuts pt6a38-772001-003-0070 2 . Make sure bolt heads are on rear side of fireseal, then torque nuts 36 to 40 lb.in.

3039 and 3373; insert trim thermocouple (1) pt6a38-772001-003-0010 1 through center fireseal (from front), and secure to fireseal with two bolts (12) bolts (12) pt6a38-772001-003-0060 2 and
self-locking nuts pt6a38-772001-003-0070 2 . Make sure bolt heads are on rear side of fireseal, then torque nuts 36 to 40 lb. in.
Install loop clamp (2) onto probe, and secure to similar clamp on casing for reversing linkage mechanism with bolt and self-locking nut. Torque nut 36 to 40 lb. in.

Connect lugs of both harnesses (trim thermocouple (3) and T5 (4)) to respective AL (alumel) and CR (chromel) posts on thermocouple terminal block (18). Secure lugs with nuts (15) pt6a38-772001-003-0105 1 and (16) pt6a38-772001-003-0115 1 ; do not torque at this stage (Ref. Testing).

n-para.title: Installation of Power Section on Gas Generator Assembly after Unscheduled Overhaul (Ref. Fig. )

procedure.title: With Gas Generator Module (GGM) Mounted in Stand (PWC34300) or (PWC51140) or (PWC70907).
procedure.step: Remove caps from pressure and scavenge oil transfer tubes (12), and install new preformed packings on tubes.
Remove plugs from couplings (13) at flange C on power section.

Remove any protective covers installed after light overhaul. Make sure that gas generator case flange C, and power section exhaust duct flange C, are clean, free from nicks, scratches, dents and other potential seal deformities. Smear thin layer of jointing compound (PWC09-005) on exhaust duct flange prior to assembly.

Check and centralize interstage sealing rings on compressor turbine shroud housing to ensure smooth entry into mating surface of power turbine stator housing. Interstage sealing rings are positioned with gaps 180 degrees plus or minus 20 degrees apart with one gap at TDC. Two different sets of sealing rings can be used on the shroud housing. One set comprises one inner ring (P/N 3024311) and outer ring (3024310); the other comprises two identical sealing rings (P/N 3014660) in tandem.

Using hoist and sling (PWC32073) or (PWC34073), move power section carefully into position on gas generator case. Align pressure and scavenge oil transfer couplings with respective transfer tubes at rear of engine, and mate power section and gas generator case at flange C.

ENSURE FLANGE C OF GAS GENERATOR CASE AND EXHAUST DUCT ARE PARALLEL AND BOLT HOLES ARE ALIGNED. IF ASSEMBLIES DO NOT MATE FREELY, DO NOT USE FORCE. WITHDRAW POWER SECTION AND CHECK FOR CAUSE OF INTERFERENCE.Install bolts through mating flanges (heads at rear), and locate T5 thermocouple wiring harness clamp and governor pneumatic tube clamp bracket to flange C (Ref. Fig. 501, View on Flange C). Secure all bolts with self-locking nuts, tighten in diametric sequence and torque 36 to 40 lb.in. Wipe off excess jointing compound.

Temporarily remove bolts (3114) or nuts (3114) (5) and (6) (Ref. Fig. ) securing T5 trim harness thermocouple to terminal posts. Connect terminal lugs of T5 thermocouple wiring harness and T5 trim harness to appropriate terminal posts on terminal block (8).
Reinstall and torque bolt or nut (5) (chromel terminal) (REF. NO. 1267, Fits and Clearances), bolt or nut (6) (alumel terminal) (REF. NO. 1266, Fits and Clearances).

Connect coupling nut (5, Fig. ) at rear end of governor pneumatic tube assembly to bulkhead fitting (9) at center fireseal (10). Tighten coupling nuts, torque 90 to 100 lb.in., and lockwire (PWC05-089).

Install front swivel joint (6) of propeller reversing linkage in slot of front lifting bracket. Swing retaining plate over swivel joint and install inner bolt and nut. Tighten inner and outer nuts and torque 36 to 40 lb.in. Tighten front swivel joint locknut (7), torque 200 to 225 lb.in., and lockwire (PWC05-089).

Install spacer sleeve in propeller reversing lever (17), and locate clevis end of push-pull terminal (3) on propeller reversing lever. Secure with bolt and castellated nut. Tighten nut, torque 24 to 36 lb.in., and install cotterpin.
Locate governor interconnecting rod (4) on airbleed link of propeller governor (1), and secure with bolt, washer and castellated nut. Tighten nut, torque 24 to 36 lb.in., and install cotterpin.
Install new preformed packing on drain plug (14) and install plug in reduction gearbox drain boss; torque 200 to 225 lb in., and lockwire (PWC05-089).
Carry out power section checks (Ref. Testing).

figure.title: Installation of Power Section in Gas Generator Case after Unscheduled Overhaul

procedure.title: General
procedure.step: Immediately after satisfactory engine test, the following checks must be performed to ensure the integrity of all external components of the engine assembly.
Where wirelocking is specified, use correct size and type of lockwire (PWC05-089).
Reference to paragraphs in this chapter and other chapters will be made when it is necessary to obtain specific information on torque values, etc.

If a power section or power section module is removed for unsatisfactory test results, the first-stage power turbine shroud housing and sealing rings must be inspected and, if necessary, rectified (Ref. Subpara. , following).
Ensure power turbine classified vane ring is removed from a power section/power section module after test, and is retained with the gas generator module.

If test results are unsatisfactory, remove power section from the gas generator case; inspect first-stage power turbine stator housing and sealing rings and, if necessary, rectify (Ref. Para. , following).

procedure.title: Examine Exhaust Duct, Gas Generator Case, Center and Rear Fireseals, Inlet Area and Screen
procedure.step: Examine exhaust duct, fireseals and gas generator case for damage or dents. Check for security attachment flanges. If damage is caused by the engine being dropped during handling, refer to the appropriate light overhaul sections of this chapter.

Remove air inlet screen (Ref. 72-30-00, DISASSEMBLY), and conduct a thorough examination for foreign object damage (FOD) within the inlet case area. Replace inlet screen (Ref. 72-30-00, SUB-ASSEMBLY), and cover with a strip of waxed paper or other suitable material to exclude foreign matter from compressor.

procedure.title: Examine External Oil System Components and Tubes
procedure.step: Inspect scavenge oil pump for leakage. Check for security to accessory gearbox.
Examine oil-to-fuel heater and bypass valve (PT6A-41 and PT6A-42 only) for leakage. Check that attachment bolts and heater drain plug are lockwired.
Ensure main oil filter element is the original one installed during assembly. During engine testing, a slave filter is used. This must be removed after testing, and replaced with the original one.
Inspect No. 2 bearing scavenge oil tube for damage, security, and check retaining bolts are lockwired.
Inspect oil pressure tubes from accessory gearbox to propeller reduction gearbox for damage. Check torque values on tube flange, coupling and elbow retaining bolts, and lockwire (Ref. Para. ).
Check dipstick for security.
Check chip detector in propeller reduction gearbox for correct torque value, and lockwire (Ref. 72-10-00, SUB-ASSEMBLY).

procedure.title: Examine External Air System Components
procedure.step: Check propeller governor for security of attachment.
Check high and low pressure bleed-valve retaining bolts for correct torque values, and lockwire (Ref. 72-30-00, SUB-ASSEMBLY).
Inspect compressor delivery air tubes for damage, paying particular attention to tube insulation. Check torque values on tube nuts, nipple, adapter retaining nut, and lockwire (Ref. ).
Inspect governor pneumatic tubes from fuel control unit to propeller governor for damage. Check torque values, and lockwire (Ref. ).
Connect propeller reversing linkage, and lockwire (Ref. ).

procedure.title: Examine External Fuel System Components
procedure.step: Examine fuel pump for security to accessory gearbox and tightness of hose and line connections. Check lockwiring.
Examine fuel control unit for security to fuel pump, and tightness of hose and line connection. Check lockwiring.
Inspect flow divider and dump valve or flow divider and purge valve, check torque values of retaining bolts and lockwire (Ref. 72-30-00, SUB-ASSEMBLY).

MAKE SURE ALL 14 MANIFOLD ADAPTER LOCKING PLATES ARE CORRECTLY INSTALLED.Inspect fuel manifold and transfer tubes for damage. Check torque values (3064) of manifold bolts and lockwire (Ref. 72-30-00, SUB-ASSEMBLY). It is not necessary to retorque manifold retaining bolts after check run (3064).
Check fuel drain valves for correct torque value, and lockwire (Ref. 72-30-00, ASSEMBLY).

procedure.title: Examine Temperature Indicating and Ignition System
procedure.step: Inspect ignition cables for security to spark igniters. Disconnect cables from ignition exciter, and protect ends with caps. Secure loose ends of cables to gas generator. The ignition exciter is protected in a sealed envelope and stored in engine container (Ref. Storage Instructions).
Re-check torque values of each spark igniter, and lockwire to ignition cables (Ref. 72-30-00, ASSEMBLY).

procedure.title: Power Turbine Stator Housing and Compressor Turbine Shroud Housing Sealing
procedure.step: If sealing contact between power turbine stator housing assembly and two sealing rings located in compressor turbine shroud housing assembly is suspect after engine run: With engine installed in stand, separate power section from gas generator assembly (Ref. Disassembly-1). Inspect inside diameter of first-stage power turbine stator housing for evidence of sealing ring contact. If less than 90% circumferential contact is evident, replace sealing rings and rectify stator housing (Ref. 72-50-03, REPAIR). Install power section in gas generator assembly (Ref. Para. ) Repeat engine performance test (Ref. Testing) and, if satisfactory, final engine checks.

procedure.title: Installation of T5 Trim Value Plate after Test (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: On completion of engine test, and prior to engine shipment, ensure that T5 trim value and value of NG/RTH at 750 (PT6A-38), 850 (PT6A-41 and -42) SHP/DELRTH recorded on engine test log sheet is properly stamped on trim value plate; install plates as follows: . Place engine data plate (2) on retaining plate (1) on inlet case (4) and secure with two blind rivets (5) at upper holes. Locate T5 trim value plate (3) over two lower holes in data plate (2) and secure to retaining plate with two blind rivets (5).

figure.title: Installation of T5 Trim Value and Engine Data Plates
