n-para.title: General
n-para.para: This section contains all Fits and Clearances applicable to engine final assembly procedures detailed in Chapter 72-00-00, ASSEMBLY. Personnel engaged in the measurement of Fits and Clearances must acquaint themselves with general procedures.

subpara.title: Inspection Frequency Requirement (IFR)
subpara.para: The term Inspection Frequency Requirement (IFR) is a system by which each fit, or clearance receives an inspection frquency rating (Ref. P&WA Standard Practices Manual, P/N 58005).

The letters A, B, C and D appearing in the IFR column indicate the recommended frequency of inspection.
A - Measure each component, fit or clearance at each overhaul or whenever affected parts are disassembled regardless of physical condition. Make a record of the results.
B - Make sure that the fit, clearance, torque or other special assembly requirement is correct at assembly, during every engine build. Deviations must be corrected.
C - Measure affected parts only if deviation is suspected or evident by visual examination.
D - Measure affected parts when repairing or replacing them.

subpara.title: Dimensional Checks
subpara.para: The DIMENSIONS FOR REF. column indicates minimum and maximum manufacturing dimensions of two mating parts. These dimensions are provided for information only.
The LIMITS column indicates the desired minimum and maximum fits and clearances between new parts, and also the allowable limit to which these parts may wear before replacement is necessary.
The letter T indicates a tight fit; L or no letter, a loose fit.
BY SELECTION means parts must be matched by selection to provide a required fit.
FIT TO means a fitting operation may be required at assembly to obtain the required fit.
An asterisk (*) indicates part(s) should be replaced if any looseness is evident.
Unless otherwise stated, all fits are diametrical. Spline fits are calculated from chordal dimensions.

The figures in the MINIMUM, MAXIMUM and REPLACE columns shall be interpreted:
Torque in pound-inches.
Spring pressures in pounds and ounces.
Vane areas in square inches.
Vane class figures correspond to a determined geometric area. When the REPLACE Column is left blank, the MIN. or MAX. limits apply, as required.

subpara.title: Torque Limits
subpara.para: Unless otherwise stated, apply thread lubricant to all parts that are to be torque-loaded.
Use engine lubricating oil (PWC03-001) or equivalent, unless otherwise specified.

Where torque limits for castle nuts are provided in the MINIMUM column only, these nuts should be tightened to the designated torque and then further tightened, if necessary, to properly align the locking slots and holes.

Where MINIMUM and MAXIMUM values are given, the alignment of the locking slot must be obtained without loosening the nut and without exceeding the maximum limit. If this is not possible, back-off the nut half a turn, then retighten. If alignment cannot be accomplished, select another nut.
Torque requirements for interference fit applications, such as studs, may be obtained with or without lubrication, unless otherwise specified.

entry.note: Tighten fingertight plus 45 degrees
Safety wire plug.
Tighten until firm contact plus 180 degrees.
Apply standard torque from 24 to 36 lb. in., then back off to align first slot with hole in bolt; assemble cotterpin.
Tigten bolts 15 to 20 lb. in., then retighten 32 to 36 lb. in., without loosening
Adjust nut to obtain 6 to 11 lb. in. torque, to lift handle when cap is installed in a slave adapter.
End of cable must extend beyond inspection hole.

general.para: The purpose of these instructions is to prove the integrity of repairs effected during normal scheduled or unscheduled overhaul and to ensure that engines will produce rated power within the required limits.

The classified first-stage power turbine vane ring returned with a gas generator module undergoing scheduled overhaul is (already) installed on the slave power section and the engine tested in accordance with instructions in this chapter.

Because the performance of a turbine engine is greatly affected by surrounding atmospheric conditions, it is essential that accurate values of actual barometric pressure and compressor air inlet temperature are obtained at time of engine testing. Because even the best instrumentation can vary its indication with use, it is recommended that all instruments are calibrated regularly.
All wet line pressure systems should be calibrated at the appropriate engine height.
Procedures and requirements and their applicability to either an engine, power section or gas generator are listed in Table .
Consumable materials and engine test equipment are listed below and referred to by part number in text.

consumables.para: The consumable materials listed below are used in the following procedures.
For alternate products, suppliers and suppliers addresses refer to Consumable Materials List P/N 3043340.

special-tools.para: The special tools listed below are used in the following procedures.

row.entry: Test cell static pressure, propeller installation (psia)

fixtures-and-equipment.para: The fixtures, equipment and supplier tools listed below are used in the following procedures.

row.entry: P/N 10-100-0464, Required for AGB vibration survey
P/N MS25038-04, Ng and Nf measurement

procedure.title: General
procedure.step: The test equipment required for PT6A-38/-41/-/42 and -42A engines is listed in Paras. and , and are referred to by item number in the text. For data reduction use program PWC83020.

Engine testing must be performed using a suitably correlated test stand. The requirements for overhaul test stand correlation can be obtained from Pratt & Whitney Canada, Customer Support Department. A condensed description of test cell correlation procedures and requirements is also contained in the Pratt & Whitney Test Facility Planning Manual, Part No. 3040888.

subpara.para:
Symbols and abbreviations (with computer style alternatives) designated for various stations within the engine, and for working variables used in engine testing, are as follows:
DEL(delta) Corrected Pam (in. Hg)/29.921
del P Engine Torquemeter Pressure minus static pressure, in. Hg
DELRTH(Delta Root Theta) Delta x Root Theta
del T5Untrimmed Tt5 minus Trimmed Tt5 Value (F°)
°F Degrees Fahrenheit
F°Fahrenheit Degrees
"G" Gravitational Constant
in. HgInches of Mercury
in. H20Inches of Water
MORManual Override
Nf (NF)Power Turbine Speed, rpm
Ng (NG) Gas Generator Speed, rpm
PamAmbient Barometric Pressure, in. Hg
POPPropeller Oil Pressure (psig)
PsgbReduction Gearbox Static Pressure, psig
PsnTest Cell Static Pressure, in. H20
Ps3 (PS3)Compressor Discharge Static Pressure, psig
°RDegrees Rankine (°F + 459.688)
RTH(Root Theta) Square Root of Theta
SFCSpecific Fuel Consumption, WF/DELRTH divided by SHP/DELRTH
SGSpecific Gravity of Fuel
SG BaseTurbine Meter Calibration Standard
shp (SHP)Shaft Horsepower, Nf x del P divided by 5272
Tf Fuel Temperature, °F
THTheta (Tt1 + 459.688)/518.688
TsgSG Fuel Sample Temperature, °F
Ttl Engine Inlet Temperature, °F
Tt5 (TT5)Interturbine Temperature, °F (°R)
Tt7 (TT7)Engine Exhaust Nozzle Temperature, °F (°R)
T5DCalculated Interturbine Temperature, °F (°R)
Wf (WF) Fuel Flow, pph

procedure.title: Prepare Engine/Propeller Controls (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Because reverse power is not used during engine test, controls associated with reverse power feature, i.e., FCU interconnect rod (1), propeller governor interconnect rod (4), and propeller reversing lever (2), are not installed until test is completed. (Ref. Final Assembly).

Secure unattached controls as follows: Push Beta valve (3) fully in, and place reset lever (5) in the fully forward position. Secure valve and lever in these positions with a suitable tension spring attached to each of the components.

procedure.title: Install Test Equipment (Ref. Figs through )
procedure.step: Install breather adapter fitting (PWC50383)on accessory gearbox; secure with two bolts; torque 32 to 36 lb. in.
Install overspeed governor (PWC32101-101), with gasket, on studs at left-hand side of reduction gearbox. Secure with four nuts and washers; torque 150 to 170 lb.in.
Install exhaust nozzles (PWC32090) on engine. Secure each nozzle with six bolts and nuts; torque 65 to 75 lb. in.

Install tachometer-generators Install Nf tachometer-generator MS25038-04, with gasket on propeller reduction gearbox housing. Install Ng tachometer unit (PWC50931) with gasket on AGB housing. Install Ng tachometer-generator MS25038-04 on tachometer unit. Secure with nuts and washers to housing, and torque 75 to 85 lb.in. Ng tachometer unit (PWC50931) for vibration survey using ACES Analyzer only. For vibration survey using other than ACES Analyzer, install Ng tachometer-generator MS25038-04 on AGB.
Install main oil pressure fitting (PWC50387) on right-hand side of accessory gearbox housing. Torque 375 to 425 lb. in.
Install torquemeter pressure fitting (PWC50387) on right-hand side of reduction gearbox or to torque limiter when equipped with limiter. Torque fitting 375 to 425 lb.in.
Install torquemeter static adapter (PWC50392) on left-hand side of reduction gearbox. Secure with two bolts; torque 32 to 36 lb. in.
Install propeller oil pressure fitting (PWC32105) or (PWC50391) on the overspeed governor pad. Torque bolts 150 to 170 lb.in. Propeller oil pressure adapter is required for dynamometer testing only.
Remove one fuel nozzle retaining bolt from gas generator case. Install Ps3 adapter (PWC30136) through flange of fuel nozzle into bolt hole. Torque adapter 25 to 30 lb. in.
Install fuel inlet temperature thermocouples (PWC30814). Torque 65 to 75 lb.in.
Install oil inlet temperature thermocouple probe (PWC30814) in boss on right side of engine accessory gearbox. Torque 65 to 75 lb. in.
Install Tt1 thermocouple harness (PWC30514-52) on engine gas generator. Torque bolts 7 to 9 lb. in.

Remove two bolts, washers and nuts from flange A of propeller reduction gearbox at the 6 o'clock position. Install vibration bracket pickup assembly (PWC70146) at the rear of flange A and secure with two bolts, washers and nuts. Torque bolts 36 to 40 lb.in.

Install AGB vibration bracket: Propeller Stand Installation or Dynamometer Stand Installation - (PWC70326) Mounting Arrangement: Install bracket (PWC50578) on mounting pad. Secure with bolts (MS9530-08), and torque 60 to 72 lb.in. On Dynamometer Stand Installation - (PWC32478)Mounting Arrangement: Remove AGB drain plug. Install bracket (PWC51495) with packing (AS3208-08). Torque bracket 220 to 225 lb.in.

For vibration survey using ACES Analyzer (Ref. Fig. ) Attach cable to accelerometer (3), and connect to charge converter box. Attach cable to the charge converter box and to the ACES Analyzer velocity connection. Attach tachometer cable to tachometer unit (PWC50931), and connect to the tachometer matching box. Attach tachometer matching box connector to the ACES Analyzer tachometer connection with interface cable.
For vibration survey using ACES Analyzer with B&K 2635 Charge Amplifier (Ref. Fig. , Detail A): Attach cable to accelerometer, and connect to charge amplifier.
For a permanent record of vibration survey, attach printer and printer cable to ACES Analyzer.

On the propeller test stand installation (Ref. Fig. ): Install Ps1 fitting (PWC32457) on the rear face of the gas generator firewall at 12 o' clock position. Make sure the opening of the Ps1 fitting is facing the engine. Attach Ps1 fitting with two bolts, washers and nuts. Torque bolts 36 to 40 lb.in.

procedure.title: Removal from Assembly Stand and Install in Propeller Test Stand (Ref. Fig. ):
procedure.step: Attach hoist to lifting eye (1) (PWC32117). on engine mount ring (2). Take up slack on hoist chain.
Remove bolts (7) and washers (6) securing engine mount ring (2) to adapters (5) on assembly stand (4).
Ensure that mount pads (PWC32080) are installed on mount ring (PWC32081) and secured to gas generator case. Torque 365 to 395 lb. in., and 225 to 250 lb. in., respectively.
Hoist engine, complete with mount ring, and secure to test stand with five bolts and nuts. Torque nuts 800 to 900 lb. in. and lock with cotterpins.
Disconnect hoist and move it clear of test area.

procedure.title: Install Propeller
procedure.step: Install propeller (PWC32100-104) with preformed packing on propeller reduction gearbox shaft on engine and secure with eight retaining bolts.
Torque retaining bolts 600 to 730 lb. in. and wirelock with single strand of lockwire (PWC05-089).

procedure.title: Removal from Assembly Stand and Install on Dynamometer Stand Installation - (PWC32478) Mounting Arrangement (Ref. Fig. ):
procedure.step: Remove 22 bolts, washers and nuts from flange A of propeller reduction gearbox. Install engine mount ring (2) (PWC32083) on front of flange A and secure with 22 special slave bolts MS9518-20 and nuts P/N 3012675. Tighten nuts diametrically opposite in sequence and torque 36 to 40 lb. in.

Remove nut (7), washer (6) and bolt (11) from bracket assembly (4) (PWC30591). Secure bracket (5) to accessory gearbox mount pad with three washers (8) and bolts (9). Tighten bolts, torque 140 lb. in. and wirelock (PWC05-089).
Attach hoist and lifting eye (PWC32117) to mount ring on assembly stand. Take up slack on hoist chain.
Remove bolts and washers securing mount ring to adapters on stand.
Install preformed packing (19) (MS9388-328) on plug (18) (PWC50395) and insert plug into propeller shaft.
Hoist engine and lower into dynamometer stand.
Secure bracket (5) to struts (10) with bolt (11), washer (6) and nut (7); torque nut 500 lb. in.

Secure engine mount ring (2) to left-side (port) mount (3) (PWC32305-100) and to right-side (starboard) mount (1) (PWC32304-100) with bolts (12), spacers (13) and (14) and nuts (15); tighten nuts and torque 4000 lb.in.
Disconnect hoist and move it clear of test area.
Connect coupling shaft to propeller shaft flange and secure with eight bolts (21) and nuts (20); tighten nuts and torque 1500 lb. in.

procedure.title: Install Engine on Dynamometer Stand - (PWC70326) Mounting Arrangement
procedure.step: Attach hoist and lifting bracket (PWC50373) to mount ring (PWC70331) on assembly stand. Take up slack on hoist chain.
Remove bolts and washers securing engine mount ring to adapters on assembly stand (Ref. Storage Instructions).
Make sure that mount pads are installed to mount ring (PWC70331) and secure to gas generator case. Torque 350 to 400 lb. in. and 225 to 300 lb. in. respectively.
Install propeller shaft plug (PWC50395).
Hoist engine, complete with mount ring and secure to mount ring adapter (PWC70327). Torque bolts to 750 lb. in. and lockwire.
Mate engine propeller shaft to adapter flange (PWC70329-01). Torque bolts to 600 to 650 lb. in. and lockwire.

procedure.title: Connect Test Stand Controls
procedure.step: Connect propeller speed control linkage on test stand to speed control lever on engine propeller governor. This step of procedure is not required on dynamometer stand.
Connect control linkage on test stand to condition lever on top of fuel control unit (PT6A-41/-42 and -42A engines only).
Connect power control linkage on test stand to cambox on accessory gearbox.
Check for freedom of movement and range of controls. Adjust test stand linkage as necessary.

procedure.title: Connect Test Cell Plumbing and Instrumentation
procedure.step: For location of test cell connections, refer to (Figs. through ) and Para. preceding.
Install oil scavenge-to-cooler elbow fitting (PWC32113) between engine scavenge pump outlet and oil cooler inlet line.
Connect test cell oil cooler return oil line at 12 o'clock position on compressor inlet case. Torque 900 to 1000 lb. in.
Connect engine breather tube to breather adapter on accessory gearbox using worm-drive hose clamp.
Connect fuel inlet line (incorporating fuel inlet thermocouple) (PWC30814) to oil-to-fuel heater. Torque 450 to 500 lb. in.
Install BOV probes (PWC50933-01) on each bleed valve (Ref. Fig.)
Connect engine ignition leads to ignition exciter. Tighten fingertight, then a further 45 degrees.
Connect starter cables.
Connect drain lines to the following: Fuel pump. Starter-generator seal activity. Flow divider and dump valve (3199). Gas generator case FCU drain to atmosphere.

SECURE ALL INSTRUMENTATION LINES AND LEADS TO PREVENT CHAFING OR CONTACT WITH HOT PARTS OF ENGINE.Connect the following: Torquemeter pressure line. Torquemeter static line. Main oil pressure sensing line. Main oil inlet temperature thermocouple lead. When tightening electrical lead connectors, turn fingertight plus a further 45 degrees. Scavenge oil pressure sensing line. Scavenge oil temperature thermocouple lead. Pressure sensing line and temperature thermocouple lead in steps and preceding, are connected to oil pressure and temperature fittings incorporated in oil scavenge-to-cooler elbow (Ref. step preceding). Overspeed governor reset solenoid lead. Reduction gearbox oil pressure sensing line, if required. P3 pressure line. Tt1 and Tt7 harness leads. Test cell leads, and leads A and B of potentiometer, located in test cell control room, to Tt5 terminals 1 and 2 on engine (Ref. Fig. ). Ensure terminal bolts are long enough to accommodate additional terminal lugs; if not, replace with longer bolts. Ng and Nf tachometer-generator lead. Magnetic chip detector lead. Vibration bracket pickup assembly lead. Flow divider and purge valve (3199) accumulator line.
Remove engine oil filter using puller (PWC30556) and replace with slave filter element of identical part number.
Ensure that thermocouple (PWC32449) and probe (PWC34297) are correctly installed.

Install fuel collector (PWC64453) on the dump side of the fuel flow divider. If the engine is equipped with an ecological fuel flow divider, accumulator (PWC50524) is to be installed on the dump side of the fuel flow divider.

procedure.title: Fill Engine Oil Tank:
procedure.step: Unlock filler cap on accessory gearbox housing and withdraw gage/dipstick from filler tube.

DO NOT MIX DIFFERENT BRANDS, VISCOSITIES OR SPECIFICATIONS OF OIL AS THEIR DIFFERENT CHEMICAL STRUCTURES CAN MAKE THEM INCOMPATIBLE.Add oil (PWC03-001) to tank until level (cold) is at the MAX. COLD marking on gage/dipstick. During depreservation and motoring runs, oil tank will become depleted owing to filling of engine system and propeller dome. Oil level at all future replenishments after engine power runs should be maintained at MAX. HOT level on dipstick.
Replace filler cap and gage/dipstick and lock securely.

procedure.title: Depreservation of Fuel System
procedure.step: Fuel systems preserved with oil for storage purposes must be purged before starting a wet or dry motoring cycle. Disconnect fuel line at inlet of flow divider and dump valve (3199) or flow divider and purge valve (3199), as applicable, for drainage into a suitable container. Ensure ignition switch is OFF. Open test cell fuel valve, and switch fuel pump ON. Place propeller control lever at FEATHER and power control lever at TAKE-OFF (fully open). OBSERVE STARTER MOTOR OPERATING LIMITS (REFER TO STARTER MANUFACTURER'S MANUAL). Motor engine while retarding power control lever to IDLE then advancing it to TAKE-OFF. Repeat as necessary until clean fuel flows from open line. Set power control lever at FUEL CUT-OFF, switch fuel supply pump OFF, and close test cell fuel valve. Reconnect fuel line to flow divider and dump valve (3199) or flow divider and purge valve (3199), as applicable, and secure line attachment points.

procedure.title: Torque Limiter (if fitted)
procedure.note: To permit engine testing through out the entire power range, the torque limiter Py line shall be disconnected.
procedure.step: Remove the Py line between line junction and torque limiter. (Ref. Fig.)
Blank off torque limiter and Py line junction openings.

Oil Inlet Temperature Thermocouple and Lead

Removal / Installation in Dynamometer Test Stand - (PWC32478) Mounting Arrangement

graphic.annot: PT6A-40 and Post-SB3039 and Pre-SB3373 Engines
PT6A-40 and Post-SB3039 and Pre-SB3373 Engines
PT6A-40 and Post-SB3039 and Pre-SB3373 Engines

procedure.title: Prestart Checks
procedure.step: Ensure that engine test installation is clear of all loose nuts, bolts, tools or other foreign objects.
Remove all loose objects from test cell floor.
Recheck engine and propeller controls for full travel.

procedure.title: Wet Motoring Run
procedure.step: Position controls as follows: Ignition switch OFF. Test cell fuel valve OPEN. Fuel supply pump switch ON. Confirm fuel inlet pressure is not less than 5 psig. Propeller control lever at FEATHER. Power control lever at fuel CUT-OFF.
Place starter switch ON. Motor engine with starter until a steady state gas generator speed of approximately 7000 Ng and oil pressure of 30 psig (minimum) is attained.
Advance power control lever to ground idle detent position for a maximum of 10 seconds.
Record fuel flow rate, which must be 90 to 120 pounds per hour before a start attempt is made. If not within this range, reject FCU.
Retard power control lever to fuel CUT-OFF.
Place starter switch OFF.

During engine rundown, check operation of flow divider and dump valve (3199) and gas generator case drain valves, or flow divider and purge valve (3199), as applicable. Listen for unusual noises such as scraping or rubbing sounds. If any such noise is heard, determine location and possible cause; rectify (Ref. Light Overhaul).
Note and record engine rundown time (minimum 20 seconds).
Close fuel valve and place fuel pump switch OFF.
Check for fuel and oil leakage; rectify as necessary.
Perform dry motoring run (Ref. Para. following).

procedure.title: Dry Motoring Run
procedure.step: This procedure is used whenever it is necessary to remove internally trapped fuel and fuel vapor or if there is evidence of fire within the engine. Air passing through the engine serves to purge fuel/fuel vapor from the combustion section, power turbine and exhaust system.
Position controls as follows: Ignition switch OFF. Test cell fuel valve OPEN. Fuel supply pump switch ON. Propeller control lever at FEATHER. Power control lever at fuel CUT-OFF.
Place starter switch ON and motor engine for a maximum of 10 seconds to expel fuel and fuel vapors. Switch starter OFF, close fuel valve and place fuel supply pump switch at OFF.
Recheck engine oil level and, if necessary, replenish tank to MAX. COLD level.

procedure.title: Engine Starting
procedure.caution: ALLOW SUFFICIENT STARTER COOLING PERIOD BETWEEN MOTORING CYCLES AND ENGINE START (REFER TO STARTER MANUFACTURER'S LIMITS AND RECOMMENDATIONS).

THE ENGINE MUST START AND REACH IDLE WITHIN 35 SECONDS OF INITIATION OF THE START. THE FIRST START OF THE DAY CAN SOMETIMES TAKE LONGER; THEREFORE, THE START TIME MUST BE CORRECTED TO COMPENSATE FOR LONG TIME TO LIGHT. FOR TTL GREATER THAN 3 SECONDS: TTI MODIFIED = TTI RECORDED - (TTL - 3 SECONDS). IF THIS REQUIREMENT IS NOT ACHIEVED, REFER TO NOTE BELOW.
procedure.note: If the engine does not meet the above requirement, check the FCU pneumatic system for leaks. If no leaks are found, replace the FCU.
procedure.step: Position controls as follows: Ignition switch OFF. Starter switch OFF. Power control lever at GROUND IDLE. Propeller control lever at FEATHER. Test cell fuel valve OPEN. Fuel supply switch ON. Confirm that fuel inlet pressure is not less than 5 psig.

IF Tt5 OBSERVED EXCEEDS 1600°F OR CONTINUOUS FLAME ISSUES FROM THE EXHAUST, SHUT OFF START CONTROL LEVER IMMEDIATELY. DO NOT ATTEMPT TO RELIGHT ON RUNDOWN, BUT WAIT UNTIL THE ENGINE COMES TO REST, THEN DO A DRY MOTORING CYCLE TO COOL THE ENGINE.Simultaneously, place starter and ignition switches to ON and, when Ng attains 4500 rpm, advance power control lever to RUN.

Observe that engine lights and after engine has accelerated smoothly to GROUND-IDLE 19750 to 20250 rpm Ng (PT6A-38 engines) or 21125 to 21625 rpm Ng (PT6A-41/-42 and -42A engines), return ignition and starter switches to OFF.

procedure.title: Unsatisfactory Start
procedure.step: If one or more of the following conditions occur during engine starting, shut down engine immediately. Anticipatory action is to be taken, whenever possible, to prevent engine temperature limits from being exceeded: Engine fails to light within 10 seconds of advancing power control lever to minimum idling speed. False or hung start; after lightup, engine fails to reach idling speed. Hot Start: Tt5 exceeds starting temperature limits. This condition may be preceded by a False or Hung Start.

procedure.title: Shutdown
procedure.warning: IF A FIRE OCCURS IN THE ENGINE AFTER SHUTDOWN, PERFORM A DRY MOTORING RUN IMMEDIATELY (REF. PARA. PRECEDING).
procedure.step: Allow the engine to run at idling speed for at least two minutes to stabilize at minimum running temperatures.
Move propeller control lever to FEATHER.
Move power control to fuel CUT-OFF. Note rundown time and record.
Shut off test cell fuel supply and switch off fuel supply pump.

procedure.title: Points to be Understood before Testing
procedure.step: That all operating limits in Table must be observed during all phases of the test procedure.
That test cell instrument readings must be recorded in engine test log (Ref. Fig. ).

On engines tested in a dynamometer test facility, propeller feathered is defined as 6000 Nf ± 2000, and POP maximum 50 psig. Maximum fine pitch is defined as 12500 Nf ± 500. These definitions relate only to minimum idling speed settings.

entry.note: Run down time on the compressor turbine must not be less than 20 seconds from ground idle.

procedure.title: Supplementary Test Operating Conditions (Ref. Table )
procedure.step: Fuel pressure at engine inlet of 5 to 20 psig at all times including transient.
Oil temperature for all conditions except transient is 140° to 160°F.
Scavenge oil back pressure at the engine outlet is 20 psig (minimum) to 50 psig (maximum).
Maximum permitted difference between individual inlet temperature thermocouple indications is 8°F (PT6A-38 engines) or 12°F (PT6A-41/-42 and -42A engines).

Maximum permitted difference between average Tt7 thermocouple readings between exhaust nozzle assemblies is 60°F and between thermocouples with a given nozzle is 120°F (PT6A-38 engines) or 145°F (PT6A-41/-42 and -42A engines).

Steady State stability limits:
Ng Speed± 50 rpm
100% Ng Speed= 37468 rpm
Nf Speed± 100 rpm
100% Nf Speed= 33235 rpm
δP torque± 1.5 in. Hg
In a propeller test cell: Maximum torque at IDLE is 14 in. Hg.
Maximum overall limit for vibration shall not exceed 100 "G" for operation, and 70"G" for acceptance.

procedure.title: Preliminary Checks
procedure.caution: MAKE SURE MAXIMUM OPERATING LIMITS ARE NOT EXCEEDED (REF. TABLE )
procedure.step: Feathering Operation Check (Propeller Test Stand) Start engine and run at Ground Idle, Ng=21375 ±200 rpm. Record Ng and lock lever on control console. Feather propeller, ensure that propeller control lever is positioned against feathering stop; propeller should feather immediately and steady running within four seconds. Record Ng. Unfeather propeller. If the maximum ΔNg between the feathered and unfeathered settings is within 100 rpm proceed to step If the maximum ΔNg between the feathered and unfeathered settings exceeds 100 rpm, blank the Py line at the CSU and repeat operation. If condition is still the same, replace the FCU. If Ng speed does not vary more than 100 rpm, replace the CSU.

Feathering Operation Check (Dynamometer Test Stand) Start engine and run at Ground Idle, Ng=21375 ±200 rpm and set Nf at 5000 ±2000 rpm Record Ng, Nf and POP (Propeller Oil Pressure). POP is to be 50 psig or less. Set Nf speed to maximium available and move propeller control lever against maximum Nf stop. Record Ng, Nf and POP. If the maximum ΔNg between the feathered and unfeathered settings is within 100 rpm proceed to step . If the maximum ΔNg between the feathered and unfeathered settings exceeds 100 rpm, blank the Py line at the CSU and repeat operation. If condition is still the same, replace the FCU. If Ng speed does not vary more than 100 rpm, replace the CSU.

With oil temperature controlled at 140° to 160°F, check that oil pressure is 110 to 125 psig at 27000 Ng and above (PT6A-38/-42 and -42A engines) or 100 to 135 psig (PT6A-41 engines), and not less than 60 psig at ground-idle. If necessary, adjust as follows: Shut down engine (Ref. Para. ). Drain engine oil (Ref. Disassembly). Remove oil filter cover with puller (PWC30556), remove element, and remove filter housing from air inlet case with puller (PWC30328) or (PWC50726) (Ref. Disassembly). Using compressor tool (PWC32415) or (PWC50113) inserted through inlet case aperture, remove retaining ring securing relief valve (3153) or regulating valve (3153) and separate valve from pump. Disassemble valve (Ref. 72-60-00). Add or remove adjusting spacers as required (Ref. 72-60-00). Install relief valve or regulating valve (as applicable) through aperture in air inlet case into oil pressure pump housing and, using compressor tool (PWC32415) or (PWC50113), secure with retaining ring. (Ref. Final Assembly). Install check valve assembly, oil filter element and cover (Ref. Final Assembly). Refill oil tank (Ref. Para. ). Start engine; check and record oil pressure.

procedure.title: Bleed Valve Checks
procedure.step: Set at Ground Idle 19750 to 20250 rpm Ng (PT6A-38) or 21125 to 21625 rpm Ng (PT6A-41/-42 and -42A engines) and allow speed to stabilize.
Check bleed valve operation, commencing with LP bleed valve.

Advance power control lever slowly to take-off power. By slowly retarding power control lever until temperature indication changes. Check and record Ng, Tt1, P3 and P1 (baro). Acceptable pressure ratio (P.R.) range is 3.0 to 3.5
P3 - Expressed in gauge pressure
P1 - Barometric pressure P.R. =
P3
P1 + 1
Repeat procedure for HP bleed valve, again recording Ng and Tt1. Check that valve closing point is within band indicated on (Ref. Fig. ).
The valve closing point must be within the gas generator speed (Ng) band (Ref. Fig. ) for the indicated air inlet temperature.

If closing point of either LP or HP bleed valve is incorrect, proceed as follows: Remove condi orifice to gain access to internal orifice. Orifices are numbered in 0.001 in. increments of hole size. If indications are that the closing point is too high, then a larger hole size of orifice is required (or vice versa if the pressure ratio is too low). Remove internal orifice and install replacement, selecting suitable size from drawing of LP or HP bleed valve, as applicable. Reinstall condi orifice. Start engine, and repeat steps through until valve opens and closes at correct point. Record on log sheet size of orifice removed and new one installed. It is not necessary to remove the bleed valve from the engine to remove or install the orifice. The size difference between each numbered orifice is 0.001 inch hole diameter. If indications are that the closing point is too high, then a larger hole size orifice is required or vice versa if the point is too low.

procedure.title: RGB Vibration Checks
procedure.step: Ng sweep: Set Nf to 30150 + 100/−0 rpm. Do a slow acceleration (4000 rpm/min.) from ground idle to maximum attainable Ng, do not exceed any operating limit. Monitor gage for vibration level. Do a slow deceleration (4000 rpm/min.) from maximum attainable Ng to ground idle. Record Ng, Nf, torque and vibrations at the highest vibration peak from steps and .

Nf sweep: Set Nf to 30150 + 100/−0 rpm. Increase power to a torque of 80 ± 3 in. Hg. Do a slow deceleration (4000 rpm/min.) from 30150 + 100/−0 rpm to 24500 rpm. Keep engine torque at 80 ± 3 in. Hg during deceleration. Do a slow acceleration (4000 rpm/min.) from 24500 rpm to 30150 + 100/−0 rpm. Keep engine torque at 80 ± 3 in. Hg during acceleration. Record Ng, Nf, torque and vibrations at the highest vibration peak from steps and .

Acceptance Limits: Make sure that vibration level is not more than 100"G" for test cell operation and 70"G" for engine acceptance. The engine can be acceptable to a maximum of 80"G" overall provided that a spectrum analysis is done at the highest vibration peak and that the first stage reduction content is less than 45"G", and the second stage reduction content is less than 50"G". Any vibration results above the limits must be investigated by producing a vibration spectrum plot at the highest vibration peak recorded previously. Find from the spectrum, the probable cause of the excessive vibration and rectify.

procedure.title: AGB Vibration Survey (ACES Analyzer)
procedure.note: The vibration survey requirement applies only to engines being tested following overhaul or repair requiring balancing of the compressor rotor assembly.
Accomplish vibration survey using the following procedures and the ACES Operator's Manual. The operator must be familiar with the ACES Model 1700 Analyzer prior to performing these operations.
If alternate equipment is used, make sure charge amplifier settings are correct (Ref. Para. ).
procedure.step: Install the ACES PT6 RAM procedure card 11-100-0048 in the ACES Analyzer. Select the analyzer power on, and load the procedure into the ACES Analyzer. Ensure battery charge indication is greater than 40 percent.
Select "PT6A 1ENg Survey Engine Model" from the operation options menu.
Using cursor keys, select PT6A engine model.
Select "Perform Engine Survey" from the main menu.
Perform engine start (Ref. Para. ). Allow engine to stabilize and oil temperature to reach a minimum of 51°C (125°F).
Select "Start Engine Survey" from the menu on the ACES Analyzer.
Enter the engine serial number.
Select the Vibration Sensor as a BK4505/TEC, and set the input range to 1.0.

Acceleration Survey Select "Acceleration Survey" from the menu on the ACES Analyzer. Set power control lever to LO-IDLE Set propeller control lever to 30150 rpm Nf (propeller testing), or set propeller control lever to maximum position, and adjust dynamometer controller to 30150 rpm. Ng Sweep: Press "Enter" on the ACES Analyzer to start recording. Accelerate slowly at a rate of 5000 rpm/min from LO-IDLE to max available Ng without exceeding any operating limits. Reduce to LO-IDLE. Produce a plot of 1ENg vs Ng. Vibration level must be monitored during all vibration surveys. Operating limit is 1.0 cm/sec during this sweep. Where vibration exceeds 1 cm/sec, the sweep must be terminated and the engine sent for repair.

When survey is completed, review and record peak amplitude by using the cursor keys to locate the peak To magnify or reduce vertical scale use vertical arrow keys tagged "Point." To magnify horizontal scale between point "A" and "B", select point "A" with cursor and press "MARK." Select Point "B" with cursor and press "EXP." To return to original screen, select Point "A" and press "MARK," and then select Point "B" and press "CLR." For a hard copy, press and hold the "0" key on the ACES Analyzer. The printer will copy the displayed screen. Exit to the main menu on the ACES Analyzer.

Shutdown Survey Perform steps through above Select "Shutdown Survey" from the menu on the ACES Analyzer. Press "Enter" on the ACES Analyzer to start recording. Shut down engine from idle End vibration survey after engine reaches 0 rpm and a sync error appears on the ACES Analyzer. Press "Enter" on the ACES Analyzer to stop recording. Perform step above. Exit to the main menu on the ACES Analyzer.

1 ENg Vibration Acceptance Limit: From the plots produced above, ensure that 1ENg vibration level does not exceed the following limits:
LO-IDLE to max Ng : 0.5 cm/sec
Shutdown from LO-IDLE to 5000 rpm Ng : 0.5 cm/sec

procedure.title: Acceleration and Bodie Checks
procedure.step: If engine responds sluggishly, or acceleration rate is too slow, the Ps3 and fuel system pneumatic control tubes and connectors should be checked for leakage, or obstruction, before any fuel control adjustments are made (Ref. Troubleshooting).

Position power control lever maximum stop on console to limit of 134.7 in. Hg (PT6A-38 engines) or 152.7 in. Hg (PT6A-41/-42 and -42A engines), or to maximum available torque obtainable without exceeding engine operating limits (Ref. Table ).

Reset propeller control lever to give 29000 Nf, then retard power control lever to GROUND-IDLE 19750 to 20250 rpm Ng (PT6A-38 engines) or 21125 to 21625 rpm Ng (PT6A-41/-42 and -42A engines). Maintain propeller control lever in this position throughout the acceleration and bodie checks.

Acceleration GROUND-IDLE (GI) to maximum setting: The time taken to move the power control lever in the following checks must not exceed 0.5 seconds, and the engine should respond smoothly during acceleration and deceleration. Perform one slam acceleration from GI to maximum setting followed by slam deceleration to GI. Increase power lever to 23900 to 24100 rpm Ng.

Acceleration 24000 to 35000 Ng. Perform one slam acceleration from Ng = 24000 timed to Ng = 35000 rpm. Record time, Tt1 and Ng rpm. Acceleration time must fall within range specified in Figure . Where 35000 Ng is not achieved, the required acceleration is to be reduced by 0.25 seconds per 1000 rpm below 35000 Ng.

MAXIMUM ADJUSTMENT ON FCU ACCELERATION DOME IS 3 CLICKS CLOCKWISE OR COUNTERCLOCKWISE.If necessary, adjust acceleration by rotating acceleration dome on FCU (Ref. Fig. ) one detent at a time, using the minimum number to obtain satisfactory acceleration. Rotate dome clockwise to decrease and counterclockwise to increase acceleration time.

Perform bodie checks as follows: Rotate acceleration dome on FCU three detents clockwise to increase fuel flow. Run engine for two minutes at take-off (T.O.) condition (Ref. step (2), preceding) to achieve stabilization; perform a slam deceleration to 32500 Ng, then accelerate to T.O. without dwelling at the lower speed. Reduce speed to 31500 Ng and accelerate to T.O. without dwelling. Reduce to GI. For sequential bodie checks, the dwell time at each power setting should be the minimum required for engine to stabilize. If engine is stall and surge free on completion of Bodie checks reset acceleration dome to original position (three detents counterclockwise). If stall or surge is experienced during checks, rotate acceleration dome one detent counterclockwise and repeat Bodie check. At ambient temperatures below 45°F, Bodie checks are to be made at the same setting as for acceleration. If surge is still evident, check compressor bleed valve operation. If bleed valve is functioning correctly, the dome may be reset a further two detents, a Bodie check being carried out after each detent adjustment. When surge is eliminated, reset dome three detents counterclockwise from surge-free setting. After satisfactory completion of Bodie check, following adjustment, recheck acceleration time (Ref. step preceding).

Following acceptable acceleration and Bodie checks, cut seal and lockwire on FCU acceleration dome. Hold adjusting screw with an Allen wrench, and loosen adjuster locknut. Turn dome to re-align scribe marks, then tighten locknut, wirelock and seal. Wirelock dome tab.
Reset propeller control lever stop on console to permit 30200 Nf selection.

procedure.title: Tt5 Trim Determination ("On Condition engines")
procedure.note: For engines operating on a FIXED TBO, Ref. Subpara. (Fixed TBO engines).
procedure.step: Start engine and advance power control and propeller control levers until engine is operating at 750 ± 10 SHP/DELRTH (PT6A-38 engines) or 850 ± 10 SHP/DELRTH (PT6A-41/-42 and -42A engines), or at maximum power obtainable without exceeding engine operating limits (Ref. Table ), and at an NF/RTH equal to 29360 rpm but not less than 28500 rpm minimum or above 30500 rpm maximum.

Run engine for 5 minutes at this power level to obtain stabilization. Annotate log sheet Tt5 "Trim Determination" and record the following readings:
del P
Nf
Ng
Pam
Psn
Ps3
SG
Tf
TSG
Tt1
Tt5
Tt7
Wf

Determine trim value from readings in step preceding. Process data with Program PWC83020: PT6A-38, PT6A-41 3416 engines: With results obtained in step preceding, calculate trim to suppress TT5/TH to a value of T5D/TH - 70 ± 10°F. Example:
TT5/TH trim determination at 850 SHP/DELRTH
TT5/TH untrimmed (Ref. Program output) = 1750°R
T5D/TH= 1733°R
T5D/TH - 70=1733°R = 1663°R
del T5/TH trim =1750 - 1663= 87 °F For PT6A-41 3416engines calculate trim to suppress TT5/TH to a value of T5D/TH - 115 ± 10°F. PT6A-42/-42A engines: With results obtained in step preceding, calculate trim value by suppressing TT5/TH to a value of 1680 ± 5°R at 850 SHP/DELRTH. TT5/TH trim determination at 1710°R
TT5/TH untrimmed (Ref. Program output)= 1710°R
Target TT5/TH = 1645°R
Required del T5/TH trim value= 65 °F
The following example is for engines unable to obtain rated power due to Hot Day Condition.Hot day condition equivalent temperature at Take-off rating TT5/TH trim determination:
TT5/TH untrimmed (Ref. Program output)= 1750°R
Target TT5/TH= 1680°R
Required del T5/TH trim value= 70 °F
Actual TT5/TH untrimmed (Ref. Program output) = 1720°R
Required del T5/TH trim value per above = 70 °F
Actual target TT5/TH= 1650°R
The maximum allowable adjustment is the equivalent of 125°F total trim.
If zero degree trim is required (zero trim stick) and the TT5/TH value (Ref. Program output) is lower than the minimum acceptance TT5/TH at rated power (Ref. Table ), then the following formula must be used to determine whether or not the engine is acceptable (PT6A-42 engines).
Tt5 (min) - Tt5 (act) ≤ T5D (lim) - T5D (act)
where
Tt5 (min) =Tt5/TH minimum acceptance limit at rated power (Ref. Table )
Tt5 (act) =Tt5/TH actual (Ref. program output)
T5D (lim) =T5D/TH maximum acceptance limit (Ref. Table )
T5D (act) =T5D/TH actual (Ref. program output) Record del T5 value on log sheet in °F and °C del T5/TH °C =
del T5/TH °F
1.8 total trim value for data plate. Trim value obtained in steps or preceding is for a 59°F day. To trim engine, this value should be denormalized as follows: del T5/TH x TH = del T5

Trim selection - PT6A-38 engines and PT6A-41 (3039) engines: Obtain trim harness classification to suit requirement of del T5 (Ref. Table ). Install selected trim harness (Ref. Final Assembly). Start engine (Ref. Para. ) and increase power to TAKE-OFF (Ref. step preceding). Allow readings to stabilize, then check trim reduces Tt5 by the required value. If necessary, install trim of a different class and recheck. When satisfactory trim is achieved, take full set of readings. Annotate log sheets "Tt5 (ITT) Trim Check Point - Trimmed" in remarks column. T5 Trim Harness Classification
CLASSRESISTANCE (ohms)TRIM VALUE (°F)*
5 14165
716129

2024 85

6011021
* Approximate values. Individual trim harnesses may vary.

Trim adjustment - PT6A-41 (3039) and PT6A-42/-42A engines (Ref. Fig. ): Start engine and run at TAKE-OFF (Ref. step preceding), with Tt5 trim panel switch ON and meter knob set at NORMAL. Run engine for 3 minutes minimum. Turn knob on Tt5 meter to TRIM ADJUSTMENT position and dial in required trim, as obtained in step preceding, on potentiometer. When required trim is obtained, turn knob to TRIM MEASUREMENT and record resistance (ohms). Shut down engine. 3373 Disconnect potentiometer leads A and B from engine Tt5 terminals 1 and 2. Connect leads A and B to variable trimmer leads 3 and 4 (Ref. Fig. ). Remove protective cover from engine variable trimmer (Ref. Fig. ). Turn knob to Tt5 NORMAL position and use a screwdriver to rotate trimmer adjusting screw until meter reads resistance value (ohms) recorded in step preceding. Turn knob to Tt5 REV position and record meter reading; adjust trimmer to read average of values found in steps and . Trim adjustment and resistance measurement must be performed when Tt1 is within 5°F of engine Tt1 recorded in step . 3373 Disconnect potentiometer leads A and B from engine Tt5 terminals 1 and 2. (Ref. Fig. ) Obtain trim thermocouple class corresponding to TRIM MEASUREMENT obtained in step preceding (Ref. Table ). If class is different from class installed on engine then remove installed Trim Thermocouple (Ref. Disassembly) and install new Trim Thermocouple (Ref. Final Assembly) but do not connect leads. If trim measurement value falls between classes then pick next lower class. Measure and record resistance by connecting an Ohmmeter to Trim Thermocouple terminals. Reverse Ohmmeter leads and record resistance. Readings must be taken in quick succession to keep temperature variations to a minimum. Add the two recorded resistance values together and divide by two to find average loop resistance.
Trim Thermocouple Classification (3373)

2020M min∞3 Connect trimmer leads 3 and 4 to engine terminals 1 and 2 with bolts (3114) or nuts (3114) of the correct part number. Torque chromel terminal bolt or nut 8 to 12 lb.in. (REF. NO. 1267, Fits and Clearances) and alumel terminal bolt or nut 10 to 15 lb.in. (REF. NO. 1266, Fits and Clearances). Do not reconnect potentiometer leads A and B. Start engine and run at trimmed power condition, as in step preceding, to verify correct trimmed value of TT5/TH. Take full set of readings. Annotate log sheet "Tt5 Trim Check Point - Trimmed". If using the program PWC83020, check the T5 trim box and the output screen will determine if the trim is good or not. These operations are performed after engine shutdown, during final checks. The average trim resistance (in ohms) is vibro-peened on the cover. The trimmer adjusting screw is sealed with paint, and the trimmer cover installed.

procedure.title: ITT Trim Procedure ("Fixed TBO engines")
procedure.note: Fixed TBO must be interpreted as basic, i.e. that specified in the appropriate P&WC service bulletin, unless supported by P&WC documentation granting extended TBO for engine or engine module.
procedure.step:
At trim determination, run trim point per the following rules: For engines being overhauled, trim per Para. Make sure it must not exceed 100° trim. For PT6A-42/-42A engines being repaired: If T5D actual is equal to or less than the T5D overhaul limit, then trim per Para. If T5D actual is more than the T5D overhaul limit, then add the same delta to the overhaul trim value (Ref. Para. ). Make sure it must not exceed 100° trim.
Example:
T5D O/H Limit= 1750°
T5D Actual= 1770°
Delta T5D = 20°
T5A O/H Target= 1680° ± 5°
Delta T5D= +20°
T5A Repair Target = 1700° ± 5° For PT6A-38/-41 engines being repaired, trim per Para.
Check for proper ITT trim again, when plotting full performance. Trim again if more than +5° off target.

procedure.title: Acceptance Check
procedure.caution: DO NOT EXCEED ENGINE OPERATING LIMITS (REF. TABLE ).
procedure.step: Run engine to the following torque values at an NF/RTH equal to 29360 rpm but not above 30500 rpm or below 28500 rpm. PT6A-38 Engines 750 SHP/DELRTH or maximum power obtainable. 700 SHP/DELRTH 650 SHP/DELRTH 600 SHP/DELRTH PT6A-41/-42 and -42A Engines 850 SHP/ DELRTH or maximum power obtainable. 800 SHP/DELRTH 750 SHP/DELRTH 650 SHP/DELRTH

From readings obtained in step preceding, process data with program PWC83020 and plot normalized values of Wf, Tt5, T5D and Ng against SHP on engine performance graph (Ref. Fig. ). Plot straight line across the points.
Plot normalized values of Ps3 against Ng on engine performance graph (Ref. Fig. ).

procedure.title: Acceptance Values
procedure.step: Enter graph at 750 shp (PT6A-38 engines) or 850 shp (PT6A-41/-42/-42A engines), and record SFC, Tt5, T5D and Ng for take-off power in corrected engine performance block (Ref. Fig. ) SFC = WF/DELRTH divided by SHP/DELRTH.
Record corresponding Ng value as data plate speed rpm.
Check parameters determined in step against required parameters (Ref. Table ).

Enter graph at 35000 rpm Ng and proceed horizontally to intersect Ps3 line. Move vertically upward to read Ps3. Divide Ps3 obtained by 14.696 to obtain pressure ratio and record in corrected engine performance block (Ref. Fig. ).
Stamp engine trim plate accordingly and install on lower end of engine data plate (Ref. Final Assembly).

row.entry: Max. NG/RTH rpm Repaired Gas Generator (Ref. NOTE)

entry.caution: REPAIR LIMITS SHOULD BE USED ONLY FOR ENGINES OPERATING AT FIXED TBO's AS COVERED BY APPLICABLE TBO/HSI SERVICE BULLETIN. ON CONDITION ENGINES MUST BE TESTED TO OVERHAUL LIMITS.

figure.title: Log of Engine Test - Sample Form

key.def: Reset Lever Maximum Stop (do not adjust)

procedure.title: Minimum Governing Speed
procedure.step: With propeller control lever at maximum rpm position and power control lever at GROUND IDLE, run engine and observe Ng.

With condition lever in the run position and no interference from the FLIGHT IDLE linkage, adjust the minimum governing to 19750 to 20250 rpm Ng (PT6A-38 engines) or 21125 to 21625 rpm Ng (PT6A-41/-42 and-42A engines).
Record Ng and Tt1.

procedure.title: Flight-Idle Speed (PT6A-41/-42 and -42A Engines Only)
procedure.step: With power control lever at GROUND IDLE and propeller control lever against the maximum stop, advance condition lever to the FLIGHT IDLE stop (Ref. Fig. ).
Adjust stop to obtain 26000 to 26500 rpm Ng.
Record Ng and Tt1.

procedure.title: Propeller Governor Maximum Speed (Propeller Test Only)
procedure.step: With propeller control lever in maximum rpm position, advance power control lever slowly until Nf stops increasing. Check that Nf is 30150 ± 300 rpm. For PT6A-42 (Build Specification BS991) and PT6A-42A (BS1011, BS1181 and BS1192) maximum governor speed must be checked at 500 ± 50 shp.

Should it be necessary, adjust maximum speed on propeller governor (Ref. Fig. ). Unlock and turn adjusting screw in increments of one complete turn. Turn screw counterclockwise to increase, clockwise to decrease Nf.
Repeat steps and , as necessary, until correct Nf is obtained. Nf oscillation should not exceed 100 rpm. Record Nf.

procedure.title: Propeller Governor Maximum Speed (Dynamometer Test)
procedure.note: Propeller governor maximum speed check shall be done at take-off power, 500 shp for PT6A-42 (BS991) and PT6A-42A (BS1011, BS1181 and BS1192).
procedure.step: Using the dynamometer controller, set Nf to 28,000 ± 500 rpm and the speed selector lever (SSL) to maximum.
Using the dynamometer controller, slowly increase the Nf speed until propeller oil pressure (POP) drops to 230 ± 50 psig.
Verify that Nf speed is 30,145 ± 300 rpm at take-off power.
If required, adjust maximum speed on propeller governor (Ref. Fig.). Make adjustments in increments of one complete turn. Turn screw clockwise to decrease, counterclockwise to increase.
Repeat steps and as necessary until correct Nf is obtained. Nf oscillation should not exceed 100 rpm. Record Nf.
Record final Nf, Torque, MOT, MOP and POP.

procedure.title: Overspeed Fuel Governor Interference Check (Not applicable for BS1011, BS1181 and BS1192)
procedure.step: With propeller control lever at maximum rpm position, move power control lever on console until a power level of 100 in. Hg is obtained. Observe and record Ng.

THE FUEL GOVERNOR RESET STOP MUST NOT BE ADJUSTED.Energize overspeed governor solenoid to obtain approximately 28000 to 29200 Nf in propeller test stand. For a dynamometer only reduce the Nf speed to 28000 to 29200 rpm. Record any change in Ng. If a change occurs, make sure fuel governor reset lever is locked hard against maximum stop. Should Ng increase more than 150 rpm install new governor, and repeat all governor checks. A decrease in Ng is acceptable.

procedure.title: Underspeed Fuel Governing Check
procedure.step: Disconnect and wire lock governor reset lever against its minimum stop.

Run engine, and with propeller control lever in the maximum rpm position, gradually advance power control lever to contact maximum Ng stop (Ref. Fig. ). Record Nf which should be 28250 to 28915 rpm. Adjust propeller governor underspeed eccentric adjuster (Ref. Fig. ), as necessary, in increments of 1/16 of a turn to obtain this value.
After satisfactory completion of check, unlock reset arm, move to forward position and reconnect slave tension spring.

procedure.title: Manual Override Operation (PT6A-42 only if equipped, and PT6A-42A)
procedure.caution: USE CAUTION WHEN OPERATING ENGINE WITH THE MANUAL OVERRIDE (MOR) LEVER. THE MOR LEVER MUST BE MOVED SLOWLY.
procedure.step: Remove lockwire and locking plate from MOR lever (Ref. Fig.).
Connect MOR control lever. Ensure the MOR lever is in the inactive position prior to any engine start.
Start engine and set PLA at ground idle (21125 Ng to 21625 Ng).
Slowly increase MOR to take-off power, ensure not to exceed any operating limits.
MOR stop must be adjusted to obtain 840 ± 25 shp corrected (BS992 & BS1067), or 550 ± 25 (BS991, BS1011, BS1181 and BS1192).
Record final Ng, Nf, P1, Tt1, and Torque.
Slowly decrease MOR lever to it's inactive position.
Re-install locking plate and lockwire.

procedure.title: Torque Limiter Functional Check (If Fitted)
procedure.caution: DO NOT EXCEED SPEED OR TEMPERATURE LIMITS WHEN PERFORMING THIS CHECK.
procedure.step: Re-install torque limiter Py line (Ref. Fig. )
With propeller control lever set to Max. rpm, advance power control lever to TAKE-OFF power.

Slowly retard propeller control lever until torque pressure stops increasing; this should be between 158 and 163 in. Hg PT6A-38/-41 and-42, or 97.8 to 99.8 in. Hg (565 ± 5 SHP) for BS991, BS1011, BS1181 and BS1192. Do not exceed 163 in. Hg, or maintain maximum torque condition for more than five seconds.

If torque pressure does not fall within the limits specified in step preceding, shut down engine and adjust torque limiter as follows (Ref. Fig. ): Slacken locknut on torque limiter adjuster. Turn adjusting screw using an Allen key; clockwise to increase torque and counterclockwise to decrease torque. One-half turn of the adjusting screw is equal to 5 in. Hg. (2-1/2 psig). After adjustment is completed, tighten locknut, torque 55 to 60 lb. in. and ensure adjusting screw position is unchanged. Repeat torque limiter functional check as in steps and .

procedure.title: Checks To Confirm Engine Acceptability, or Initiate Investigation Procedure
procedure.step: Run engine to obtain an oil temperature within a range of 140° to 160°F. Shut down engine and, after one minute, check oil level and record.
The difference between oil levels recorded in Paragraph , and step preceding, should not exceed 0.2 lb/hr maximum.
Inspect engine for external oil and fuel leakage. No leakage is permitted except at locations described in Table .

Check engine for internal oil leaks: Check oil level is between the maximum hot mark and not more than two inches below the maximum cold mark. Remove drin plug from the 6 o'clock position on rear face of accessory gearbox and allow oil to drain. Check oil level after minimum of two hours has elapsed. Level must be the same as recorded as in Step , drain rate from accessory gearbox drain should not exceed one drop per minute.
Remove magnetic chip detector from propeller reduction gearbox.
Examine magnetic chip detector and slave oil filter for contamination or metal particles.

procedure.title: If Test Results are Acceptable:
procedure.step: Magnetic chip detector (Ref. 72-10-00, SUB-ASSEMBLY).
Install new oil filter element in place of slave element used during test (Ref. Final Assembly).
Seal location of Tt5 trim adjustment screw (3039 and 3373) (Ref. Fig. ) with paint (PWC07-002).
Vibropeen Tt5 trim resistance value (Ref. Para. subpara. ) on variable resistor cover and install cover (3039 and 3373)

table.title: Engine Oil and Fuel Permissible Leakage

entry.note: When a specific seal leakage is not specified, the seal leakage shall not exceed 3 cc per hour per individual seal. All seal leakages shall be included in total oil consumption.

procedure.title: After Rectification for Unusual Oil Conditions (Ref. Light Overhaul, Parts A and B):
procedure.step: Ensure test cell oil system is full.
Fill engine oil tank.
Perform two motoring cycles to circulate engine oil throughout the oil system and fill propeller reduction gearbox.
Drain engine oil (Ref. Disassembly).
Repeat step , preceding.
Start engine.
Check engine for external oil leaks.
Shut down engine and rectify oil leaks.
Check tank oil level and refill if necessary.
Start engine and run at GROUND IDLE.

With oil temperature controlled at 140° to 160°F, check that oil pressure is 110 to 125 psig at 27000 Ng and above for PT6A-38/-42 and -42A engines, or 100 to 135 psig for PT6A-41 engines, and not less than 40 psig at ground idle. If necessary, adjust as follows: Shut down engine. Drain engine oil (Ref. Disassembly). Remove oil filter cover. With puller (PWC30556), remove oil filter element. With puller (PWC30328) or (PWC50726), remove oil filter housing from air inlet case (Ref. Disassembly). Using compressor tool (PWC32415) or (PWC50113) inserted through inlet case aperture, remove retaining ring securing relief valve (3153) or regulating valve (3153) and separate valve from pump. Disassemble valve (Ref. 72-60-00). Add or remove adjusting spacers as required (Ref. 72-60-00). Install relief valve or regulating valve (as applicable) through aperture in air inlet case into oil pressure pump housing and, using compressor tool (PWC32415) or (PWC50113), secure with retaining ring (Ref. Final Assembly). Install check valve assembly, oil filter element and cover (Ref. Assembly). Refill oil tank. Start engine and recheck oil pressure (Ref. steps and , preceding).
When preceding checks are satisfactory, shut down engine; remove main oil filter and chip detector, and examine for metal particle contamination.
If contamination is still evident, return engine to overhaul shop for rectification; "unusual oil conditions" (Ref. Light Overhaul).
If no evidence of metal contamination is found, return engine to service.
When engines sustain propeller shaft seizure on test using a slave propeller governor, recall governor from test cell and conduct light overhaul (Ref. 61-20-00, LIGHT OVERHAUL).

n-para.title: Preservation
n-para.para: Preserve engine in accordance with storage requirements (Ref. Storage Instructions).

procedure.title: Remove Propeller Test Stand Plumbing and Instrumentation
procedure.step: Remove propeller from engine (if applicable).
Refer to Para. preceding, for physical location of test cell connections and plumbing. Remove interconnect/drain pipes and instrumentation harnesses
Fit blanking caps/covers to open ended pipes and ports of the engine and test facility.

procedure.title: Remove Engine from Propeller Test Stand and Install in Assembly Stand
procedure.step: Attach hoist to lifting eye (PWC32117) on engine mount ring. Take up slack on hoist chain.
Unlock and remove bolts and nuts securing mount ring to test stand.
Lift engine and mount ring and install in assembly stand (Ref. Storage).
Disconnect and remove hoist and lifting eye.

procedure.title: Remove Engine from Dynamometer Stand (if applicable) and Install in Assembly Stand
procedure.step: Remove eight nuts (20, Ref. Fig. ) and bolts (21) securing coupling shaft to propeller shaft flange.
Attach hoist to lifting eye (PWC32117) on engine center mount ring. Take up slack on hoist chain.
Remove nuts (15), spacers (14) and (13), and bolts (12) securing left side and right side mounts (3) and (1) to mount ring (2).
Remove nut (7), washer (6) and bolt (11) securing bracket (5) to struts (10).
Hoist engine.
Remove three bolts (9) and washers (8) securing bracket (5) to accessory gearbox and remove bracket.
Install in assembly stand and disconnect and remove hoist.
Rotate engine to vertical position in stand with propeller reduction gearbox uppermost.
Remove 36 nuts (16) and bolts (17) in flange A and remove mount ring (2); reinstall original bolts and nuts to secure flange (Ref. 72-01-00, SUB-ASSEMBLY).

procedure.title: Removal of Dynamometer Test Accessories
procedure.step: Remove test accessories and slave equipment (Ref. Para. , preceding, for locations).
Fit blanking caps and covers to open engine accessory ports.

n-para.title: Final Check
n-para.para: Return engine to assembly bay (overhaul shop) for security check of parts and components, and check of torque values and wirelocking (Ref. Final Assembly).

n-para.title: Power Section Run-in
n-para.note: The on-wing run-in is for a power section specifically returned for unscheduled repair (LIGHT OVERHAUL), when new 3215 or 3216 sleeve bearings have been installed in first-stage planet gears, or when three or more new 3217 or 3218 sleeve bearings are installed in second-stage planet gears in propeller reduction gearbox.

procedure.title: Incremental Run-in
procedure.caution: THE FOLLOWING PROCEDURE MUST BE CONDUCTED TO THE SATISFACTION OF AN APPROVED OVERHAUL FACILITY. ON COMPLETION OF PROCEDURE, MAIN OIL FILTER MUST BE INSPECTED.
procedure.note: Power sections with 3215 or 3216 and 3217 or 3218 sleeve bearings installed, do not require run-in.
procedure.step: Conduct pre-start and engine motoring checks with propeller feathered (Ref. Airframe Manual).
Start engine with propeller feathered (Ref. Airframe Manual).
Motor engine at IDLE for 10 minutes.
AIR INLET TEMPERATURE MUST NOT EXCEED 120°F. IF NECESSARY, INCREASE Np TO MAINTAIN TEMPERATURE WITHIN LIMITS.Unfeather propeller and run engine at IDLE for 10 minutes with propeller in fine pitch.

Increase power gradually to obtain the following Np% maximum speeds in sequence. Dwell at each speed for five minutes:
Np (percent)RPM
681500

881950
912000

SPECIFIED LIMITS MUST NOT BE EXCEEDED AT ANY LEVEL. TAKE-OFF POWER MAY BE CHANGED TO SUIT AIRFRAME LIMITATIONS AND/OR AMBIENT CONDITIONS.Hold Np at 91% (2000 rpm), and increase power in increments as follows: Dwell at each power level for 10 minutes.

Shut down engine.
Inspect oil filter and chip detector for metal particles.
