general.para: Personnel preparing the power section for storage should acquaint themselves with the INTRODUCTION chapter of this manual, to familiarize themselves with general overhaul procedures (Ref. Outline of Manual Overhaul Procedures).

consumables.para: The consumable materials listed below are used in the following procedures.

procedure.title: Prepare the Power Section for Storage
procedure.step: Make sure power section is clean and dry.
Support power section in a horizontal attitude on flanges A and C, in a suitable cradle or similar structure.
Blank exhaust ports and rear end of stator housing with suitable rigid blanking pieces to ensure protection of internal parts against possible damage and the ingress of foreign objects.
Blank all accessory pads and open ports with approved-type shipping covers and caps.
Secure T5 harness to exhaust duct.
Tie four (16-unit) freshly activated bags of desiccant (PWC15-001) to assembly, two bags each side, ensuring they do not contact metallic parts of power section and thus set up corrosion.
Enclose a humidity indicator (PWC15-002) to be visible through plastic envelope.
Enclose complete power section and supporting cradle in a transparent polyethylene film envelope (0.006 inch thick).
Heat-seal edges of envelope, leaving one corner open. Evacuate as much air as possible, then seal remaining corner.
Identify assembly with part number, engine model and serial number, description and date of storage.
Store in clean, dry, enclosed area. Check humidity level weekly.

n-para.title: General
n-para.para: Light overhaul on the reduction gearbox constitutes a servicing requirement necessary to eliminate a problem, or defect, for which an engine or power section has been returned to an overhaul facility for unscheduled overhaul (Ref. 72-00-00, LIGHT OVERHAUL).

Inspection section procedures referenced in this chapter are applicable to scheduled overhaul. When used as a guide for Light Overhaul, the procedures must be evaluated by trained specialists capable of deciding whether affected parts are suitable for further service, require repair, or require replacement with new parts.
Table lists the various conditions under which a power section is eligible for unscheduled removal, together with the applicable chapter references.

table.title: Light Overhaul Reference for Unscheduled Removal - Power Section

row.entry: Propeller Shaft Oil Transfer Sleeve Binding on Shaft
Damaged Ring Gear and Second-stage Sun Gear
Loss of all Power Turbine Blades (Not associated with loss of Compressor Turbine Blades)

procedure.title: Conduct Hot Section Inspection
procedure.step: DELETED.

procedure.title: General
procedure.step: DELETED.

When overtemperature condition falls within Area C for starting conditions only or all conditions except starting or inadvertent cut-off and relight during taxi (Ref. 72-00-00, ENGINE - LIGHT OVERHAUL), proceed with inspection of power section.
Remove power section from gas generator case (Ref. 72-00-00, DISASSEMBLY).
Disassemble power section (Ref. Disassembly) and proceed with unscheduled overhaul (Ref. Table ).

procedure.title: Procedure
procedure.step: On completion of external inspection of engine (Ref. 72-00-00, LIGHT OVERHAUL), remove power section from engine and conduct inspection.
Remove power section from engine (Ref. 72-00-00, DISASSEMBLY).
Turn propeller shaft assembly by hand and listen for power turbine blade tip rub, or rough running of power section bearings (No. 3 and 4) and gearbox bearings.

Inspect through vane ring, the power turbine blade tips and shroud for cracks, evidence of rub, and disks for scoring or rubbing. If inspection is not conclusive, conduct a light overhaul inspection of these components in accordance with the appropriate chapter (Ref. Table ), including measuring and recording power turbine blade tip clearance (Ref. 72-50-03 and 72-50-04, SUB-ASSEMBLY), and compare with previous readings.

On completion of inspection, reassemble components removed (Ref. Sub-assembly). If necessary, completely disassemble the power section (Ref. Disassembly) and submit each part to light overhaul inspection (Ref. Table ).
Install power section on gas generator assembly (Ref. 72-00-00, FINAL ASSEMBLY).
Test engine (Ref. 72-00-00, TESTING).

n-para.title: Loss of all Power Turbine Blades (not associated with loss of compressor turbine blades)

procedure.title: Engines Subjected To Loss Of All Power Turbine Blades Are Rectified
procedure.step: Discard parts (Ref. 72-50-04, LIGHT OVERHAUL).
Check runout of detailed parts (Ref. 72-50-04, LIGHT OVERHAUL).
Conduct inspection of all power turbine parts (Ref. 72-50-03 and 72-50-04, LIGHT OVERHAUL).
Inspect exhaust duct (Ref. 72-50-05, LIGHT OVERHAUL).

n-para.title: Damaged Ring Gear, First and Second-stage Sun Gears or Power Turbine Shaft Coupling

procedure.title: Rectify Power Section Returned To An Overhaul Facility For Damaged Ring Gear, First Or Second-Stage Sun Gear, Or Power Turbine Shaft Coupling
procedure.step: Remove chip detector and examine for metal particles.

If metal contamination is indicated, overhaul chip detector (Ref. 72-10-00), and proceed as follows: Disassemble power section (Ref. DISASSEMBLY). Inspect first-stage sun gear and power turbine shaft coupling (Ref. 72-50-04, LIGHT OVERHAUL). Conduct inspection of gearbox parts (Ref. 72-10-00, LIGHT OVERHAUL).

title.xref: Light Overhaul Reference for Unscheduled Removal - Power Section
